story:
WE are hoping with the mulitimillion views of Autumn Rae's twiiter gone Viral...people hear/see the potential and likeableness of this pip-squeak and want to help promote,volunteer,and donate to her success!!!

Autumn Rae Shannon is a singer/songwriter/actor.

She has been in some form of entertainment business since the age of 4. Actually writing her 1st song with her daddy "Butterfly" at age 5.  With 5 more years under her belt in the studio and on stage Autumn Rae has become a prolific songwriter." I Wish I Could Fly" is her newest single to be released this year after a self funded summer release of "Back Where I Belong". It is in her heart and soul and she will keep striving toward her goal to be able to share her gifts with the world through her music!!

  • This video, and for this song especially, is so important to AR because it represents her not letting anyone or anything stop her from following her heart and doing what she feels...she was born to do. She keeps her faith and determination to succeed as a singer/songwriter. Against all the odds
  • Contributing to create this music video could really wake up the music industry people and help catapult Autumn Rae's songwriting and singing career!!!It is exactly what this child prodigy needs to prove to the world they should look past her 4 ft tall stature and her short 10 years of life...and hear her brilliantly written lyric and melodies...that are very hard to believe came from someone so young...BUT THEY DID and you helping her will help make all her life's dreams a reality!!!! She is so humble and sweet and seemingly shy...but would be your best friend and do anything for you. She wants to be a successful musician so she can help heal people through her music. Music is good for the heart and soul and AR says if she can do that she can spread Love to the world!!!

What We Need & What You Get

We feel we can start the Music Video if we can raise $5000.00 and are hoping to achieve a professional MTV quality Video. Obviously we hope people love Autumn Rae and her song and want to help her  succeed and create more music you can love, by exceeding our goal. $5000.00 would get us locations, gear rentals, great crew which is essential, hair & wardrobe, great editors and a lot of promotion for the video/song once completed.

There will be opportunity for contributors and fans like you to get some cool perks by getting involved!!! Perks from  social media shout outs, pre-release of the song and/or video, to being a featured extra, all the way to a 30 minute private concert for 20 of your closest friends at you provided venue!!!!

And, if we don't reach our entire goal we will start the project and try to get as many volunteers in areas that may not be as crucial as others. Then we may have to find funding for the promotion afterward.

The Impact

Very Talented people have lined up to help make this music video short The ,producers,directors,and some crew members that are interested in creating this video have worked on many successful projects locally and abroad. WE are excited and hoping we can raise enough to get them on the project!!

Risks & Challenges

 I don't really see any risks or hurdles to overcome in making the video for the song It will be afterwards that we will need finiancial support for sure- to market and promote the video- so we can really get it seen and heard by the people and get the numbers we need to make this a success. With the help from you contributors we really feel this is going to happen!!

 
 

If You can't contribute,  that doesn't mean You can't help:

  • You can help by sharing and  getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign.You could volunteer on set or in an online capacity..we will need lots of help in all aspects- where volunteers would save on the overall budget needed!!!
  • Remember  to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

5 of Remi's best songs re-recorded with a mini orchestra.

  • Will hire a group of talented artists to record these songs again.
  • Will use acoustic string instruments to create an orchestral version of these songs.
  • Will be recorded in a professional studio.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal.

  • I need money to pay the string trio to record the songs.
  • Also to cover the expenses of the studio we are going to use.
  • Finalize the mixes and loose ends so that the songs can be available for everyone.

The Impact

Why you should help.

  • Fuel another campaign of Remi, supporting the creativity and productivity of indie artists and local acts.
  • Participate in the making of 5 great songs that have been greatly acclaimed.
  • Enjoy new and great music.

Risks & Challenges

For those of you who know me and those who yet don't.

  • You know i will see this project through no matter what.
  • With your help i can raise the quality of the result.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel like pledging your money, you can always:

  • Spread the word like crazy.
  • Think again about donating.

And that's all there is to it.

Remi & the road.

story:
Hi everyone! 

It's been 4 years since I released my first album Little Bird and I am so excited to finally record and share a new 4 song EP titled Inside. 

My first album was recorded in my home in 2011 and was funded entirely by a Kickstarter Campaign- thank you to my wonderful backers! This was the result of many years of songwriting following the death of my brother in 2003. Little Bird was a collection of many sad songs that are very near and dear to my heart and after releasing them into the world I was able to move into a new space that has now had time to formulate into a new set of songs that are quite different for me. I am hoping to pre-sell this EP in order to be able to make it. Be sure to check the perk options for extra goodies. 


My Goal

My goal of $3000 will go towards the following:

-Recording, mixing, and mastering

-Photos for promotion & my Indiegogo Video

-CD Production & Design

-Paying my most excellent musicians

How You Can Help

-Sharing my Indiegogo campaign on Facebook with your friends and family. The more people we reach the more successful this will be!

-You can like my Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/Josie-Overmyer-129331433816175/?ref=aymt_homepage_panel

-You can Subscribe to my Youtube Channel   https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCeFrVTB0In3TtKy5DVuKbCA

-You can also check out my videos on Youtube and share them with your social media sites.


Thank you all so so much for checking this out! I am really very excited to share more music and hope you all enjoy.


With love,

Josie

story:
Project:

KEEP LIVE JAZZ IN HARLEM – SAVE CASSANDRA’S JAZZ!

Goal:  $95,000

Cassandra’s JAZZ Club & Gallery’s primary Mission is to:  KEEP “REAL” JAZZ ALIVE IN HARLEM, correcting the ongoing misrepresentation and misconception of Jazz, protect its legacy and preserve the historical significance of Jazz and its relationship to Harlem -- the hallowed grounds of Jazz.   This is the vision and long  dream of two of millions of people: Dr. Dwight Dickerson, and wife Cassandra.  Through persistence, preservation and sheer determination, Dr. Dwight -- “Doc” -- and Cassandra have made their DREAM A REALITY - this is their story!  

A Bit About the Campaigners:

  • Dr. L. Dwight Dickerson is a professor of music (Ph.D., UCLA, 1998) and a life-long, self-appointed “Ambassador of Jazz."  Doc has dedicated his life to teaching, playing and promoting JAZZ – real Jazz and its history – around the world.  He is a passionate, internationally known, Master Jazz pianist, bandleader and composer, with over 60 years of professional performance experience with “Jazz Giants” worldwide.   As a professor, Dr. Dwight most recently taught at the American University of Sharjah (Dubai) where he designed and implemented the first music curriculum on the university level in the Middle East. 
  • Cassandra Storey-Dickerson – After whom the Club was named – is a Legal professional, administrator and promoter. In 2003, while living abroad for 13 years, started “Divas Abroad",  where she managed, promoted and booked American women Jazz singers in upscale venues throughout Asia and the Middle East. She was a co-producer of “SummerStage Dubai” (2005-2009)  and also planned, promoted and implemented the only successful Jazz Supper Club -- complete with the introduction of Western “soul food” -- to the Middle Eastern culture. 

Overview

After an arduous and exasperating year spent negotiating the rigors of the New York State liquor licensing process, and many exhausting negotiations on the exorbitant and prohibitive pricing of New York real estate, in late summer 2015, the courageous couple “softly” opened Cassandra’s Jazz Club & Gallery! The mission was accomplished; the vision fulfilled. Cassandra and Doc repatriated back to New York after living abroad for 13 years, armed with their Faith, Doc’s own Fazioli Grand Piano and the couple’s life savings!  

In 2013, they commenced to find, recreate and open CASSANDRA’S JAZZ CLUB & GALLERY, literally in the heart of the “Hallowed Grounds” of Jazz in Harlem.  Before becoming Cassandra’s, the venue was a dark, fearful and violent place that stigmatized and embarrassed the Community, ultimately  resulting in the loss of a young man’s life in 2014. Today, it is a beautiful, art-filled, culturally rich, proud and happy place  where “real”,  live,  straight-ahead JAZZ emanates from the bandstand, throughout the brick walls lined with portraits of the “Jazz Legends” – past and present.  As many local and international “Jazz Lovers” have exclaimed, Cassandra’s is currently the most elegant venue Uptown, delivering the best live, authentic Jazz – the quintessential American art form – that Harlem has witnessed since the “Swing Era”!

But, unfortunately, due to the extraordinarily high rents in the newly “gentrified” Harlem, social engineering and corporate greed - $8,000 per month for Cassandra’s –Cassandra’s JAZZ Club & Gallery is in IMMINENT DANGER OF CLOSING!  Cassandra’s is now on the same course that has led most of the legendary jazz clubs of Harlem down the path of imminent doom – Lenox Lounge, Small’s Paradise, Count Basie’s, Wells, on & on.  Due to the high rents, Cassandra’s is on the brink of closing only six months after its “soft” opening, even before the Jazz community has  discovered Cassandra’s existence!

A Bit About The Venue

Transforming the old  venue (formerly known as “PJ’s”)  from a “dive bar” with a long history of criminal acts -- one  resulting in tragic death in January 2014 (referenced above) -- to Cassandra’s Jazz – a place where  people in the Community are not afraid to enter or gather, was in itself no easy or inexpensive task.  Pictures of the old “PJ’s” BEFORE Cassandra’s are attached.

“Since 2010, PJ’s Cocktail Lounge and Restaurant had been the scene of four separate shootings, a stabbing, an assault, a gunpoint robbery and an attack on two police officers, according to NYPD records…. The fourth shooting took place Jan. 8, 2013 when a 33-year-old patron was tragically gunned down, losing his life.  In late January 2014, the premises were ordered shuttered by the Manhattan Supreme Court – for the third time since 2009.

A Bit about the Landlord

The Landlord’s premature and precipitous push to take back Cassandra’s Jazz, considering its contribution to the community and increase in the property value for the Landlord, is untimely and suspect. 

·  In the beginning of the long-negotiated venture, the Landlord, and as new owners of multiple buildings in Harlem, first presented itself as a supporter of Jazz.  The concept and possibilities of a high-end, law-abiding Jazz club,  as a step in erasing the dark stigma and negative repute of the old  "PJ's", appeared  timely and financially appealing, especially, when the "Landlord does no work" clause was firmly embedded in the Lease.  Cassandra's was renovated from bottom to top with Doc and Cassandra's own life savings.  The rental payments began in January.  

·  The Landlord gave three months rent concessions; however, Cassandra's was barred by law to open and operate without the SLA liquor license approval, which did not come until six months' later, or, June 2015.  

·  Further, there was  a month's delay due to heating failure, which took the full month of February - the coldest month of last year - to repair so the hourly paid contractors could resume work. 

·  With no income to pay exorbitant $7800 per month rental,  together with the multiples of other expenditures of  required for a start-up business, has led to an exhaustion of their funds.  Thus, unfortunately, Cassandra's fell into arrears.

·  It has now come to the attention of Doc and Cassandra that the Landlord's suspicious and sudden push to regain control and possession of Cassandra's,  that a broker of an anonymous mega foreign corporation -- with unlimited funds -- has tremendous interest in acquiring the space Cassandra's has now unilaterally renovated and now occupies.

·  This is occurring after only six months – and during the period when Cassandra’s is beginning to make the turn toward sustainability.

· This is also indicative of what is currently happening in Harlem, in New York City, in Washington, DC and in many major cities across the US. 

· Inasmuch as Music – Jazz  – is the ultimate cultural unifier, it is not the diversity of people of Harlem seeking better lives, it is the take-over of the faceless, multi-national and foreign corporations, politicians, laws and lawyers and that aid the Landlords for their own self-serving greed that reeks havoc among communities by jacking up rents to usurious  unaffordable prices that has driven multiple generations of Harlemites from their homestead.   

· Clearly, It’s all about money!  It is money and the greed has driven many small businesses – especially music venues – and mostly uptown Jazz clubs -- into shutdown.  Most recently, the Lenox Lounge, which rents were tripled by its Landlord resulting in subsequent long-fought court battles and, ultimately, destruction.  Now, historically, it is now one more statistic in many historic Harlem Jazz clubs… gone by the wayside.

 · Since Cassandra’s  only defense is to pay the arrearages eliminating the Landlord’s only reason to evict Cassandra’s from the premises that houses it. Doc and Cassandra cannot do it alone, which is why they are asking you to step in and stand with them! 

· This Campaign is a grassroots effort of compassion and love for the music -- a small step toward saving  the culture, the history and the legends of Jazz.  The politicians and banks won't help except to lead us down the same path as the other legendary Jazz clubs mentioned above.  Only WE can do this -- WE MUST KEEP CASSANDRA’S JAZZ open!

· As professionals and business people, Cassandra and Dr. Dwight understand that the “rent must be paid”; but, for right now, our sword in this battle is money -- and we are losing the battle.  

· Regardless of the Landlord's motivation, the laws are on its side.  Therefore, to allow Cassandra's to not only “Keep real Jazz Alive in Harlem - “Save Cassandra’s Jazz”, but also advance their vision beyond Harlem and  Cassandra's, Cassandra's must pay the money -- and it needs your help!

Together – Lovers of Jazz and music in general world-wide, historians, musicians, community activists, etc. -- with small, large or ANY contribution to this Campaign – you can help Doc and Cassandra – with whatever your finances will allow – to not only “Keep real Jazz Alive in Harlem - “Save Cassandra’s Jazz” but also to advance their vision to “Keep real Jazz Alive" worldwide.

Cassandra's JAZZ Deserves To Be Harlem

The transformation of Cassandra’s from a dark and violent place to a place presenting “culture, class and cool JAZZ,” this process  deserves some concessions… and more time for many reasons, but especially since:

(a)  Cassandra’s has all but erased the fearful and painful imagery of the old PJ’s, and replaced it with a social outlet in which patrons can feel proud,  and safely enjoy world-class Jazz. 

(b)  Cassandra’s is contributing both culturally and scholastically to the Community by raising the standards of the music  – the ultimate unifier of all cultures.

(c)  New “young, up and coming” residents of the Harlem Community of all races and demographics  are now coming in for the first time.  “Old-timers” of Harlem Jazz thrilled to have a place to go as they had  "back in the day!"   As the word spreads of Cassandra’s existence – as if they’ve discovered an “oasis in the desert”, people are coming!  

(d)  Since Cassandra’s in the only “jazz club” providing real “live” Jazz six nights a week – Doc and Cassandra are  lauded  with praises and thank you’s NIGHTLY for making Cassandra’s Jazz happen in their Community!

 THE PLAN

Doc and Cassandra have not only  "come this far by Faith," and belief in the Music – the ultimate unifier – but also through a well thought-out 10-year plan.  

The Plan is simple: To STAY and continue to provide the Jazz community with the highest quality of Jazz, performed by world class Jazz Legends at discounted prices. 

During their quest to find a home for Cassandra’s, the couple was advised by numerous financial “experts” that opening a Jazz club in Central Harlem would cost well over $1M.  Doc and Cassandra defied that logic by diligently and determinedly finding the venue, restoring and opening it with a budget of under $400,000 – their own money, their life’s savings!  But now – TO STAY and GROW – Cassandra’s needs help.  It needs a “one shot” cash infusion of $95,000 to “keep the dream alive” and “keep the music playing!

The monies raised will be used to:

(a)    Add signage and electrical access to the front exterior;

(b)   Add plumbing for running water to the food service area (kitchen) to increase sales;

(c)   Hire and train staff; and, most importantly,

(d)   Cure rental arrearages to put Cassandra's JAZZ on a level playing field.


FUTURE PROJECTIONS

Even in its short existence, based on the standards of Jazz being presented at Cassandra’s, not only is the local community discovering the “oasis” within it, but also through social and print media, tourist advertising,  as well as the never-failing “word of mouth”.   Cassandra’s is now being compared with the “Top 5” New York Jazz Clubs  and “buzzed” about on the international Jazz circuit as the new “go to” place for Jazz in NYC!

· Cassandra’s  has attracted the attention of many reputable Jazz organizations, such as the Wilbur Ware Institute.(Fundraiser, November 13-15, 2015); Jazz Foundation of America, and many other institutions supporting Jazz.

· World class Jazz artists  such as Ron Carter, Louis Hayes, Patience Higgins, Geri Allen, James Carter, Michael Carvin, Eddie Henderson, Gary Bartz – to name a few -- have either visited, performed or scheduled upcoming performances at Cassandra’s. 

· Future income projections, by certified accountants,  range from $$15,000 - $20,000 per month – to pay the $8k monthly rent, musicians, staff and expenses.  This will be achieved by presenting two to three Major Jazz Headliners  per month -- the likes of Eddie Henderson coming  or Gary Biarritz - together with a nightly line-up of local Live Jazz bands and cultural presentations,  pulled from the vast pool of talented, and skilled musicians in the New York area.

************************

This is only the beginning for Cassandra’s JAZZ!  Upon moving past this  impasse’, the future projections are bright and bountiful.  Cassandra’s will not only enhance the economic viability of the Community by creating job opportunities for musicians and others alike, but also aid in returning Harlem to its rightful and proud place as one of the Jazz Capitals of the World.  

Help Us “Keep The Music Playing”

As Jazz afficiados, musicians, historians, Harlemites,  and Jazz Lovers across the globe, we cannot allow this to happen!  We must stand together to protect jazz – its history and its Legends -- in Harlem and worldwide.  

We appreciate and accept any and all pledges from $10 to $10M!  Select the "Perk" or add any amount you can afford that will help us "keep the music playing" at Cassandra's JAZZ!

YES WE CAN – AND YES WE WILL -- "KEEP "real" JAZZ ALIVE IN HARLEM! --YES WE CAN -- AND YES WE WILL -- SAVE CASSANDRA’S JAZZ"!

supporter of Jazz.  The concept and
possibilities of a high-end, law-abiding Jazz club,  as a step in erasing the dark stigma and
negative repute of the old  "PJ's", appeared  timely
and financially appealing, especially, when the "Landlord does
no work" clause was firmly embedded in the Lease.  Cassandra's was
renovated from bottom to top with Doc and Cassandra's own life savings.  The
rental payments began in January.  
·  The Landlord gave three months rent concessions; however,
Cassandra's was barred by law to open and operate without the SLA liquor
license approval, which did not come until six months' later, or, June 2015.
 
·  Further, there was  a month's delay due to heating failure,
which took the full month of February - the coldest month of last year - to
repair so the hourly paid contractors could resume work. 
·  With no income to pay exorbitant $7800 per month rental,  together with the multiples of other
expenditures of  required for a start-up business, has led to an
exhaustion of their funds.  Thus, unfortunately, Cassandra's fell into
arrears.
·  It has now come to the attention of Doc and Cassandra that the
Landlord's suspicious and sudden push to regain control and possession of
Cassandra's,  that a broker of an
anonymous mega foreign corporation -- with unlimited funds -- has tremendous
interest in acquiring the space Cassandra's has now unilaterally renovated and now
occupies.
·  This is occurring after only six months – and during the period
when Cassandra’s is beginning to make the turn toward sustainability.
· This is also indicative of what is currently
happening in Harlem, in New York City, in Washington, DC and in many major cities
across the US.  
· Inasmuch as Music – Jazz  – is the
ultimate cultural unifier, it is not the diversity of people of Harlem seeking
better lives, it is the take-over of the faceless, multi-national and foreign
corporations, politicians, laws and lawyers and that aid the Landlords for
their own self-serving greed that reeks havoc among communities by jacking up rents to usurious  unaffordable prices that has driven multiple generations of Harlemites from their homestead.   · Clearly,
It’s all about money!  It is money and
the greed has driven many small businesses – especially music venues – and
mostly uptown Jazz clubs -- into shutdown. 
Most recently, the Lenox Lounge, which rents were tripled by its
Landlord resulting in subsequent long-fought court battles and, ultimately, destruction.  Now, historically, it is now one more
statistic in many historic Harlem Jazz clubs… gone by the wayside.
 · Since Cassandra’s  only defense is to pay the arrearages eliminating the Landlord’s only reason to evict Cassandra’s from the premises that houses it.
Doc and Cassandra cannot do it alone, which is why they are asking you to step
in and stand with them!  · This Campaign is a grassroots effort of compassion and love for the music -- a small step toward saving  the culture, the history and the legends of Jazz.  The politicians and banks won't help except to lead us down the same path as the other legendary Jazz clubs mentioned above.  Only WE can do this -- WE MUST KEEP CASSANDRA’S JAZZ open!· As professionals and business people, Cassandra and Dr. Dwight understand that the “rent must be paid”; but, for right now, our sword in this battle is money -- and we are losing the battle.  · Regardless of the Landlord's motivation, the laws are on its side.  Therefore, to allow Cassandra's to not only “Keep real Jazz Alive in Harlem - “Save Cassandra’s Jazz”, but also advance their vision beyond Harlem and  Cassandra's, Cassandra's must pay the money -- and it needs your help!
Together – Lovers of Jazz and music in
general world-wide, historians, musicians, community activists, etc. -- with
small, large or ANY contribution to this Campaign – you can help Doc and
Cassandra – with whatever your finances will allow – to not only “Keep real Jazz Alive in Harlem - “Save Cassandra’s Jazz” but also to advance their vision to “Keep real Jazz Alive" worldwide.
Cassandra's JAZZ Deserves To Be HarlemThe transformation of Cassandra’s from a dark and
violent place to a place presenting “culture, class and cool JAZZ,” this
process  deserves some concessions… and
more time for many reasons, but especially since:
(a)  Cassandra’s has all but erased the fearful and painful imagery
of the old PJ’s, and replaced it with a social outlet in which patrons can feel proud,  and
safely enjoy world-class Jazz.  

(b)  Cassandra’s
is 
contributing both culturally and scholastically to the Community by raising the standards of the music  – the ultimate unifier of all cultures. 

(c)  New “young,
up and coming” residents of the Harlem Community of all races and demographics  are now coming in for the first time.  “Old-timers” of Harlem Jazz thrilled to have a place to
go as they had  "back in the day!"   As the
word spreads of Cassandra’s existence – as if they’ve discovered an “oasis in
the desert”, people are coming!  (d)  Since Cassandra’s in the only “jazz club” providing real “live” Jazz six nights a
week – Doc and Cassandra are  lauded  with
praises and thank you’s NIGHTLY for making Cassandra’s Jazz happen in their
Community!
 THE PLAN

Doc and Cassandra have not
only  "come this far by Faith," and belief in the Music – the ultimate unifier –
but also through a well thought-out 10-year plan.  The Plan is simple: To STAY and continue to provide the Jazz community with the highest quality of Jazz, performed by world class Jazz Legends at discounted prices. During their quest to find a home for
Cassandra’s, the couple was advised by numerous financial “experts” that
opening a Jazz club in Central Harlem would cost well over $1M.  Doc and Cassandra defied that logic by
diligently and determinedly finding the venue, restoring and opening it with a
budget of under $400,000 – their own money, their life’s savings!  But now – TO STAY and GROW – Cassandra’s needs
help.  It needs a “one shot” cash
infusion of $95,000 to “keep the dream alive” and “keep the music playing!

The monies raised will
be used to:(a) 
  Add signage and
electrical access to the front exterior;(b) 
 Add plumbing for running water to the food
service area (kitchen) to increase sales;
(c) 
 Hire and train staff; and, most importantly,
(d) 
 Cure rental arrearages to put Cassandra's JAZZ on a level playing field.FUTURE PROJECTIONSEven in its short existence, based on the standards of Jazz being presented at Cassandra’s, not only is the local community discovering the “oasis” within it, but also through social and print media, tourist advertising,  as well as the never-failing “word of mouth”.   Cassandra’s is now being compared with the “Top 5” New York Jazz Clubs  and “buzzed” about on the international Jazz circuit as the new “go to” place for Jazz in NYC!· Cassandra’s  has attracted the attention of many reputable Jazz organizations, such as the Wilbur Ware Institute.(Fundraiser, November 13-15, 2015); Jazz Foundation of America, and many other institutions supporting Jazz.· World class Jazz artists  such as Ron Carter, Louis Hayes, Patience Higgins, Geri Allen, James Carter, Michael Carvin, Eddie Henderson, Gary Bartz – to name a few -- have either visited, performed or scheduled upcoming performances at Cassandra’s. · Future income projections, by certified accountants,  range from $$15,000 - $20,000 per month – to pay the $8k monthly rent, musicians, staff and expenses.  This will be achieved by presenting two to three Major Jazz Headliners  per month -- the likes of Eddie Henderson coming  or Gary Biarritz - together with a nightly line-up of local Live Jazz bands and cultural presentations,  pulled from the vast pool of talented, and skilled musicians in the New York area.************************This is only the beginning for Cassandra’s JAZZ!  Upon moving past this  impasse’, the future projections are bright and bountiful.  Cassandra’s will not only enhance the economic viability of the Community by creating job opportunities for musicians and others alike, but also aid in returning Harlem to its rightful and proud place as one of the Jazz Capitals of the World.  Help Us “Keep The Music Playing”As Jazz afficiados, musicians, historians, Harlemites,  and Jazz Lovers across the globe, we cannot allow this to happen!  We must stand together to protect jazz – its history and its Legends -- in Harlem and worldwide.  We appreciate and accept any and all pledges from $10 to $10M!  Select the "Perk" or add any amount you can afford that will help us "keep the music playing" at Cassandra's JAZZ!YES WE
CAN – AND YES WE WILL -- "KEEP "real" JAZZ ALIVE IN HARLEM! --YES WE CAN -- AND YES WE WILL -- SAVE CASSANDRA’S JAZZ"!

story:
Hi I'm Tim Hegarty and so many times I hear an ad when I am driving and think "Oh I want that" but I can't stop my car and get out my mobile to make a note of the offer I just heard.

What if I could just "Bagzit" I thought? (To "Bagz" something is to claim it first) What if my mobile picked up the advert for that Kate Bush show that I wanted to see and put it an alert on my mobile so that I could buy the ticket when I got home?
Well that's where the idea came from. 
And then - What if there was a radio station that played great original music but which could connect 360 with the listener?
A radio station that allowed for a personalised and relevant connection between the sponsor and the listener?
A Radio station that was the world's first by connecting the song directly to the user's mobile on demand?
Well I have done it with BagzitRadio.com.
I have now developed the Beta version App for iPhone and it works beautifully. I have had discussions with the two biggest record companies in the world, three of the biggest retailers in the UK, and four major advertising agencies. They love it.  The record companies love the idea that any song ever recorded (or played live) could connect with fans, retailers could give special offers to their customers whilst listening to their advert or even better when they are playing music in-store, and agencies can create a multitude of exciting, experiential adverts that connect 360 with the user. The list is endless.
How do we do this? We put inaudible digital codes into the advert. We play the advert on BagzitRadio.com. Our Bagzit app is the decoder part and when it "hears" the code it allows for the mobile device to receive the info / offer / coupon / ticket. 
The fact that the user has logged in via social media platforms means that someone who is bald is not going to get a shampoo offer - just kidding, but you get my drift.
So I need to take this up to the next level and that's where I need your help.
There is the Android version to be developed, which is not a big task, but more importantly we need sales and marketing people to get this product to market and quickly.
My background is as a serial entrepreneur and ideas person and having set up successful businesses in the past, including property and recruitment companies, I realise that once you have a good idea you have to tell the world about it. Oh yes, I also wrote songs for Gloria Gaynor in the US and had a Top Ten Hit in the United Kingdom for D:Ream, but hey that's another story.
We have spent $64,000 (£45K) getting the product to the level it is now and $20,000 would enable this product to be finished and delivered to the world.
The breakdown is as follows;
$15,000 to hire top sales reps and marketing people - contract only.
£5,000 to develop out the final ideas for the App including the Android version.
Now being a lover of music  - I also have my own music sync company www.syncnys.com - and a music publisher I have always championed new music from whatever genre. I know how the world of music rights works and how (little) performers get back from their songs being played - in the USA they get $0 yes that's right ZERO from their songs being played on the radio!
So here's the deal. I'm going to share any income from advertisers directly with the rights holders of the songs played on the BagzitRadio.com. That will be a straightforward split on the amount of times your song is aired. Simple.
All I can offer by way of a perk is that if you are a songwriter or band then if you subscribe and make this idea BIG then your song will be uploaded onto www.bagzitradio.com and put on rotation - FOREVER.  (NOTE: we are licensed with the relevant royalty licensing agencies so everyone gets paid). If you are a fan of a band then you can put their song up instead. It is a way to show your support for that band too and get their music out there. We will be developing certain genres that are played at certain times of the day and your song will be part of that particular show. Obviously if this idea gets stupidly big then we will look at developing out particular stations that cater for each type of genre bagitradio/rock or bagzitradio/pop for example.
However if you are one of the original funders then your song will be rotated FOREVER. 
All we ask is that the song is recorded to broadcast quality - remember you want folks to hear the best - and delivered by MP3
If we don't get our total goal then we are still broadcasting but we want to create a community here and those that are with us at the start then we will be with them for all time. 
If you aren't a singer / songwriter / band but just love the idea then please FB, tweet or poke or whatever you can do to spread the word and maybe someone who submits a song will be the person whose song gets covered or released big time and you can say you played your part in that.
What else is out there? Well you have Spotify and Pandora but those guys pay a pittance to the songwriters and maybe Adele and Taylor Swift have had too much publicity already so lets keep this for all you out there who aren't multi million dollar stars OK?
Love ya, Tim

story:
My name is CW Allen and I'm a Hip Hop artist based out of Chicago,IL. Those who know me know I love God, my wife, making music and cartoons. Recently I began a new project where I combined to of those loves, and I wanted to see if I could get your helping to finish it?

Heroes Never Die

Some people become famous or make six-figures, others never see life outside of minimum wages or constant turmoil. Regardless of where people may find themselves in life, they have a unique ability, the ability to be someone’s Hero. Everyone loves watching a good hero's story unfold, the trials, the failures, and ultimately the victory that seemed impossible to reach. Although though these heroes will eventually die their legacies will live on... 

HND is a collection of music I teamed up with Grammy award winning producer Alex "Big Juice" Hitchens to create. Juice has produced some of our favorite songs for artist such as Lecrae, This'l, MC Jin, and many more. He was also the producer the music for Kobe Bryant and Lebron Jame's latest Nike commercials.  The Idea was to infuse my love for superheroes and Hip Hop and create an epic story. Along with this collection of music, I began drawing a graphic novel that I hope to release in the near future. 

What We Need & What You Get

My team and I need: 

    • Composition/Beats($2,000>>potentially open ended)
    • Mixing & Mastering ($900)
    • Recording ($540)
    • Graphic Design($900)
    • Touring ($1,500)
    • Marketing(Open ended)
    • Indiegogo gifts 
If you finically support us we will give you a gift! See the list on the side of our campaign and determine will you be a hero and join us in this new mission? 

The Impact

I make music because I love people and I love seeing them become who they were made to be. I believe that music has an amazing place in that journey. I grew up as a advent Hip Hop listener. Hip Hop taught me how I should dress, how I should act, and how I should speak. The influence of my music and my culture on me were remarkable. Now a days I reflect on those days and wonder how amazing it would be to use my own music to encourage others as they do amazing things on their journey.  

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean your not apart of this family:

Please let people now about what i'm doing  through word of mouth and social media outlets. Your efforts are greatly appreciated and will aid in empowering this movement. 

Peace,

CW Allen

www.cwallenmuzik.com

story:
If you don't think Beethoven and Brahms are hilarious, you haven't experienced the Mozart Musical Workout! 

 

HELLO AND WELCOME! You are enthusiastically invited to support the shooting and editing of the Mozart Musical Workout, a series of exercise videos that work out the whole body and foster a love for classical music at the same time. Adding exhilarating fun to any elementary school classroom, the movements are humorous, stimulating and  exhausting -- perfect for a 3-minute movement break in the general classroom and as an entertaining exploration of classical pieces in the music classroom.

We have planned 10 videos that focus on grades 1 through 6 and can also be enjoyed by people of all ages. Each segment includes carefully choreographed patterns of movement that emerge from the core essence of the music. The students develop a connection and sensitivity to the music, while developing critical listening skills. STUDENTS WILL LAUGH AND GIGGLE with Mozart and Tchaikovsky, then take away a deeper understanding of each piece, no longer a bunch of random sounds. With repetition and follow-up lessons, students develop the ability to differentiate emotional and musical characteristics within each piece, such as dynamics, sequence, key changes, patterns, structure, melodic and rhythmic contours, and the spirit of the music -- all embodied through rigorous, funny, kinesthetic engagement.

JOIN US. BRING CLASSICAL MUSIC TO LIFE FOR A NEW GENERATION,

AND GET THEM IN SHAPE!

 

The Mozart Musical Workout comes with

• the workout!

• tutoring videos that teach the workout movements

• lesson ideas for each piece of music plus information about the composers and their place in history and geography.

Besides functioning as a powerful educational tool in the music classroom, the series is also great for movement breaks during a day of rigorous instruction!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds we raise will pay for producing, shooting, and editing the videos for 10 pieces of music. This includes casting, rehearsing, rental of equipment, green screen special effects, sound studio rental, costume design, post production editing, and obtaining rights to use each piece.

In addition, personal appearances and hands on workshops promoting the video will be utilized for marketing.

Your contribution will enable children all over the world to jump and twirl to Mozart and Brahms, kick, shake, hop and zombie-out to Beethoven. [The gift of joy is priceless. ]

The Impact

It is wonderful to see children laugh and smile while learning about classical music. Your contribution will enable our project to spread around the world. While others have created expressive movements as part of an early childhood music program, no other program that we know hits the whole-body funny bone with exhilarating  and exhausting movements for ages 6 - 12,. As an added benefit, adults love it too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course we need money. We also ask that you spread the word. Tell your friends through social media, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and any other tools you have available to you to support us. The more buzz you create, the more money we get and the better our final project will be. Send your friends to this campaign and ask them to visit mozartmusicalworkout.com.

 

THE MMW TEAM:

Evan Alboum, Artistic Director

After attending Oberlin College and Conservatory of Music where he was first introduced to Dalcroze Eurhythmics, Evan Alboum became a professional movement artist, specializing in physical comedy with classical music. He then became an actor appearing in musical theater, commercials, Shakespeare and contemporary plays. He has since taught in public schools on both coasts as a classroom music teacher and as a teaching artist designing residencies to  teach children how to listen to and love classical music.

 

Keith Stern, Chief Technical Officer

Keith has played a role in promoting 23 major motion pictures with directors such as Peter Jackson, Bill Condon, Ron Howard and Steven Spielberg. He has worked with a variety of people to maintain their presence on social media such as twitter, Instagram and Facebook. His clients have included Ian McKellen and Lynn Redgrave. He developed a philosophy of working on an effective way to achieve the visions and ambitions of his client, rather than creating flashy websites that look cool, but do not necessarily achieve the desired goals. He also enjoys working on no budget projects and to that end we are thrilled to have him on board!

 

Lucas Krauss, videographer

Lucas Krauss is a twenty-four year old videographer and teacher from Vermont. As a young person growing up in rural Vermont Krauss, he cultivated a powerful imagination and put it to use making parody music videos, dramatic shorts and documentaries. Since then he has traveled to over 25 countries including Peru, New Zealand, Botswana and Vietnam, documenting his travels with extensive videos using a range of cameras including film, digital and drones.

He has since taught in public schools on both coasts as a classroom music teacher and as a teaching artist designing residencies to  teach children how to listen to and love classical music.
 
Keith Stern, Chief Technical Officer
Keith has played a role in promoting 23 major motion pictures with directors such as Peter Jackson, Bill Condon, Ron Howard and Steven Spielberg. He has worked with a variety of people to maintain their presence on social media such as twitter, Instagram and Facebook. His clients have included Ian McKellen and Lynn Redgrave. He developed a philosophy of working on an effective way to achieve the visions and ambitions of his client, rather than creating flashy websites that look cool, but do not necessarily achieve the desired goals. He also enjoys working on no budget projects and to that end we are thrilled to have him on board!
 
Lucas Krauss, videographer
Lucas Krauss is a twenty-four year old videographer and teacher from Vermont. As a young person growing up in rural Vermont Krauss, he cultivated a powerful imagination and put it to use making parody music videos, dramatic shorts and documentaries. Since then he has traveled to over 25 countries including Peru, New Zealand, Botswana and Vietnam, documenting his travels with extensive videos using a range of cameras including film, digital and drones.

story:
Clint Alphin

I moved to Nashville, TN from North Carolina in 2003 to finish an internship for a degree from Appalachian State University and pursue a career as a songwriter and performing artist. In the past 15 years, I've released three independently produced albums and gained recognition from several different prominent songwriter and artist contests, most notably as the winner of the 2017 Telluride Troubadour contest at the Telluride Bluegrass Festival. In the pursuit of my music, like plenty of other people, I've held several day jobs to support my art, including loading trucks for FedEx, tuning snow skis, working at music stores, and around 10 years of substitute teaching and part-time teaching in public schools. I took a break from teaching a little over two years ago to pursue music full-time, and I've been fortunate to see increased musical success since then.  

The Goal

As I've worked and learned the process of making records, I've learned it's a lot like any project in a conventional business - finding and hiring the right people is crucial. I've learned from several of my friends who have been finding success as full-time independently touring musicians that using professional PR can make a huge difference in reaching new fans and booking festivals and venues that have good reputations and pay well. I've found a PR firm in Nashville that I think is a good fit for me, and I'm excited about working with them for this new album release.  

Professional promotions can cost almost as much as recording and producing the album, so I'm asking for some funding help, like many of my other musician friends have. This is not an easy thing for me to do, and it's a scary amount of money for me to ask for as well. But Indiegogo lets me keep whatever I raise, so you can be sure that whether I reach or surpass the $10,000 goal I've set, whatever money I can raise through this campaign will be much appreciated and put to good use.

By helping me in this campaign, you are helping me get my music to a national and possibly worldwide audience; you are helping me get reviews from music critics in reputable publications; and you are helping me continue to live my dream of writing songs and performing them for people (like you) who love the music and stories of singer/songwriters (like me) who travel the roads catching songs and sharing their heart with others through music.  

Thank you for being an important part of this journey with me. 

The Costs and Benefits

I've tried to keep my perks and rewards on this campaign as straightforward as possible. My purpose is to get my record out to the world and to be able to play in front of more audiences for more shows each year. So the rewards are based around getting you my new music and giving you the opportunity to come to Nashville to hear it live or bring me to your hometown to play for you in person. 

As far as the costs go, hiring the PR firm will cost me around $3,000 per month for a four-month rollout campaign. The PR staff will send out the album and press materials to publications, music reviewers, and radio stations that they have built reputations with. This doesn't guarantee getting good or well-published reviews, but it gives me a better chance of getting the attention of those people than if I were to send them the music myself. Those of you who are good at math will realize I need $2,000 more than what I'm asking for. If I happen to raise that extra $2K, that would be great, but the goal I've set helps me get started and get most of the way through the campaign. That's a big deal, and I'll be more than grateful for whatever funds you help me raise.

If I should raise more than the amount I need, the extra funds will go either to extended months of PR, hiring a separate and dedicated radio promoter to send the music to terrestrial folk and Americana radio stations, and/or securing a venue and band for the official album release show next year in Nashville. I'll also be planning to produce and release music videos for some of the songs during 2019, so some funds could go into the production costs associated with those. 

Risks & Challenges

As I said before, there is no guarantee that I will get lots of good reviews and good radio play out of the money that I'm spending. But I'm proud of the new music I've created; it's as good or better than anything I've recorded in the past; and the people I'm hiring are as excited about the potential this music has to reach and move people as I am. I'm also confident that whatever increased presence I'm able to achieve through this promotional campaign will be progress in my goal to have a sustainable life making quality music, and just making the connections to more fans through the fulfilling of the perks of this campaign (especially the house concerts) will be a big step forward for me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks for reading about my funding goals and efforts. I realize that some folks may not be able to contribute at this time or to give as much as they would like. If that's you, I completely understand and would be happy to have you help me in other ways.

  • You can share this campaign through social media and email to anyone you think might want to contribute.
  • You can like my music page on Facebook and follow me on Instagram. You can also add me to your Pandora stations, subscribe to my channel/stream me on Spotify, and/or subscribe to my YouTube channel.
  • You can visit my website ( http://clintalphin.com) and sign up for my email list, listen to and purchase my previous releases, and check out my gig calendar to come and see me play whenever I'm near your town.

story:
Jackson Moe is proud to release the video for  “Tin Foil Heart,” a track from their upcoming release Pure Gold. The song was recorded at Berlin Studios in New Jersey and produced by Joe Michelini. The video was shot and edited by Shane Barbera and directed by Dan Cupps.

 

After 2016’s release EP AF rocketed up the country charts (from 420 to 69, like a good first date) the band embarked on their Live AF tour. Prior to their Milan show, Jackson Moe’s Barth & Messina underwent dramatic cosmetic surgery (they swapped eyeballs) which forced them to cancel the remaining 200 dates from the Live AF tour. Set for an early 2019 release, Pure Gold will feature five songs plus bonus material, with help from big ol’ backing band The Bolo Boys.

 

Pure Gold Track List:

  • Tin Foil Heart
  • America Town
  • Buy A Coke (And Throw It Out)
  • Runnin' From The Sun
  • (SECRET BONUS TRACK)

story:
Hello! We are Sanctorium - the Russian symphonic metal band.

And again, let us introduce ourselves! Fans of dark music appreciate the contrast between memorable cold female voice and a colorful male death metal growls, and also mix of heavy guitar riffs with exquisite keyboards (classic of the genre), symphonic arrangements and the general atmosphere of the songs. We take our inspiration in different mythologies, legends, history of ancient civilizations, mysticism and philosophy, which is reflected in English texts-paintings, painted in deep colors.

The first time we met with the platform Indigogo in 2016, when we raised funds for the recording of our second album, "Tessellation of the Universe". Our campaign was more than successful, and thanks to your funds we released a wonderful album! It was a great experience, and we learned about our fans around the whole world. You can check the previous campaign here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/sanctorium-s-new-album--2/x/14305506#/

Since then we shot and released a new video "Kaleidoscope" for a song from TotU, became the finalists of Emergenza (international music competition), went to Japan twice and played there 3 shows, went on a tour of the Balkans and played 8 shows in Romania, Bulgaria, Hungary and Slovakia, played 2 concerts in Finland and of course in Saint Petersburg. And after it we are still full of energy and ready to present to you something special ;) And for those, who didn't listen to our music yet, you can do it here: http://sanctorium.bandcamp.com/

Metal music and Sanctorium means a lot for us. Since 2005 when we started with our first members and up till now, it’s the big part of our lives. Receiving your support on the concerts and internet is one of the best things in this business we are engaged in! THANK YOU! Without you, our work would have been useless.

Now it’s time for our next step. We prepared a really huge thing! Our new album will be called "Ornaments" and consists of a 2 parts: symphonic metal and symphonic folk metal. So it will be a double album from 16 tracks, including 2 instrumentals, with epic arrangements, live academic choir, deep texts and interesting and complex musical parties, as always. We cannot make it just ourselves, so we ask you for help!

What We Need & What You Get

Recording a huge symphonic metal album is a difficult task now. It is actually probably the most expensive metal genre to work in. We've done a lot of hard work, but a lot of things are yet to come! We decided to make mixing and mastering of the album in Europe, so the cost of this campaign will be much higher than last time :( Because of a lot of tracks, 12 000$ is the minimal sum of money we need to record this album. This is the money to pay for studio time, sound engineer, artwork, merch and perks to you.

In return we offer you the best perks we could think of, which include the digital and physical versions of the album (plus very limited special edition), various merch (special limited edition), some cool pastimes like joining us in Saint Petersburg, and so on.

Note: EVERY PERK INCLUDES SHIPPING TO ANY COUNTRY!

Budget

It’s always cool to know where exactly your money goes. So here it comes:

  • Studio time (90 hours) – 1 600 $
  • Sound engineer’s fees (mixing, mastering) – 8 000 $
  • Artwork - 300 $
  • Merch - 600 $

Subtotal – 10 500 $

  • IndieGoGo fees (5% + 5% new fee "Reserved Funds" + approx 4% for transferring money = approx 14% +25$) - approx 1 500 $

Total – 12 000 $

What Happens if We Raise Less?

If we raise less than 12 000 $, the album will be made anyway and we will fulfill all our obligations to those who back us up. But of course it will take longer since we will have to do non-musical jobs to earn some of the money ourselves and borrow the rest of it.

What Happens if We Raise More?

If we manage to raise more than 12 000 $, we will shoot a new wonderful video for the one of a new song.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would still like to help but don't have funds, you can help us by telling all of your friends that this campaign is running. You can also share this campaign on your social media by using the Indiegogo share tools located at the top of this page.

Contact us directly at zhykova.darya@gmail.com if you would like to contribute with other methods of payment other than credit card (including PayPal).

JOIN US ON OUR JOURNEY TO RELEASE OUR 3RD ALBUM!

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT AND YOUR INTEREST IN SANCTORIUM!

 

Привет! Мы Sanctorium – российская симфо-метал группа.

И снова давайте знакомиться! Любители мрачной музыки оценят контраст запоминающегося холодного женского вокала с колоритным мужским дэтовым гроулингом, классическое для жанра сочетание тяжелых гитарных риффов с изысканными клавишными партиями, симфонические аранжировки с общей атмосферностью композиций. Мы черпаем вдохновение в различных мифологиях, легендах, истории античных цивилизаций, мистицизме и философии, что отражено в англоязычных текстах-картинах, окрашенных в глубокие тона.

В первый раз мы столкнулись с платформой Indigogo в 2016 году, когда собирали средства для записи нашего второго альбома «Tessellation of the Universe». Наша кампания была более чем успешной, и благодаря вашим средствам мы выпустили замечательный альбом! Это был отличный опыт, и мы узнали о наших поклонниках по всему миру. Вы можете посмотреть предыдущую кампанию здесь: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/sanctorium-salbum--2/x/14305506#/

С тех пор мы сняли и выпустили новое видео «Kaleidoscope» для песни из TotU, стали финалистами Emergenza (международного музыкального конкурса), дважды ездили в Японию и сыграли там 3 концерта, гастролировали по Балканам и сыграли 8 концертов в Румынии, Болгарии, Венгрии и Словакии, сыграли 2 концерта в Финляндии и, конечно же, в Санкт-Петербурге. И после этого мы по-прежнему полны энергии и готовы представить вам что-то особенное ;) А для тех, кто еще не слушал нашу музыку, вы можете сделать это здесь: http://sanctorium.bandcamp.com/

Метал музыка и Sanctorium очень много значат для нас. С 2005 года, когда мы начинали, и до сих пор, это большая часть нашей жизни. А ощущать вашу поддержку на концертах и в интернете - одно из крутейших чувств в нашем деле! СПАСИБО ВАМ! Без вас наша работа была бы напрасной.

Теперь пришло время для нашего следующего шага. Мы подготовили действительно огромную вещь! Наш новый альбом будет называться «Ornaments» и состять из двух частей: симфонического металла и симфонического фолк металла. Таким образом, это будет двойной альбом из 16 треков, в том числе 2-х инструментальных, с эпическими аранжировками, живым академическим хором, продуманными текстами и интересными и сложными музыкальными ходами, как и всегда. Мы не сможем сделать всё это сами, поэтому просим вас о помощи!

Что нам нужно и что вы приобретёте

Запись целого симфо-метал альбома - это сложная задача. Это, пожалуй, самый дорогой метал жанр. Мы проделали огромную работу, но многое ещё впереди! Мы решили сделать сведение и мастеринг альбома в Европе, поэтому цель этой кампании будет намного выше, чем в прошлый раз :( Из-за большого количества треков, 12 000 $ - это минимальная сумма денег, необходимая для записи этого альбома. Эти средства необходимы на оплату студийного времени, работу звукорежиссёра, оформление, изготовление мерча и вознаграждений.

Взамен мы предлагаем вам лучшие вознаграждения, которые только смогли придумать, которые включают в себя цифровые и физические версии альбома (включая очень ограниченное специальное издание), различный мерч (специальное ограниченное издание), некоторые интересные активности, такие, как встречи с нами в СПб, и не только.

Примечание: любое вознаграждение включает в себя отправку в любую страну!

Бюджет

Всегда полезно знать, на что идут ваши деньги. Предоставляем нашу смету:

  •     Студийное время (90 часов) – 1 600 $
  •     Оплата работы звукорежиссера (сведение, мастеринг) – 8 000 $
  •     Оформление - 300 $
  •     Мерч - 600 $

    Итого – 10 500 $

  •     комиссия IndieGoGo (5% + 5% новая комиссия "Зарезервированный фонд" + примерно 4% за перевод денег = примерно 14% + 25$) - примерно 1 500 $

    Всего – 12 000 $

Что будет, если мы соберем меньше?

Если мы соберём меньше 12 000 $, альбом будет сделан в любом случае, и мы исполним все наши обязательства перед теми, кто нам помог. Но на это потребуется больше времени, поскольку нам придётся справляться своими силами.

Что будет, если мы соберем больше?

Если получится собрать больше 12 000 $, мы снимем новый классный видео клип на песню с нового альбома.

Как ещё вы можете помочь

Если вы хотели бы помочь, но у вас нет средств, вы можете помочь нам, сообщив всем своим друзьям, что эта кампания запущена. Вы также можете поделиться этой кампанией в социальных сетях с помощью инструментов Indiegogo, расположенных в верхней части этой страницы.

Свяжитесь с нами напрямую по адресу zhykova.darya@gmail.com, если вы хотите внести свой вклад другими способами, отличными от банковской карты (включая PayPal).

ОГРОМНОЕ СПАСИБО ЗА ИНТЕРЕС И ПОДДЕРЖКУ SANCTORIUM!

Любители мрачной музыки оценят контраст запоминающегося холодного женского вокала с колоритным мужским дэтовым гроулингом, классическое для жанра сочетание тяжелых гитарных риффов с изысканными клавишными партиями, симфонические аранжировки с общей атмосферностью композиций. Мы черпаем вдохновение в различных мифологиях, легендах, истории античных цивилизаций, мистицизме и философии, что отражено в англоязычных текстах-картинах, окрашенных в глубокие тона.В первый раз мы столкнулись с платформой Indigogo в 2016 году, когда собирали средства для записи нашего второго альбома «Tessellation of the Universe». Наша кампания была более чем успешной, и благодаря вашим средствам мы выпустили замечательный альбом! Это был отличный опыт, и мы узнали о наших поклонниках по всему миру. Вы можете посмотреть предыдущую кампанию здесь: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/sanctorium-salbum--2/x/14305506#/С тех пор мы сняли и выпустили новое видео «Kaleidoscope» для песни из TotU, стали финалистами Emergenza (международного музыкального конкурса), дважды ездили в Японию и сыграли там 3 концерта, гастролировали по Балканам и сыграли 8 концертов в Румынии, Болгарии, Венгрии и Словакии, сыграли 2 концерта в Финляндии и, конечно же, в Санкт-Петербурге. И после этого мы по-прежнему полны энергии и готовы представить вам что-то особенное ;) А для тех, кто еще не слушал нашу музыку, вы можете сделать это здесь: http://sanctorium.bandcamp.com/Метал музыка и Sanctorium очень много значат для нас. С 2005 года, когда мы начинали, и до сих пор, это большая часть нашей жизни. А ощущать вашу поддержку на концертах и в интернете - одно из крутейших чувств в нашем деле! СПАСИБО ВАМ! Без вас наша работа была бы напрасной.Теперь пришло время для нашего следующего шага. Мы подготовили действительно огромную вещь! Наш новый альбом будет называться «Ornaments» и состять из двух частей: симфонического металла и симфонического фолк металла. Таким образом, это будет двойной альбом из 16 треков, в том числе 2-х инструментальных, с эпическими аранжировками, живым академическим хором, продуманными текстами и интересными и сложными музыкальными ходами, как и всегда. Мы не сможем сделать всё это сами, поэтому просим вас о помощи!Что нам нужно и что вы приобретётеЗапись целого симфо-метал альбома - это сложная задача. Это, пожалуй, самый дорогой метал жанр. Мы проделали огромную работу, но многое ещё впереди! Мы решили сделать сведение и мастеринг альбома в Европе, поэтому цель этой кампании будет намного выше, чем в прошлый раз :( Из-за большого количества треков, 12 000 $ - это минимальная сумма денег, необходимая для записи этого альбома. Эти средства необходимы на оплату студийного времени, работу звукорежиссёра, оформление, изготовление мерча и вознаграждений.Взамен мы предлагаем вам лучшие вознаграждения, которые только смогли придумать, которые включают в себя цифровые и физические версии альбома (включая очень ограниченное специальное издание), различный мерч (специальное ограниченное издание), некоторые интересные активности, такие, как встречи с нами в СПб, и не только.Примечание: любое вознаграждение включает в себя отправку в любую страну!БюджетВсегда полезно знать, на что идут ваши деньги. Предоставляем нашу смету:
    Студийное время (90 часов) – 1 600 $
    Оплата работы звукорежиссера (сведение, мастеринг) – 8 000 $
    Оформление - 300 $
    Мерч - 600 $
    Итого – 10 500 $    комиссия IndieGoGo (5% + 5% новая комиссия "Зарезервированный фонд" + примерно 4% за перевод денег = примерно 14% + 25$) - примерно 1 500 $    Всего – 12 000 $Что будет, если мы соберем меньше?Если мы соберём меньше 12 000 $, альбом будет сделан в любом случае, и мы исполним все наши обязательства перед теми, кто нам помог. Но на это потребуется больше времени, поскольку нам придётся справляться своими силами.Что будет, если мы соберем больше?Если получится собрать больше 12 000 $, мы снимем новый классный видео клип на песню с нового альбома.Как ещё вы можете помочьЕсли вы хотели бы помочь, но у вас нет средств, вы можете помочь нам, сообщив всем своим друзьям, что эта кампания запущена. Вы также можете поделиться этой кампанией в социальных сетях с помощью инструментов Indiegogo, расположенных в верхней части этой страницы.Свяжитесь с нами напрямую по адресу zhykova.darya@gmail.com, если вы хотите внести свой вклад другими способами, отличными от банковской карты (включая PayPal).ОГРОМНОЕ СПАСИБО ЗА ИНТЕРЕС И ПОДДЕРЖКУ SANCTORIUM!

story:
About the project:

'Nocturne for babies and their sleepy adults' is a new album with Scandinavian lullabies and a concert performance for 0-3 year olds and their sleepy adults. It will premiere November 2018 in Denmark, and tour Denmark and the UK in 2019.

The piece invites babies and toddlers to indulge in close-harmony singing. To enjoy the vibes of the big double base, that often rocks it's own violin baby. To explore the many different percussion instruments, and their own new kinds of rattles! It is a time and space to play, crawl, dance, make noises and sounds, and... to sleep and dream. ​

We would like to reach the very youngest, and also their adults who go through big life changes as they welcome babies into their lives. The concert performance will be equally entertaining for and aimed at both generations. It is a place to take inspiration to home, supported by the booklet with lyrics and images connected to the performance and the album of songs.

 

About the campaign:

This crowdfunding campaign is to support the Scandinavian Sining Club album, and stage show. Funding will go to the recordings, mixing, artworks, translation of lyrics into English, and print of booklets. A small portion will be reserved for the launch and online marketing. 

Perks: To download the e-booklet and album, or receive a printed version of the booklet of songs and images together with our album. We can also offer a private concert at your place. 

 

About us:

Scandinavian Singing Club was founded in London in 2015 with conductor/singer Marta Mathea Radwan, singer Åshild Bjørkeng Haugen and founder/singer Mia Theil Have. The trio has performed at charity events, concerts and to their online followers since.

'Nocturne for babies and their sleepy adults'  is part of the Riotous Company's concert performances together with 'Scherzo for piano and stick' and 'Divertimento for rope and strings', bridging story, movement and imagery with excellent music performances. 

Riotous Company in a UK charity that has produced 8 independent productions since it was founded in 2012, touring in the UK, Italy, Denmark, Macedonia and Brazil to leading venues and festivals. Creating strong international collaborations was always important, and especially now as Brexit happens. Please see more on www.riotouscompany.co.uk
