Also from a musical household in Milwaukee, Sean has lived in New York City since 1994, playing with innumerable performers, including Gotye’s Ondioline Orchestra, Maxwell, Aloe Blaac, Doyle Bramhall II, Amy Helm, Miyamoto Is Black Enough, Andy Akiho, and Helga Davis. He served as the rhythmic backbone of the band Zammuto and co-leads the group SLV. He has studied with Guinea’s master drummer, M’Bemba Bangoura, and Bahia’s musician/capoeirista Mestre Kiki da Bahia and Grupo Ginga. Click here to check out his website.  Credits on the record: Drums, percussion, keyboards, composing, arranging, producing.

Famoro Dioubate was born in Conakry, Guinea into a griot family. He is the grandson of El Hadj Djelli Sory Kouyate, a living legend of the Manding balafon. Famoro is a guardian of traditions dating back to the 13th century in the ancient Mandé Empire. He played in several groups across West Africa including Mory Kante‘s orchestra. He lives in New York City, where he leads his band Kakande. Click here to hear his music on Bandcamp.  

Penny Fox is a Milwaukee-based blues and folk singer steeped in traditional American music, with a style all her own. This is her first time singing anything close to music that sounds like this. 
 

What other great musicians can your contribution help us get on the record?

story:
Lofty

Lofty is an instrumental jazz fusion trio from Eugene, Oregon formed in summer of 2017. Since then, we've played many live shows, but haven't yet been able to release any recordings due to the high cost of studio time. However, the time has come to record a full length album. We're going into the studio in January and have lofty expectations:

  • We plan to record and mix 12 songs in two weeks - the familiar tracks you know and love, and also a few new ones you haven't heard!
  • We're featuring a lot of special guests on the album - expect to hear guitar solos, saxophone, and even some mini-orchestral parts!
  • We plan to capture video throughout the recording process and produce several live videos.

Perks

We are designing new art for the album - it will be also featured on the new shirts and posters. We'll post it as an update in a bit, but are still working on it!

If you want a combination of perks that isn't offered, send us a message and we'll work it out or add it as an option! :)

*also there is no way to allow for local pickup as a shipping option, but if you're local and don't need it shipped we're happy to refund the shipping!

Cost Breakdown

  • 2 weeks studio time (recording+mixing): $1600
  • mastering 12 tracks: $600
  • physical album production: $300
  • shirt+poster production: $400
  • album art design: $100
  • indiegogo and processing fees: $240

If our full costs are not met, we do have some flexibility to reduce these costs, for example skimping on mastering or doing a smaller run of shirts/physical CDs. However we hope to meet the full goal and realize the full potential of this album! If we exceed our goal it will allow us to budget a bit for videography and to pay the musicians who have graciously given their time and creative energy to this project!

    Thank you!

    Thank you for donating and helping to make our project a reality.

story:
Michelle Ingrham

  • I am a singer songwriter based out of Ocala FL.
  • I am re-entering the performing singer songwriter world after a hiatus that lasted about 2 years. It's like starting all over again.
  • I always felt like something was holding me back from achieving, what has always been, my childhood dreams. 

I believe that I have been given songs to share. They are about my truths, my experiences, and my struggles. One fan says. " Michelle, I love your songs but some of them are uncomfortable, but we need to hear them." I believe that too. I believe I'm not alone in how I feel or what I've been through. I want to be a voice, in song, for what needs to be said. One song in particular, is called Beautiful. Low self esteem comes in many forms but it seems to come out in anger and shame when there's a mirror in front of us. Something I have struggled with my entire life. 

The Debut solo CD "Only Love"

How you can help:

  •  With help from art and music lovers, I will be able to finish this CD, have it duplicated, distribute it to independent and folk radio stations around the world. 
  •  When I was in my touring duo, we released 4 CD's, one of which reached #7 on the international folkdj charts, and another #12. They include songs that were accepted into Kerrville folk festival's Newfolk competition and South Florida folk festival's songwriting competition. I will include autographed copies of 1 to all 4 CD's along with a copy of ONLY LOVE. 
  • My goal is to finish this CD, first and foremost. With extra funds I will distribute them to radio stations around the world. You can help me become an international recording artist.
  • I believe the song " Beautiful" needs to be recorded and performed on mainstream radio so I will be trying to push this song toward that and you can say, " I helped her get this song on the radio" 

Roadblocks

I am a massage therapist by day and was taking extra funds like tips, and also online cd sales, and putting that toward this project. I was slowly but surely doing this on my own. It's truly hard to ask for help.  Unfortunately, our landlords have decided to end their marriage and need their beautiful house back. I is a sanctuary for us that holds so many beautiful memories. We thought we would be here for a long time, making more memories. My favorite memory is marrying my best friend in the back yard. That back yard is the scene to the video you are watching.

So now having to move, all those extra funds are now being shifted to saving up to move to another house, in approximately 5 months. 

  • This CD holds songs I thought I'd never write. but I did, and they kept coming. I am suppose to share these songs with the people who need to hear them. 
  •  I am hoping this CD will reach #10 ( at least ) on the international folk charts, like 2 of our CDs did when I toured with my duo. I am hoping this CD takes me around this beautiful country again. 
  • I believe this is what I'm suppose to do. It's not about making money for me, as a songwriter, it's about the song and the connections they create. It all goes together in an intricate balance of art and finances. 

You never know

Just like this sudden move we have to make, unwanted challenges occur that we can't avoid. 

  •  As a performing singer songwriter, I, for 20 years, performed with my duo, who I was married to, and I became so reliant on him, that I lost confidence in being a strong artist on my own. Doing all the background work, I had the fear instilled in me that music couldn't sustain us because we had a work routine that paralyzed us. His fear was debilitating and I believed it. My biggest challenge is believing is my music, but that confidence is coming back with each performance, each new song, and each encouraging fan that tells me I should be doing this. There is really nothing in the way, other than financially.  I have a supportive husband, family, and fanbase, who believes in me. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I believe there is a reason for everyone who enters our lives. Each person is a lesson in one way or another. Some people don't have funds to help, but they have connections to radio, venues, housing while we are on tour, and even talents to add to this project. I welcome input, ideas, and inspirations. They are all steps to making this project, and my goal, the best they can be. 

Thank you for your love of independent music and performing songwriters. 

You are so appreciated.

Michelle

visit www.michelleingrham.com

story:
Violent Vickie is a Los Angeles-based multimedia electronic music band. 

 

Inspired by punk, electro & industrial music, Vickie programs beats, plays synth and sings, screams & talk-raps with a backdrop of fitting visuals.  Violent Vickie has toured with Hanin Elias of Atari Teenage Riot and has shared the stage with The Missing Persons, Trans X, Them Are Us Too, Mika Miko, and Go Betty Go.  Vickie has toured the US, Europe, and has performed at multiple Ladyfests and Pride festivals.  Violent Vickie’s “Lies” was released by Emerald & Doreen Recordings (Berlin).  “The Scientist” was released on vinyl  by The  LoveCraft Bar (PDX).  “The Wolf” was released by Riot Grrrl Berlin and was featured in a NOW (National Organization for Women) film.   She was also interviewed for the documentary “GRRRL”, which was featured in “Alien She”, a riot grrrl exhibit which toured museums.  Vickie's last LP “Monster Alley”, was voted best album by KALX.  

Vickie is currently raising money to fund the production of her upcoming 15 track LP "Division" and music video "Serotonin", which will be directed by AJ Strout of Letter A films & produced by Luka Fisher.   Raising money with this campaign will enable Vickie to put out a high quality music video,  and high quality music and packaging for her album.  The funds from this campaign will help to pay for space rentals, shooting, and editing the video as well as the cost of mastering and pressing for her 15 track album.

What We Need & What You Get

We are currently attempting to raise $5,000 which will cover the costs of video and music production as well as support the cast and crew.   The money raised will go towards mastering and pressing the album as well as space rental, permits, costumes, makeup, and pay for the film crew.  

We are offering many fun perks for contributions to the campaign including but not limited to downloads, CD, a compilation from the Lovecraft Bar, T-shirts, postcards, a private Violent Vickie show, a custom song or cover by Violent Vickie, and Producer credit.

 

The Impact

If you contribute to this campaign Vickie will be able to produce a higher quality music video and album, which will in turn help to keep the arts alive.

In the past Vickie raised funds for her album "Monster Alley" , which contributed to the of mastering the album and pressing the CD.

Any contribution you can make to this campaign would be much appreciated!

Risks & Challenges

Vickie's album is nearing completion and  the music videos are in the works.   Contributions to this campaign would help Vickie to be able to pay for locations rentals, costumes, to pay the film crew, to master her music and press the album.  

Raising funds for this project would enable us to put out a high quality music and video that we would love to put out for our fans.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount of money would be vastly appreciated,  however if you are unable to contribute at this time, we would very much appreciate it if you would share this campaign.  Indiegogo makes sharing campaigns easy with their share tools!

story:
OUR STORY

The Inner Circle Jazz Orchestra is a supergroup of rising musicians, and is the brainchild of composers Arnie Co and Spencer Sussman. For our first major recording, we honor our roots: the San Francisco Bay Area. 

The ICJO’s debut EP, In Our Backyard, celebrates the Bay Area as one of the most artistically vibrant places in the world. Our project is inspired by our experiences (both past and present) and how we value our community in a rapidly changing world.

In order to bring our music to life, we need you - our community - to support us!

 

WHAT WE NEED

You can help us by purchasing tickets to our live recording session and/or donating toward any of the included perks! Your contributions will make our video and performance an unforgettable event!

 

PERFORMANCE INFO

Saturday December 28th

8pm & 9:30pm showtimes

The Art Boutiki (44 Race St, San Jose, CA 95126)

 

EXPENSES

As you might imagine, creating In Our Backyard takes a team of talented musicians, videographers, sound engineers, and many others. We are completely self funded, so we rely solely on your support to bring forth our absolute best.

  • Venue Rental
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Videography
  • Artwork
  • Musicians 
  • Food services
  • CD Pressing
  • Festival fees
  • Travel
  • Agent fees
  • Bonus tracks

 

Thank you for your support from Arnie, Spencer, and the entire Inner Circle Jazz Orchestra!

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone! 

My name is Calvin Limuel. I’m a musician based in Boston, MA. I’m a recent graduate of Berklee College of Music. I began my musical life from my home country Indonesia, and currently for quite some time now in Boston. 

Over these years, I have played with so many talented musicians, some of whom I call dear friends, and I have also written so tunes and compositions, but I’ve struggled to compose an actual cohesive album, and I also felt inadequate as a musician. Although it hasn’t really changed that much, I’ve decided that it’s now or never. 

This campaign would help me fund my first album project. I have waited for too long, to be able to record my own music, and I’m glad that I can finally do this with some of my good friends, some who I have played with at recitals and many other gigs including our residency at Boston’s legendary Wally’s Café Jazz Club. 

Album Details 

Instead of just one album, I’ve ended up with two setlists for two albums that would be released separately to the public (campaign backers would get them earlier), the first would be titled “Home: In Transit”, and the second one “My Gratitude”. 

“Home: In Transit” will contain songs inspired by the places that I’ve lived in, my hometown Jakarta, Indonesia, and Boston, where I’ve lived for almost a quarter of my life now. Many have known me now for one of the songs “Take the T”, inspired by the dreaded MBTA. I’ve considered Boston my second hometown, but I know life will someday lead me out of Boston. “Home” was the initial title of the album I thought of and my bandmates added “In Transit”. 

“My Gratitude” will contain songs I wrote as “hommages” toward the great musicians that have come before us and also the people in my life. Songs about, inspired, and for my musical heroes, mentors, and my mother. 

These two albums will also include bonus tracks and some exclusive to the campaign backers. 

Your contributions would help us pay for: 

  • the production process (studio recording time, mixing/mastering engineers, additional gears needed);
  • accommodation (transportation, food);
  • documentation (photo & video);
  • graphic designing;
  • distribution platforms;
  • marketing & promotional;
  • and of course, the musicians, engineers, and everybody involved.

In the case that our goal isn’t reached, we are still moving on with the process and hope that we’d still have enough resources (or even more backers) to complete the whole project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to contribute monetarily today, but you can still contribute by spreading the news! Use the convenient social sharing buttons on the side, so more people can see this campaign! 

 

I'm so excited for this project, and I'm glad you're a part of it! Thank you so much! 

Best, 
Calvin Limuel

story:
Who is The Sam & Tony Show?

The Sam & Tony Show is made up of two music-loving artists who collided in Los Angeles and decided to meld their musical sensibilities into one songwriting powerhouse. Sam Johnides, originally from Michigan, has been a songwriter, pianist, guitarist, and drummer (amongst other musical talents) since his high school days and brought his array of musical skills to Los Angeles to become a music producer, composer, and performer. His successes in Los Angeles include winning Best Original Songwriting at the 2017 Hollywood Fringe Festival for Turbulence with Robot Teammate and composing the long-running Trump in Space at Second City Hollywood, written with Tony his co-writer, Gillian Bellinger, and Landon Kirksey. Tony Gonzalez, Texas-born and raised, after pursuing an operatic career finally found his true passion in songwriting and performing original music in Los Angeles. Sam and Tony’s collaborations have included film scores and songs (Undocumented Salvation (2017), Lemon Drop (2018)), composition for musicals (Supportive White Parents, Look Out Hollywood!, Annabella, Happily Ever Under), and original music for YouTubers and Podcasts (“Friends with Ben E Fitz,” “Still a Loser,” “Some Quest for Glory”). Their music video for their original single “Song You Made Me Write” can be found on YouTube.

What is Bravura?

Bravura is a large-scale world invented by The Sam & Tony Show where circus tents are cities, ringleaders compete for the best acts by whatever means necessary, carnival life is the way of life, and the inhabitants either dedicate their lives to mastering their performance art, or become the outsiders that seek to undermine and dismantle the carnival world. The debut album Bravura will be a musical journey through that world, where each song is written to showcase the perspective of a particular inhabitant, ranging from the charismatic Ringmaster to the fire and brimstone-slinging Revival Preacher, from the less-than-enthusiastic Clowns to the odd Freaks who only want a place at the table. Every moment of the album is designed to transport you from everyday life into a musically soaring escape into this strange realm.

With the completion of this fundraising campaign, we will be able to record at the much-loved Studio City Sound in Studio City, California, owned by Grammy-award Winning Mixer Tom Weir. Your financial support means we can dedicate time to refining our instrumentals (we play all our own instruments), getting the best vocal takes, and mixing each track to sonic perfection so that the final product is as amazing as we hear it in our heads. Along with the release of the album on all major platforms (Amazon Music, Apple Music, iTunes, Pandora, Spotify), The Sam & Tony Show will have something solid to take outside of California for our first venture out of state, bringing the fantastic sounds of Bravura abroad with a live band show that will be a night to remember. This album will truly be the next large step in our careers. Your help in funding it will not only be rewarded with various gifts listed on this campaign page, but will be returned with the deepest of gratitude from two guys from the Midwest and the Southwest who had a dream bigger than both of them.

Where Will My Funds Go?

Our initial goal is $10,000. We’ve broken down the cost of recording in the studio per song, having had some experience with our previous singles, and have found that one song, from top to bottom (rehearsal studio rentals, tracking instrumentals, recording vocals, and mixing) cost between $1200-$1600 per song. Our engineer extraordinaire, Jeff Ryon, is included in the hourly rate of the studio, and playing our own instruments cuts down on costs, but it is still a hefty financial undertaking! Our goal is to have at least 6 original songs to present once the project is complete (a full EP). We have no shortage of material, so should our fundraising goal be exceeded, we would be more than happy to add to that number for a full album! Once everything is mixed and mastered, we’ll do our official release on all major music download platforms, such as well as manufacture physical copies of the album.

A portion of the budget is also set aside for the commission of the artwork you see on display by the talented Michael Ramstead, which will appear on the album and on various merchandise to be sold at live shows. Manufacturing of CDs is another expense that we are read to undertake, but raising over our goal limit would surely help to ease that amount for us.

We’re excited to be able to return your generosity with some gifts! Depending on the level of funds you provide, we have various tiers of gifts available:

$20: Digital downloads of songs before official release. You’ll get to hear the music first, before we release everything on the major music platforms.

$35: Personalized copy of the Bravura Album. With this level of giving, you’ll have your own copy of Bravura along with a special “thank you” message from The Sam & Tony Show.

$50: Bravura T-Shirt. Along with the above-mentioned gifts, you’ll receive a T-shirt with some special lyrics from the album, “Give your pain another name,” along with the Bravura logo on  the back.

$100: Physical print of the original Bravura Artwork. Our beautiful and macabre cover art, created by Michael Ramstead, will be provided in an 11x11 print for you to gaze at as you listen to the album at home.

$250: Special Kat-thryn Cat Piano signed by Sam & Tony. If you haven’t seen our Instagram page, you’re missing out on getting acquainted with a little children’s instrument that made it into many of our shows and has become something of a mascot. We’ll sign your own personalized Kat-thryn and send it your way, and you will probably even get to rename her!

$500: Personalized Thank-You Song from The Sam & Tony Show. We’re songwriters, so one of the best ways we know to gift people is through song! We’ll get some details from you about what you’d like your song to be about and go about crafting you your own original The Sam & Tony Show composition.

$1000: Your Personal Live Concert. If you’ve donated at this level, you’ve truly gone above and beyond and we would love to bring one of our The Sam & Tony Show concerts right to you, either at your home or at a venue you’d provide. You can tell your friends and family you hosted Sam and Tony in a live concert and lived to tell the story! Certain travel restrictions and venue needs apply. Refer to the perks list for details.

What we’ll do if we don’t reach our goal. Luckily for us, our vision for bringing our music from our minds to your ears is much bigger than any financial barriers. Should we not reach our campaign goal, we will still make use of whatever funds we’ve been able to collect and put it towards Studio City Sound. The main difference would be how quickly we could release the music, as we would work towards releasing the album no matter how much we achieved through the campaign. However, the more we raise with your help, the more songs we will have to share and the quicker you’ll have the album in hand!

Why does Bravura matter?

If you’re a fan of The Sam & Tony Show, we hope that you are familiar with our commitment to artistically excellent music that is refreshingly original while still being completely accessible. If you don’t know us or our work, we invite you to get familiar with our output!

 http://www.thesamandtonyshow.com

The world of pop music is, to some ears, disappointingly commercial and feels like something out of a factory (a very commercially successful factory), but without the organic approach of the songwriter transferring their ideas in an original and artistically committed way from page to stage. We understand the connection between artist and audience to be a two-way street. We want to provide the audience with something they haven’t heard before that speaks to them on an emotional level, while the audience wants to provide ears for our music as long as it isn’t alienating. Bravura is the perfect blend of modern rock and our distinct theatrical voice. It is musical escapism to the max, without being too commercially sanded down or too avant-garde.

Bravura, while being some of the most fun we’ve had as composers, goes beyond just being escapism. The art we’re creating comes from very real places. “Hellfire and Devilry” was written as a vivid portrait of the fear and terror associated with growing up in the shadow of religiosity, afraid that my sins would condemn me to eternity in hell. “Freakshow” is an homage to all those who feel as if society has rejected them, for sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, background, medical condition, or any other reason that people use as grounds for rejection. No matter how outlandish our presentation of these songs, our emotional core is very grounded in what will speak to you, our audience. We write these songs as self-therapy. Hopefully a bit of that catharsis slips into your experience with The Sam & Tony Show.

How do I know you’ll follow through?

Sam and I are, if anything, committed to making it through from the beginning of the project to the end of it. We have many other personal projects that have led to runs in theatres.

Our last crowdfunding campaign resulted our first self-produced musical Annabella, which was nominated for Most Outstanding Songwriting in the 2015 Hollywood Fringe Festival and had nine sold-out performances at the Lounge Theater. Subsequently it was given an eight-performance sold-out run at the Big Oak Theatre In Chatsworth, CA, produced by Avenue Act One. We know how to turn your generosity into something that takes on a life of its own, and we hope you’ll trust us on this journey as well.

Available to watch here is our first music video for our first wide-released single “Song You Made Me Write.” The process required casting, finding a crew, and a lot of dedication with it all coming together. As producers, we know how to put our all financially and artistically into a project so that it arrives to you, our audience, as fleshed out as possible. 

How can I help?

There are many ways in which you can help The Sam & Tony Show reach its goal! Check out our available perks and see which gift your donation lines up with. No matter how much we raise, we will receive the majority of your gifts (IndieGoGo takes a small percentage as a fee for using their crowdfunding platform). Also use the IndieGoGo sharing tools provided so that you can let your friends and family know about your gifting and about our campaign. Word of mouth is going to be a huge helper in this, or at least a share on Social Media with some words about why you believe in The Sam & Tony Show. We’re going to be releasing regular updates as the campaign continues so that you have an inside look at the exciting world of watching a little money bar slowly climb to 100%.

Please know that we are extremely grateful for your generosity, financial or otherwise, and hope that you’ll be a big part of bringing the music of Bravura to life.

“Bravura Album Cover” and “Ringmaster” images by Michael Ramstead.

Photography by Michael Filippi.
story_txt:
Who is The Sam & Tony Show?
The Sam & Tony Show is made up of two music-loving artists who collided in Los Angeles and decided to meld their musical sensibilities into one songwriting powerhouse. Sam Johnides, originally from Michigan, has been a songwriter, pianist, guitarist, and drummer (amongst other musical talents) since his high school days and brought his array of musical skills to Los Angeles to become a music producer, composer, and performer. His successes in Los Angeles include winning Best Original Songwriting at the 2017 Hollywood Fringe Festival for Turbulence with Robot Teammate and composing the long-running Trump in Space at Second City Hollywood, written with Tony his co-writer, Gillian Bellinger, and Landon Kirksey. Tony Gonzalez, Texas-born and raised, after pursuing an operatic career finally found his true passion in songwriting and performing original music in Los Angeles. Sam and Tony’s collaborations have included film scores and songs (Undocumented Salvation (2017), Lemon Drop (2018)), composition for musicals (Supportive White Parents, Look Out Hollywood!, Annabella, Happily Ever Under), and original music for YouTubers and Podcasts (“Friends with Ben E Fitz,” “Still a Loser,” “Some Quest for Glory”). Their music video for their original single “Song You Made Me Write” can be found on YouTube.
What is Bravura?

Bravura is a large-scale world invented by The Sam & Tony Show where circus tents are cities, ringleaders compete for the best acts by whatever means necessary, carnival life is the way of life, and the inhabitants either dedicate their lives to mastering their performance art, or become the outsiders that seek to undermine and dismantle the carnival world. The debut album Bravura will be a musical journey through that world, where each song is written to showcase the perspective of a particular inhabitant, ranging from the charismatic Ringmaster to the fire and brimstone-slinging Revival Preacher, from the less-than-enthusiastic Clowns to the odd Freaks who only want a place at the table. Every moment of the album is designed to transport you from everyday life into a musically soaring escape into this strange realm.
With the completion of this fundraising campaign, we will be able to record at the much-loved Studio City Sound in Studio City, California, owned by Grammy-award Winning Mixer Tom Weir. Your financial support means we can dedicate time to refining our instrumentals (we play all our own instruments), getting the best vocal takes, and mixing each track to sonic perfection so that the final product is as amazing as we hear it in our heads. Along with the release of the album on all major platforms (Amazon Music, Apple Music, iTunes, Pandora, Spotify), The Sam & Tony Show will have something solid to take outside of California for our first venture out of state, bringing the fantastic sounds of Bravura abroad with a live band show that will be a night to remember. This album will truly be the next large step in our careers. Your help in funding it will not only be rewarded with various gifts listed on this campaign page, but will be returned with the deepest of gratitude from two guys from the Midwest and the Southwest who had a dream bigger than both of them.

Where Will My Funds Go?
Our initial goal is $10,000. We’ve broken down the cost of recording in the studio per song, having had some experience with our previous singles, and have found that one song, from top to bottom (rehearsal studio rentals, tracking instrumentals, recording vocals, and mixing) cost between $1200-$1600 per song. story:
Short Summary

This two-time Grammy nominee’s career has taken Cidny (Cindy) from singing back-up with Elton John to having eight critically acclaimed solo albums, including 1999's award winning “Somewhere Between Heaven and Earth”. Followed by “Neverland” and “dream #29” and Cid's 2010 "Howling Trains and Barking Dogs". In 2007 Cidny formed the “super-trio”- The Refugees- with songwriting greats Wendy Waldman and Deborah Holland. The Refugees released two CDs 2009's Unbound  and 2012's THREE. Both stayed on the Folk/Americana charts for many months. Since 2016, Cidny has been performing his autobiographical one person show Somewhere Between: Not An Ordinary Life  in theaters around the country, including Los Angeles, New York, and Nashville to rave reviews. In 2019,  the major documentary Invisible, directed by TJ Parsell, will be released in which Cid is featured. Also Cid will release his first album as "Cidny Bullens". He is writing and recording songs reflecting his last seven years of gender transition. In 2020, Cid's memoir will not be far behind.

What We Need & What You Get

OK Folks! I'd like to raise $10,000 (as a start).  These funds will go partly for initial recording costs that include studio and musician fees. But MORE IMPORTANTLY for the hiring of a TOP publicist--who has to have at least three months ahead of release to start promoting. (That alone is the $10K).

What YOU get is the chance to contribute to a timely, relevant project, that I hope will reach a broad audience (akin to my album "Somewhere Between Heaven and Earth"), about yet another misunderstood human element, condition, story. Being a transgender person is not a choice. We are born with the body of one gender and the brain (identity) of the other. Gender also is not binary, as we all have been conditioned to believe. But that's a long discussion. Because this reality is so misunderstood: people die. Trans people young and old, commit suicide. Or are brutally murdered. Thankfully, in the last few years, we have had known people "come out" and we've had more discussion and perhaps a bit more acceptance. But in this volatile political climate, right now, with so many other battles to fight, our progress has been limited. My story--like my one person show--is a human story. I am asking you to help me tell it in the most effective way I can. That takes money.

The Impact

Here's my hope: After my album "Somewhere Between Heaven and Earth" was released 1999, I spent the next 15 years doing workshops, concerts and seminars for bereaved parents, the medical community, the psychology and sociology communities--at colleges, universities, and conferences, all over the country and actually in several other countries around the world.

I would like to do this again, now, on the subject of being transgender, wherever I possibly can.  My experience is that education, by personal contact, with a human story, told not only in words but in music, makes the greatest impact on the heart and mind.

You can help me do this.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't help financially, believe me, I get it! But please help me get the word out about this campaign and what my goals for this album are.
  • Use  the Indiegogo share tools!

 THANK YOU WITH ALL MY HEART! As I continue to grow as a human being, and as the death of Jessie taught me (she's given me too many gifts to list), my path is to be of service in this world.

Thank you for helping me do just that.

story:
Just imagine...

Imagine for a moment being at a Pink Floyd's rehearsal (...or maybe The Beatles?... Nirvana? Heck, any band's rehearsal will do). The songs are full of raw energy, in spite of the occasional mistakes the players may make. You can feel the creativity and the potential in the air. That's the feeling The Vlade had in mind for his debut album "Dreams In The Basement", an album he composed all music, played all instruments, recorded, programmed, mixed and designed all by himself. For better or for worse, The Vlade is continuing this vision in his second album, "Changes".

Who's The Vlade?

Vancouver, British Columbia is what The Vlade calls home nowadays, but the singer/songwriter was born on the banks of the river Danube in his native Bulgaria. His love affair with music and art started very early on in his life, with his grandma's songs and paintings. Ever since he can remember, he has always been fascinated by the sounds and colors around him. 

The Vlade taught himself to play the guitar around age thirteen, when his brother Julian brought one home. He began writing his own music soon after. His current musical style can be described as an eclectic blend of a wide range of musical influences - from traditional folk songs and acoustic sounds to electronic music and hard rock. Over the years that mesh has morphed into a uniquely wonderful style, showcased here on his first lo-fi album release, "Dreams In The Basement". 

But The Vlade's talents do not end with his musical abilities. He is also an award-winning designer, humorous illustrator and animator, children's book author and cartoonist. And though music took a second seat to work and family, he is glad to be at a stage of his life when he can return to his first love.

The Goal

"It is never too late to follow a dream", says The Vlade. "Apart from the pure joy of creating music, teaching my kids to follow their dreams is the other reason why I recorded this album. You should always stay true to your real self, no matter what!"

How Can You Can Help?

Yes, a small contribution goes a long way and will be much appreciated! But times are tough and if you're not able to contribute, I completely understand. But that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please spread the word out and help make some noise about this campaign.
  • You can simply use the Indiegogo share tools :-)

And that's all there is to it.

story:
My name Is Michael Forkuo and I'm from Worcester, Massachusetts. Ive been involved with worship music ministry for 20 years.

     My heart has always been to help followers of Jesus Christ (present & future) see what worship is and how it can be enhanced or diminished by where and how we include God in our everyday lives. Monday through Saturday is where we all live and Sunday is where we often find a reason to celebrate. We all look forward to the "locker room moments" that Sunday mornings bring but when we head back out into the "game" often our faith, hope & love are confronted by opposing forces. Many times all we're left with is questions.  And in the process of finding answers to the questions, how do you find your hallelujah?

     This is where I've been living for the past 2 & 1/2 years and during this part of my journey I've been mercifully confronted by my continuous need to trust and surrender. Trust that if God has given me eternal security through Jesus Christ I need to learn to trust He will secure my everyday.  Surrender my desires, my hurt, my pain, my resentment and my constant need to understand and control the outcome. This is how the road to everything came about. 

     I know that I am not alone on this road even though life and the enemy of my soul would love for me to believe that I am. However, God has amazing ways of making it glaringly apparent that there are others on this same road. We are not all at the same point on the road but the most important thing is that we are all traveling together on it. Letting Jesus into your heart is the first step but where do you go from there?

     More often than not, I find myself following Him and just trying to keep one foot in front of the other as I try and stay on this road. Where are you? Are you walking? Are you running? Are you following Him? My hope is that you'll join me on this journey and support me with finishing this EP.                            Thank you for your time. You're a blessing!

Mike

We all look forward to the "locker room moments" that Sunday mornings bring but when we head back out into the "game" often our faith, hope & love are confronted by opposing forces. Many times all we're left with is questions.  And in the process of finding answers to the questions, how do you find your hallelujah?
     This is where I've been living for the past 2 & 1/2 years and during this part of my journey I've been mercifully confronted by my continuous need to trust and surrender. Trust that if God has given me eternal security through Jesus Christ I need to learn to trust He will secure my everyday.  Surrender my desires, my hurt, my pain, my resentment and my constant need to understand and control the outcome. This is how the road to everything came about. 
     I know that I am not alone on this road even though life and the enemy of my soul would love for me to believe that I am. However, God has amazing ways of making it glaringly apparent that there are others on this same road. We are not all at the same point on the road but the most important thing is that we are all traveling together on it. Letting Jesus into your heart is the first step but where do you go from there?
     More often than not, I find myself following Him and just trying to keep one foot in front of the other as I try and stay on this road. Where are you? Are you walking? Are you running? Are you following Him? My hope is that you'll join me on this journey and support me with finishing this EP.                            Thank you for your time. You're a blessing!
Mike

story:
All profits of this crowdfunding will be donated to support AUTOPOIESIS, a collective throwing kickass techno events for and by FLINT* folks: women, lesbian, inter, nonbinary and trans people. The event started on February 2016 with Amperia alongside Schatten Voraus. Soon Vela, from Dangerous Drums joined the collective as for Henna. The team has performed in many more venues such as Chesters, ://about blank, Eschschloraque Rümschrümp, Beate Uwe, Kantine am Berghain and now @Diskothek Melancholie. Their genres revolve around the techno spectrum, basically uptempo and energetic. Their online podcast started in October 2019 on mixcloud and casts already 40+ artists from all over the world.

https://www.instagram.com/autopoiesisberlin/

Autopoiesis itself has a special meaning, it comes from biology and has an echo in sociology, a self-constructivist approach which aims to empower all trans and ciswomen artist to find strength in themselves and take over the night, the dancefloor and the stage.

 

The COME HOME label has been created in 2019 to bring a sense of community while tackling issues like Vakula’s most awful misogynist cover, Kanye West’s denial of LGTB or any similar events that have shaken the music industry and techno scene over the last year.

Starting now, COME HOME stands-up against Misogyny, Transphobia, Homophobia, Sexism, Racism and definitely Vakulism of all kinds!

Rooted to the origins of Techno & Acid music, COME HOME is a music label that aims to be a space for freedom, tolerance, respect, self-expression and Life whatever your origins, beliefs and orientations. We promote HUMANITY, unity, community, diversity and LOVE.

 

COME HOME launches its first EP CH001 “KONFLIKT” (2020) with the Berlin based ACID techno artist ZIEL. 4 tracks and a remix by MARC PIÑOL. Artwork by PABLO PERRA. Will be available for vinyl press, along with some other gifts.

               

 

We care about a sustainable, inclusive, open-minded approach to life. Together as a community, we can make a difference and we ask for your support to bring a positive impact.

Support us! 

Welcome Home

story:
Mon parcours

D’origine arménienne, je suis née au Liban, parisienne de formation et montréalaise de cœur. Très jeune, j’ai développé une forte passion pour le piano et le chant, et ai eu le bonheur d’accompagner des artistes francophones de renoms tels que Bécaud, Aznavour, Moustaki, Ferrat et Léveillée dans leur tournées au Liban et participé au Festival international de la chanson de Sopot. 

Après avoir obtenu un premier prix d'exécution à l'École normale de musique de Paris, je me suis lancée sur la trajectoire d'une carrière d'interprétation classique. Brisant les chaînes du classicisme, j’ai créé un répertoire empreint de tradition et d'originalité, où se fondent harmonieusement les sons d'Orient et d'Occident. Par la magie de l'intégration d'instruments aussi variés que le piano, le oud, le saxophone, les flûtes, les percussions, et par ma voix, je tente de rejoindre toutes les sensibilités. 

Ma musique, à la frontière de l'interprétation et de la création, est le fruit d'une recherche constante d'équilibre entre qualité, précision, émotion et liberté d'expression.

Nourrie de ces expériences, j’ai composé mes propres chansons et me suis imposée sur la scène culturelle montréalaise depuis une vingtaine d'années. 

En 2003, mon album Souffles d'Orient, a été nominé dans la catégorie Album de l'année - Musiques du monde au gala de l'ADISQ. 

Mon second album “Lady Sylva”, quant à lui, coup de coeur Renaud-Bray, nous plongeait dans un univers plus intimiste avec une formule piano-voix.

Aujourd’hui, avec une sérénité retrouvée, celle d'une femme, d'une artiste affirmée et socialement engagée, j’ai décidé de me surprendre avec un nouveau projet touchant qui ne demande qu’à être bouclé ?

Pour la pré-production de ce nouvel opus  "À mon père", j’ai décidé de vous (fans, amis et autres amoureux de la musique) impliquer en amont par le biais de cette campagne de préfinancement en collaboration avec l’organisme Hay Doun, dont la mission est d’intégrer les nouveaux arrivants et les plus démunis. 

Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtiendrez

En ce moment, j'ai pu finaliser la 1ère partie du plan de pré-production soit la conception d’une maquette pour mon mini-album grâce entre autre à de précieux collaborateurs qui souhaitent donner un coup de pouce à une artiste indépendante.

Toutefois, maintenant que je finalise la préparation de mon plan de production, je vous sollicite tous, familles, amis, contacts professionnels ou tout autre personne passionnée par mes oeuvres et/ou démarche artistique à vous impliquer dans ce projet passionnant.

Avec votre aide, je pourrai assurément aller de l'avant et franchir les étapes nécessaires à la production du mini-album physique dont l'investissement est assez conséquent. Les fonds que je tente d'obtenir permettront de couvrir:

  • Le coût de production de l'album (enregistrement, mixage, mastering);
  • Les coûts de distribution (graphisme, révision, impression);
  • Les honoraires de l’avocat (droits de propriété intellectuels);
  • Les coûts logistiques;
  • Les coûts de promotion (relations publiques, marketing Web)

 

 

Ce que vous recevrez

En retour de votre participation et de votre contribution, vous pourrez obtenir au choix les récompenses suivantes:

  • Album en version numérique 
  • Album physique (dédicacée ou non dédicacée)
  • Paroles écrites à la main
  • Concert privé
  • Titres de producteur de l'album
  • Et bien d'autres choses encore...

Je vous invite à accéder aux détails des retributions dans la colonne de droite sur cette page.

Impact

Je suis convaincue que ce nouveau projet aura un impact significatif pour ma carrière au Québec et à l'international, il contribuera à faire connaître à un nouveau public des classiques de la chanson française revisités par une artiste identitairement éparpillée.

Risques et défis

Bien que j'aie couvert les coûts pour la maquette du album, ceux liés à la production, aux honoraires de l'avocat pour les droits de propriété intellectuels  vont au-delà de mes ressources financières.

Cette entreprise est un grand défi et je souhaite m'assurer que ce projet soit de grande qualité.

En dehors du défi des ressources financières exigées par un tel projet, l'autre challenge concerne la coordination logistique des livraison estimées. j'ai monté une équipe autour de moi ainsi qui me permettra de vous assurer une expérience d'achat des plus limpides: chaque récompense sera remise en temps et en heure.

Je ne manquerai pas de vous tenir informés tout au long du processus des updates concernant la livraison des récompenses!

Autres manières de contribuer

Pour ceux qui ne peuvent pas faire une contribution monétaire et souhaitent s'impliquer autrement, il vous suffit de partager cette page avec vos amis sur Facebook, Twitter, et toutes autres plateformes de médias sociaux!

Je tiens à remercier d'avance tous mes supporters qui me suivent depuis ces nombreuses années et qui m'ont toujours encouragé à faire ce que je suis. Grâce à votre soutien et votre contribution à cette campagne de prévente, nous ferons de mon nouvel mini-album "À mon Père" un franc succès!

story:
On April 16, 2019, with the help of the pledgers from Indiegogo, I’ve been able to raise the funds to produce a posthumous for my late uncle/godfather Daniel Coulanges who was introduced as "One of the world's finest guitarist." The album is titled "World's Finest" is 30 years in the making with a profound message, I hope if given the opportunity you and I can share this extraordinary story  to address the question; why it's crucial to #KnowMyStatus when in comes to HIV. But with the $1276 is needed to fulfill the reservations that already have made and cover the cost of the licensing fees.

According to the Miami Herald "The Miami-Fort Lauderdale-West Palm Beach metropolitan area led the nation in new HIV diagnoses in 2017, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Florida overtook Louisiana to claim the third-highest rate of new HIV diagnoses per 100,000 people that year, behind Washington, D.C. and Georgia. Read more here: With Florida’s high HIV infection rate, the state should become a leader in prevention

This upcoming spring, I plan to record a modern-day "unforgettable" multigenerational duet of Jacquel Brel's Ne Me Quitte Pas, with my late uncle, along with the help of Chris Palowitch a production manager from the University of Miami Frost School of music.  I would like to invite you to my website http://www.yanatha.com to see a preview of the Worlds' Finest album cover and much more

Here with Dr. Jean Junior after An Evening Celebrating the late Daniel Coulanges who died of HIV in 1989 discussing the wonderful and affordable and sometimes free drugs for this affected with HIV to live a prosperous today.

Pledge today on Indiegogo to reserve the World's Finest album and much more

As featured on the Miami Herald Community Voices 

Kendall man on a mission to remind the world of late uncle’s talent for guitar playing

BY CHRISTINA MAYO

'Paying tribute to a lost loved one can weigh heavily on our hearts. But Kendall resident Yanatha Desouvre has made it his mission to help the world know and remember his guitarist uncle and godfather, Daniel Coulanges, who died in 1989 at 28 of HIV/AIDS complications.

“Imagine the musicians Jimi Hendrix, Kurt Cobain, or Amy Winehouse, who all died at a very young age, had some rare unheard creative works that were never shared with the world. What would you do to get that music to the world?” Desouvre said in an email.

He last saw his godfather 27 years ago when Desouvre was an 11-year-old boy. Coulanges, was a classical Haitian guitarist, “like his award-winning, world-renowned accomplished older brother Amos Coulanges.” Another uncle in the musical family, Nito Coulanges, was in the Haitian gospel band, Echo Mysteriuex.

Desouvre discovered his late godfather’s music through its remarkable journey to him.

A video of Daniel Coulanges playing

"Killing Me Softly"

 

 “Don’t Cry for Me Argentina”

 

traveled from New York to Paris to Miami with Love.

“My Uncle Amos Coulanges said, ‘Nephew, someone told me they have a recording of Daniel playing guitar at a college in Staten Island, New York.’ He told me as soon as he gets it he’ll send me a copy,” Desouvre said.

“I received a gift I will never forget,” he said. “I opened the international package and silence filled the room. I put the DVD in my computer and with each guitar string, my godfather plucked I cried and cried. My godfather was speaking directly to me with each note.”

“He died on April 30, 1989, two years before Magic Johnson made his announcement, and never had an opportunity to share his talent with the world, until now,” Desouvre said.

In the grainy video Coulanges also plays a stunning classical guitar adaption of:

“Ne Me Quitte Pas” by Belgian singer-songwriter Jacques Brel.

 

Desouvre is trying to raise $1,358 update ($1280.71) (Since updated - $1267) through Indiegogo to have the recordings remastered, properly mixed and produced.

He is also trying to raise awareness about HIV testing through the project. Desouvre is a prolific author. He was born in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, grew up in Brooklyn and Philadelphia, and now lives in Kendall with his wife and three children. Another is on the way. He works at the University of Miami.

He said he remembers his godfather in the Brooklyn apartment. He remembers him playing guitar and he said he does not want to throw away his chance to share that music with the world.

“My wife and I named our second daughter Danielle after my godfather. She shares his drive, ambition and sense of humor,” he said.

As for the recording, he said, “I managed to extract the audio from the video performances. I plan to get the songs mastered and produced so we may share this sentimental musical and video project with the world title, ‘Daniel Coulanges — World's Finest — Live in New York’ because that was how the host introduced my godfather.”

He relates to and quotes “Hamilton” creator Lin-Manuel Miranda and the words in Miranda’s Tony acceptance speech: “Nothing here is promised, not one day.”

“I strongly agree with Lin-Manuel Miranda. I also believe since we all only have just one life to live we must all live that life to the fullest,” Desouvre said. “This is a story of how a nephew/godson wants to honor the legacy of his musically gifted late uncle/godfather Daniel Coulanges. That nephew/godson is me.”

Desouvre is planning to release the album for his godfather in January.

“After the album is produced all the proceeds from that album will create a fund to establish and finance a not-for-profit center called Daniel Coulanges Center for Arts, Technology, and Business where there will be workshops and classes for anyone who wants to learn the business of the art that they are passionate about,” Desouvre said.

Read more from the Miami Herald here: 

http://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/community/miami-dade/community-voices/article112293027.html

See Daniel Coulanges's Story featured on Becon-TV's New Haitian Generation

GONE TOO SOON  http://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/community...

The Daniel Coulanges Story has been featured here:

 

 

This is the sixtenth campaign. I first want to thank those who have pledged to parts 1 through 15 of this heartfelt project, I believe I've been called to do. It came short of the goal, whoever I haven't given up yet. The World's Finest project was able to raise  381.54 (including Indiegogo's fees) in Part 1, 335.05 in Part 2 and $85 this heartwarming project, however, the journey continues. If you are a vinyl collector this one is for you.

In 1989, two years before Magic Johnson announced he was HIV-positive, My uncle and godfather lost his life to AIDS; he was a mere 28 years old. Although his life ended far too soon I am working on his legacy will lasting forever with this Indiegogo project to bring the recently found rare recording to life. I'm working with my uncle and godfather's music to raise awareness about HIV, encouraging everyone to know their own HIV status. This is important everywhere, but especially in Miami-Dade County, which Care Sources indicates is the number one county in Florida for new cases of HIV.

It all started last spring when I received a package in the mail. I opened the box, found a video, placed it in his video player, and pressed play. The harmonious sounds of his my late uncle and godfather, Daniel Coulanges, filled the room as he played an unaccompanied classical guitar adaptation of: "Ne Me Quitte Pas, Don’t Cry for Me Argentina, Killing Me Softly and many more I felt my late uncle and godfather's presence as if they were in the same room.

With your pledges, I am confident we will get the music mastered and produce the album.

Have you ever wanted to share your talents with the world? What if you never had a chance to? My late uncle and godfather Daniel Coulanges described as, "The world's finest guitarist" died at the young age of 28 years old on April 30th, 1989 of HIV/AIDS. At that time it was a death sentence. Today with early testing and medicine many are living and thriving with HIV/AIDS.  In Miami, One in 99 Miami-Dade residents is living with HIV or AIDS (one in 67 male and one in 178 female) source careresource.org. Your generous pledge will help awareness of the importance of one knowing their HIV status negative or positive.  

Daniel never had an opportunity to share his talents with the world. Thanks to my other uncle Amos Coulanges, he was able to get rare footage of his late baby brother Daniel performing. My wife and I named our second daughter Danielle after my late godfather/uncle. Danielle has his sense of humor, candidness, and adventure.

This video is  Daniel's cover of "Killing Me Softly." With that rare footage, I was able to extract the audio. However, I need your help from there. With your pledges, I am confident we will able to fully commit and complete this project. This remarkable project includes: 

Digital copy of World's Finest (Live Performance in New York) album 

Physical copy of World's Finest (Live Performance in New York) album 

World's Finest guitar pick 

World's Finest Poster

A World's Finest t-shirt of your own

Credit on the Album

Executive Producer Credit

Digital Download Film of Daniel's Performance in Concert

In the spirit of transparency, here are the approximate breakdowns of the World's Finest costs:

World’s Finest T-shirts $170.00 

Limited CD duplication and distribution $300

Graphic Design - $370

Mastering -$700

World’s Finest posters -$60

Custom World's Finest Guitar Picks - $50

Music License Fees - $117.24

 

$1767.2 + plus $185 (Fulfillment (Shipping and handling Cost)

 

$1952.2 - Funds raised so far $335.05 - $381.54 = 692.87

 

$1235.61 + 125 Indiegogo Fees  ​​

I manage to reduce the cost from the original $2700 down to by not just raising what we've raised but reducing the actual cd production to a smaller amount  to get to the final number of $1280.71 $1358.61 minus 280.71 ($85 minus fees = $79.90) raised from part 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 our this campaign.

By backing this project, it will give us the necessary funding to do four things:

 

1. For professional mastering. We are aiming high and will have this album mastered professionally for your listening pleasure 

2. For production. Once the album is complete, the funding you provide will allow us to bring the album into production and distribution. We have always made sure our albums are packaged beautifully & we want to maintain that standard. We will be fulfilling the orders of the t-shirts, posters and cd's

3. Professional graphic design. Because we are working with aged images we want those images to be restored and the graphics and text to be as professionally done as possible and your funding will help us get there.

4.Edit the concert video. Editing the aged footage will take some time and with your pledges, the editing will be done and distributed to you to enjoy watching over and over again

With your pledges, I am confident we will support this project fully funded 

World's Finest Live in New York album Tracklist​

 

1. Etude No 17 

2. Adelita

3. Maria

4. Capricho Árabe

5. Valse Vénézuelienne

6. Valse Vénézuelienne (reprise)

7. Spanish Roman (Romance de Espana)

8. Killing Me Softly 

9. La Bohème

10. Ne Me Quitte Pas (Don't Leave Me)

11. Don't Cry for Me Argentina

12. Chason Latine

13. Sine

14. Nan Fon Bwa

15. M Pap Pale Man Pawôl

16. Belle Haîti

17. Ti Zandô (unmastered)

18. Kouzin (unmastered)

ONE LAST THING​

I encourage everyone reading this to pursue your passion intentionally with purpose because if you don't; no one else will. No one is promised tomorrow so why not pursue your passion with the natural gifts that you've been given right NOW.

To paraphrase a conversation I recently had with someone. We are killing ourselves softly with each moment that passes when we don't at least attempt to express and share our talents with each other. But letting your light shine you unknowingly inspire others to shine their lights as well. It is never too late until it is.

RISKS and CHALLENGES​

The risk and challenges that come with completing this project are not getting the funds to produce the album in a professional manner. With your pledges, I am confident we will support this project fully funded​

But with the $1276 is needed to fulfill the reservations that already have made and cover the cost of the licensing fees.
According to the Miami Herald "The Miami-Fort Lauderdale-West Palm Beach metropolitan area led the nation in new HIV diagnoses in 2017, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Florida overtook Louisiana to claim the third-highest rate of new HIV diagnoses per 100,000 people that year, behind Washington, D.C. and Georgia. Read more here: With Florida’s high HIV infection rate, the state should become a leader in prevention
This upcoming spring, I plan to record a modern-day "unforgettable" multigenerational duet of Jacquel Brel's Ne Me Quitte Pas, with my late uncle, along with the help of Chris Palowitch a production manager from the University of Miami Frost School of music.  I would like to invite you to my website http://www.yanatha.com to see a preview of the Worlds' Finest album cover and much more
Here with Dr. Jean Junior after An Evening Celebrating the late Daniel Coulanges who died of HIV in 1989 discussing the wonderful and affordable and sometimes free drugs for this affected with HIV to live a prosperous today.
Pledge today on Indiegogo to reserve the World's Finest album and much more
As featured on the Miami Herald Community Voices 
Kendall man on a mission to remind the world of late uncle’s talent for guitar playing
BY CHRISTINA MAYO
'Paying tribute to a lost loved one can weigh heavily on our hearts. But Kendall resident Yanatha Desouvre has made it his mission to help the world know and remember his guitarist uncle and godfather, Daniel Coulanges, who died in 1989 at 28 of HIV/AIDS complications.
“Imagine the musicians Jimi Hendrix, Kurt Cobain, or Amy Winehouse, who all died at a very young age, had some rare unheard creative works that were never shared with the world. What would you do to get that music to the world?” Desouvre said in an email.
He last saw his godfather 27 years ago when Desouvre was an 11-year-old boy. Coulanges, was a classical Haitian guitarist, “like his award-winning, world-renowned accomplished older brother Amos Coulanges.” Another uncle in the musical family, Nito Coulanges, was in the Haitian gospel band, Echo Mysteriuex.
Desouvre discovered his late godfather’s music through its remarkable journey to him.
A video of Daniel Coulanges playing
"Killing Me Softly"


 

 “Don’t Cry for Me Argentina”


 

traveled from New York to Paris to Miami with Love.
“My Uncle Amos Coulanges said, ‘Nephew, someone told me they have a recording of Daniel playing guitar at a college in Staten Island, New York.’ He told me as soon as he gets it he’ll send me a copy,” Desouvre said.
“I received a gift I will never forget,” he said. “I opened the international package and silence filled the room. I put the DVD in my computer and with each guitar string, my godfather plucked I cried and cried. My godfather was speaking directly to me with each note.”
“He died on April 30, 1989, two years before Magic Johnson made his announcement, and never had an opportunity to share his talent with the world, until now,” Desouvre said.
In the grainy video Coulanges also plays a stunning classical guitar adaption of:
“Ne Me Quitte Pas” by Belgian singer-songwriter Jacques Brel.


 

Desouvre is trying to raise $1,358 update ($1280.71) (Since updated - $1267) through Indiegogo to have the recordings remastered, properly mixed and produced.
He is also trying to raise awareness about HIV testing through the project. Desouvre is a prolific author. He was born in Port-au-Prince, Haiti, grew up in Brooklyn and Philadelphia, and now lives in Kendall with his wife and three children. Another is on the way. He works at the University of Miami.
He said he remembers his godfather in the Brooklyn apartment. He remembers him playing guitar and he said he does not want to throw away his chance to share that music with the world.
“My wife and I named our second daughter Danielle after my godfather. She shares his drive, ambition and sense of humor,” he said.
As for the recording, he said, “I managed to extract the audio from the video performances. I plan to get the songs mastered and produced so we may share this sentimental musical and video project with the world title, ‘Daniel Coulanges — World's Finest — Live in New York’ because that was how the host introduced my godfather.”
He relates to and quotes “Hamilton” creator Lin-Manuel Miranda and the words in Miranda’s Tony acceptance speech: “Nothing here is promised, not one day.”
“I strongly agree with Lin-Manuel Miranda. I also believe since we all only have just one life to live we must all live that life to the fullest,” Desouvre said. “This is a story of how a nephew/godson wants to honor the legacy of his musically gifted late uncle/godfather Daniel Coulanges. That nephew/godson is me.”
Desouvre is planning to release the album for his godfather in January.
“After the album is produced all the proceeds from that album will create a fund to establish and finance a not-for-profit center called Daniel Coulanges Center for Arts, Technology, and Business where there will be workshops and classes for anyone who wants to learn the business of the art that they are passionate about,” Desouvre said.
Read more from the Miami Herald here: 
http://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/community/miami-dade/community-voices/article112293027.html
See Daniel Coulanges's Story featured on Becon-TV's New Haitian Generation

GONE TOO SOON  http://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/community...
The Daniel Coulanges Story has been featured here:
 




 

This is the sixtenth campaign. I first want to thank those who have pledged to parts 1 through 15 of this heartfelt project, I believe I've been called to do. It came short of the goal, whoever I haven't given up yet. The World's Finest project was able to raise  381.54 (including Indiegogo's fees) in Part 1, 335.05 in Part 2 and $85 this heartwarming project, however, the journey continues. If you are a vinyl collector this one is for you.
In 1989, two years before Magic Johnson announced he was HIV-positive, My uncle and godfather lost his life to AIDS; he was a mere 28 years old. Although his life ended far too soon I am working on his legacy will lasting forever with this Indiegogo project to bring the recently found rare recording to life. I'm working with my uncle and godfather's music to raise awareness about HIV, encouraging everyone to know their own HIV status. This is important everywhere, but especially in Miami-Dade County, which Care Sources indicates is the number one county in Florida for new cases of HIV.
It all started last spring when I received a package in the mail. I opened the box, found a video, placed it in his video player, and pressed play. The harmonious sounds of his my late uncle and godfather, Daniel Coulanges, filled the room as he played an unaccompanied classical guitar adaptation of: "Ne Me Quitte Pas, Don’t Cry for Me Argentina, Killing Me Softly and many more I felt my late uncle and godfather's presence as if they were in the same room.
With your pledges, I am confident we will get the music mastered and produce the album.
Have you ever wanted to share your talents with the world? What if you never had a chance to? My late uncle and godfather Daniel Coulanges described as, "The world's finest guitarist" died at the young age of 28 years old on April 30th, 1989 of HIV/AIDS. At that time it was a death sentence. Today with early testing and medicine many are living and thriving with HIV/AIDS.  In Miami, One in 99 Miami-Dade residents is living with HIV or AIDS (one in 67 male and one in 178 female) source careresource.org. Your generous pledge will help awareness of the importance of one knowing their HIV status negative or positive.  
Daniel never had an opportunity to share his talents with the world. Thanks to my other uncle Amos Coulanges, he was able to get rare footage of his late baby brother Daniel performing. My wife and I named our second daughter Danielle after my late godfather/uncle. Danielle has his sense of humor, candidness, and adventure.
This video is  Daniel's cover of "Killing Me Softly." With that rare footage, I was able to extract the audio. However, I need your help from there. With your pledges, I am confident we will able to fully commit and complete this project. This remarkable project includes: 
Digital copy of World's Finest (Live Performance in New York) album 
Physical copy of World's Finest (Live Performance in New York) album 
World's Finest guitar pick 
World's Finest Poster
A World's Finest t-shirt of your own
Credit on the Album
Executive Producer Credit
Digital Download Film of Daniel's Performance in Concert
In the spirit of transparency, here are the approximate breakdowns of the World's Finest costs:
World’s Finest T-shirts $170.00 
Limited CD duplication and distribution $300
Graphic Design - $370
Mastering -$700
World’s Finest posters -$60
Custom World's Finest Guitar Picks - $50
Music License Fees - $117.24
 
$1767.2 + plus $185 (Fulfillment (Shipping and handling Cost)
 
$1952.2 - Funds raised so far $335.05 - $381.54 = 692.87
 
$1235.61 + 125 Indiegogo Fees  ​​
I manage to reduce the cost from the original $2700 down to by not just raising what we've raised but reducing the actual cd production to a smaller amount  to get to the final number of $1280.71 $1358.61 minus 280.71 ($85 minus fees = $79.90) raised from part 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 our this campaign.
By backing this project, it will give us the necessary funding to do four things:
 
1. For professional mastering. We are aiming high and will have this album mastered professionally for your listening pleasure 
2. For production. Once the album is complete, the funding you provide will allow us to bring the album into production and distribution. We have always made sure our albums are packaged beautifully & we want to maintain that standard. We will be fulfilling the orders of the t-shirts, posters and cd's
3. Professional graphic design. Because we are working with aged images we want those images to be restored and the graphics and text to be as professionally done as possible and your funding will help us get there.
4.Edit the concert video. Editing the aged footage will take some time and with your pledges, the editing will be done and distributed to you to enjoy watching over and over again
With your pledges, I am confident we will support this project fully funded 
World's Finest Live in New York album Tracklist​
 
1. Etude No 17 
2. Adelita
3. Maria
4. Capricho Árabe
5. Valse Vénézuelienne
6. Valse Vénézuelienne (reprise)
7. Spanish Roman (Romance de Espana)
8. Killing Me Softly 
9. La Bohème
10. Ne Me Quitte Pas (Don't Leave Me)
11. Don't Cry for Me Argentina
12. Chason Latine
13. Sine
14. Nan Fon Bwa
15. M Pap Pale Man Pawôl
16. Belle Haîti
17. Ti Zandô (unmastered)
18. Kouzin (unmastered)
ONE LAST THING​
I encourage everyone reading this to pursue your passion intentionally with purpose because if you don't; no one else will. No one is promised tomorrow so why not pursue your passion with the natural gifts that you've been given right NOW.
To paraphrase a conversation I recently had with someone. We are killing ourselves softly with each moment that passes when we don't at least attempt to express and share our talents with each other. But letting your light shine you unknowingly inspire others to shine their lights as well. It is never too late until it is.
RISKS and CHALLENGES​
The risk and challenges that come with completing this project are not getting the funds to produce the album in a professional manner. With your pledges, I am confident we will support this project fully funded​

story:
Short Summary

"The Oubliette" is the fifth full-length album coming from The Reticent and like its predecessor, "On The Eve Of A Goodbye," this record will be an intense autobiographical concept record - this time focusing on Alzheimer's disease.  Having witnessed the profound and devastating impact of Alzheimer's firsthand, I have found it imperative to craft an album of substance and quality.  As such, I am seeking to return to my friend and producer Jamie King (BTBAM, Scale The Summit, Contortionist, etc.) at the Basement Studios to record this album and make it as intense and enriching as it possibly can be.

What We Need & What You Get

The Goal is to raise at least $3,000 to cover the cost of the recording.  A stretch goal of $4,000 would ensure that funds are ready to get the first ever vinyl pressing of an album from The Reticent.

The perks we offer for donating include: 

  • getting the album in physical form before anyone else
  • special edition shirts (limited to 25)
  • special edition hoodies (limited to 20)
  • signed gear from the recording of "The Oubliette" and "On The Eve Of A Goodbye" including drum heads, cymbals, and sheet music with notes
  • a live private performance by The Reticent with a setlist of your choosing

 

The Impact

As stated in the campaign video, Alzheimer's is the 6th leading cause of death in the US and about half of all adults over 85 have the disease.  The disease often gets reduced to just "forgetfulness" or "senility" but it is substantially more pernicious than those colloquial descriptions.  Art and more specifically music has a way of reaching people and opening them up to experiences that they may not understand.  While we have no illusions about this album become a worldwide phenomenon, it nonetheless may reach people that can benefit from it.  Those that have watched a love one pass from the illness, those that currently know or care for someone with the illness, and those that may want to know more about the illness.  As has long been the case, the goal of The Reticent is to make music that means something and can do something as well.  As we did with suicide prevention organizations when "On The Eve Of A Goodbye" was released, The Reticent will be donating funds from the album and holding fundraising performances for organizations such as the Alzheimer's Association, the American Brain Foundation, and the Alive Inside Foundation (a group that seeks to provide Alzheimer's patients with music).

Risks & Challenges

As with any album, hiccups may occur in the recording process.  Though we have every expectation of completing the record in a timely manner, unforeseen circumstances could cause delays or setbacks.  The good news is that the material is all completely written and ready to be recorded so any technical issues or illnesses preventing recording (or affecting vocal quality) would be merely temporary delays.  Having recorded at the Basement Studios before and working with Jamie King already, the rhythm of the process should be even better than on "Eve."

Perks will be available once the process is completed and, again, any delays in delivering the rewards would only be minor and/or temporary.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to back this project financially at this time, I nonetheless appreciate you taking the time to look into this campaign.  What can you do instead?  Please share this campaign on your social media!  You can also listen to and share the music of The Reticent!

If you'd like to be involved in some Alzheimer's disease nonprofit organizations please visit this site that has a plethora of groups with which to start:  https://www.verywellhealth.com/leading-alzheime...
