story:
About Us 

Who we are 

Award-winning musicians, our artists are alumni and faculty members of the Cleveland Institute of Music, the Juilliard School, the Hans Eisler Music Academy in Berlin, and the Zurich School of the Arts. We are all committed to exploring new, innovative ways of engaging audiences from various sectors of the community. MIC is lead by its founder and artistic director, pianist Or Re'em, with assistance from composer-in-residence Chris Neiner.

Callisto String Quartet: https://www.callistoquartet.com
Grand prize winners of the 2018 Fischoff National Chamber Music Competition

Our Mission 

Our mission is to increase the accessibility of classical music to the community. The project will empower and connect people through musical collaborations and shared values. Our festival is a celebration of community partnerships which we would like to strengthen for the benefit of the local music scene. 

How MIC came about 

The summer months, and July in particular, are a time when musical activity in University Circle is curtailed. The Cleveland Orchestra plays at the Blossom Music Center and most music students and faculty members of the Cleveland Institute of Music are away for summer festivals. We identified a need for high quality and accessible musical programs for the community.  We would like to utilize the wealth of resources and facilities, as well as the existing infrastructure in the area to offer a summer series, a rejuvenating addition to the local scene.  

How we’ll make it happen 

Diverse Programming  

MIC concerts feature all-time favorite gems of the chamber music repertoire, alongside exciting new music, composed and curated by our Composer-in-Residence Chris Neiner. Our festival celebrates emerging musicians and composers, introducing a fresh and dynamic addition to the traditional music scene. One of our programs will be tailored to young children and their families and will be complemented by narration. 

Engaging the Next Generation

Diverse Venue Settings 

Our festival will present an authentic, intimate connection between our audience and the collaborating artists. We will present our concerts in well-established concert venues as well as non-traditional spaces. The Cleveland Institute of Music will sponsor one of our concerts, and the gala concert will be held on July 14th at the Cleveland Museum of Art, followed by a reception at Judson Manor, who will host an additional concert. We will offer concerts at the Cleveland Public Library, the University Circle United Methodist Church, Council Gardens, Jennings Center for Adults, and numerous other locations! There will be a concert at NIGHTTOWN Restaurant and Bar, featuring a variety of musical styles.  

Intergenerational Collaboration 

The project is presented in collaboration with Judson Manor, a retirement community which serves as home for the Cleveland’s Women’s Orchestra, as well as Theatre in the Circle. The artists traveling from abroad will be offered residency at Judson Manor, including room and board, as well as rehearsal facilities. In recognition of this kind and generous hospitality, we will offer a free program at the Manor’s newly-renovated ballroom. Several of the residents of the Manor are former music industry professionals. They will serve as ambassadors of the project, sharing their knowledge and experience, hosting the resident-musicians and ushering for the various events. Another aspect of the intergenerational partnership will be reflected in young promising artists working together with established ones, sharing a wealth of knowledge and experience between one generation and the next.      

Bringing music to the community in collaboration with Judson Manor

Interdisciplinary Collaboration 

Our concerts will also be a product of collaboration with artists of other disciplines, to offer new perspective on the traditional concert experience, exploring the various possible relationships between different media of expression.   

Building and strengthening community partnerships 

Supporting organizations 

We are thrilled and honored to collaborate with various organizations, as well as Cleveland's leading musical institutions. With their support, Music in the Circle will celebrate a legacy of excellence, community engagement and leadership. The numerous institutions collaborating with us include the Cleveland Institute of Music, the Cleveland International Piano Competition, Judson Manor, the Jewish Federation of Cleveland and the America-Israel Cultural Foundation. 

Cleveland Institute of Music – Mixon Hall

Supporting Local Businesses 

We have been fortunate and grateful to receive support from several local businesses, such as Segelin’s Flower Shop, Tudor Arms Hotel and Etna Ristorante and Wine Bar.  We look forward to engaging more local businesses with Music in the Circle! 

Our budget

The Costs

Our festival costs about $10,000 to produce. We will be funding international travel for artists, renting well-established concert venues, securing staff support and security, and creating high-quality printed materials. As a group of individuals, we alone cannot fund a project of such broad scope.

Our costs breakdown into nine categories:

Artist Transportation by flying = $3,000
Artist transportation by driving = $750
Venue Rental Fees = $2,000
Printed materials = $2,000
Staff And Security Fees = $1,000 
Online Promotion = $500
Piano Tuning = $300
Ticketing Services = $250
Postage to Deliver Perks = $200

Surpassing Our Goal

We are committed to creating this festival. If you, our supporters, give us the gift of surpassing our $10,000 goal, the extra funds will go towards honorariums for our artists, press and radio advertisments, multi-camera video recording of performances, audio editing and production, and additional funds for our gala reception.

Your contribution

Our project has gained wide support from the community. Nevertheless, we must raise sufficient funds to secure compensation for our artists' travels as well as covering the rental fees for our venues. We rely on contributions coming from individuals who share the conviction in our cause and are willing to support making our vision a reality. Please consider donating for our project! We would be eternally grateful for any contribution of any size!

story:
Hello and welcome to our campaign to raise funds to record and release our new album!

We - Quest Ensemble - Filipe Sousa (piano),  Preetha Narayanan (violin) and  Tara Franks (cello) have been playing and composing together for nearly 10 years. We're driven by a curiosity to explore how three individual voices can become greater than the sum of their parts and so we write all our music collaboratively.

Since our first album ‘Footfall’ was released in 2014, amongst an array of other performance and community projects, we have been playing and creating away together and...

We are really excited to finally be recording this second album ' The Other Side' – a collection of new pieces we have been developing, remaking, reshaping over the last few years - the results of a long journey of digging, investigating and finding our sound as a trio.  Unlike 'Footfall', which we chose to record live, this time we have decided to work in a radically new way for us, multi-tracking our parts to make a studio album with talented producer/composer Fred Thomas. 

 

Why now?

‘It all started with a drop of ink and a musical note’

In Autumn 2018 we were commissioned to create a large-scale cross arts show at the Big Bang Festival, CCB Lisbon - with wonderful visual artist and friend Somang Lee (who will create the artwork for the album).  It was a truly inspiring experience that brought our new compositions alive both sonically and visually.  This geared us up to put our next collection of work out into the world as  'The Other Side'.  The launch of which will sit alongside the tour of our show ‘It all started…’

 

The back story

We first met at Guildhall School of Music and Drama in 2008 and since then we have created our own collaborative way of composing music. We write by ear, we use improvisation and develop pieces from small starting points. The process is completely collaborative, takes time and requires democracy (not always easy!). We draw on our varied influences from contemporary classical, to world folk to jazz, and subsequently...fit into no one set genre box.

 

Collaboration and making music with others

Over the last decade we have worked together in many creative settings. Individually and collectively, we've performed with influential artists including Kate Tempest, Sam Lee, Anoushka Shankar, Manu Delago, Talvin Singh, and Jocelyn Pook, amongst others. We have written music with young musicians, old and non-musicians, been commissioned to write music for dance and theatre pieces, worked with orchestras, in care homes, in prisons, with babies, parents and more - all alongside creating our own repertoire of music as a trio.

Writing music with others is really important to us and feeds back into our work as a trio. 

 

How you can help

  • BY SIGNING UP TO A PERK: From pre-ordering a copy of the album to having us come and play in your sitting room you will enable us to fund the production (recording, mixing, mastering) studio hire, album art work and printing costs.

  • THE MONEY: We need £6200 to finish recording and mixing and mastering the music, this includes studio rental and producer's and engineers' fees. The additional £3200 will go towards the art work of the project, manufacturing a short run of CDs and Vinyls and some PR support.

  • ABOUT THE GOAL: If we do not make the £9400 goal it will simply take longer to finish the album. We're committed to making it happen.

  • If we raise more than the goal, we'll make a high quality music video, press more vinyl, and invest in publishing and PR to push the project further. Donations of all amounts are greatly appreciated. 

  • You don't need to claim a perk to make a contribution

  • AND you can always contribute a higher amount than the perk level you wish to claim.

 

Thank you

We are so grateful for your support to record, produce and mix our second album at this turning point. 

We totally understand that so many musicians and artists are in the same boat and constantly working out how to support their work and keep it going. Any way you can help is massively appreciated – a pre-order of the album or even sharing the campaign with anyone else you think might to support.

Thank you!

Tara (cello), Preetha (violin) and Filipe (piano)
 

Press

“Compositionally complex, inventive in technique, and wonderfully ambiguous in tonality, this was a joy to behold” ~Jazzwize

“The interplay of musical lines is dextrous and intriguing” ~ London Jazz News

"The group’s attractive blend of classical textures, jazz techniques and emotive melodies speak directly and emotively" ~ **** Sinfini Music

"Quest ensemble was one of the revelations of the Big Bang festival in 2018. Blending outstanding music with visual arts..." - Wouter Van Looy, Director of The Big Bang Festival
 

Bio

Patchworks of interwoven rhythmic counterpoint and minimal grooves are counterbalanced with lyrical melodic lines. With nods to influences as broad as the contemporary minimalism of John Adams and Steve Reich, the experimental melancholic textures of Radiohead to the progressive jazz precision of Brad Mehldau, Quest Ensemble’s music inhabits its own soundworld somewhere in the gaps between chamber, jazz, folk and contemporary classical music.

Questensemble.co.uk

Listen on:

Bandcamp

Soundcloud

Youtube

 

https://youtu.be/S4UNPKLAV-s
story_txt:
Hello and welcome to our campaign to raise funds to record and release our new album!
We - Quest Ensemble - Filipe Sousa (piano),  Preetha Narayanan (violin) and  Tara Franks (cello) have been playing and composing together for nearly 10 years. We're driven by a curiosity to explore how three individual voices can become greater than the sum of their parts and so we write all our music collaboratively.
Since our first album ‘Footfall’ was released in 2014, amongst an array of other performance and community projects, we have been playing and creating away together and...
We are really excited to finally be recording this second album ' The Other Side' – a collection of new pieces we have been developing, remaking, reshaping over the last few years - the results of a long journey of digging, investigating and finding our sound as a trio.  Unlike 'Footfall', which we chose to record live, this time we have decided to work in a radically new way for us, multi-tracking our parts to make a studio album with talented producer/composer Fred Thomas. 
 
Why now?
‘It all started with a drop of ink and a musical note’
In Autumn 2018 we were commissioned to create a large-scale cross arts show at the Big Bang Festival, CCB Lisbon - with wonderful visual artist and friend Somang Lee (who will create the artwork for the album).  It was a truly inspiring experience that brought our new compositions alive both sonically and visually.  This geared us up to put our next collection of work out into the world as  'The Other Side'.  The launch of which will sit alongside the tour of our show ‘It all started…’
 
The back story
We first met at Guildhall School of Music and Drama in 2008 and since then we have created our own collaborative way of composing music. We write by ear, we use improvisation and develop pieces from small starting points. The process is completely collaborative, takes time and requires democracy (not always easy!). We draw on our varied influences from contemporary classical, to world folk to jazz, and subsequently...fit into no one set genre box. Collaboration and making music with others
Over the last decade we have worked together in many creative settings. Individually and collectively, we've performed with influential artists including Kate Tempest, Sam Lee, Anoushka Shankar, Manu Delago, Talvin Singh, and Jocelyn Pook, amongst others. We have written music with young musicians, old and non-musicians, been commissioned to write music for dance and theatre pieces, worked with orchestras, in care homes, in prisons, with babies, parents and more - all alongside creating our own repertoire of music as a trio.
Writing music with others is really important to us and feeds back into our work as a trio.

ABOUT THE GOAL: If we do not make the £9400 goal it will simply take longer to finish the album. We're committed to making it happen.
If we raise more than the goal, we'll make a high quality music video, press more vinyl, and invest in publishing and PR to push the project further. Donations of all amounts are greatly appreciated. 
You don't need to claim a perk to make a contribution
AND you can always contribute a higher amount than the perk level you wish to claim.

 
Thank you
We are so grateful for your support to record, produce and mix our second album at this turning point. 
We totally understand that so many musicians and artists are in the same boat and constantly working out how to support their work and keep it going. Any way you can help is massively appreciated – a pre-order of the album or even sharing the campaign with anyone else you think might to support.
Thank you!
Tara (cello), Preetha (violin) and Filipe (piano) 
Press

Blending outstanding music with visual arts..." - Wouter Van Looy, Director of The Big Bang Festival BioPatchworks of interwoven rhythmic counterpoint and minimal grooves are counterbalanced with lyrical melodic lines. story:
With your support we will be able to upgrade our recording studio which will allow us to release more songs and albums. We Plan on releasing tons of originals and covers and once our fan base gets big enough we will tour. It all starts with the studio. 

We started this band not even a year ago releasing our own music.  Look how big we have gotten. Just imagine if we had proper recording equipment and could tour. We would be one of the biggest metal bands out there. There is a big void in the metal community and we are filling it!

WE NEED YOUR HELP

The band will also help with the big picture! You know what that is Piggies! :)

OUR STORY

Written by Music Journalist that wants to remain anonymous

Yours Faithfully, LP22399

When was the last time you heard music that made you feel? That tapped into some inner primal part of you that cried out to make some kind of change? That made you so enchanted that you wanted to submit entirely to someone? I am willing to bet that it has been a while if it has ever happened to you at all. well I am here to tell you about something that may just change your life!

A new band called Longpig and the Femcans. If you have at least a passing interest in cannibal fantasies then it likely you have come across at least one song by this powerful new Metal band looking to subtly insert the longpig mindset into a generation of potential meals. If you haven’t then you are missing out for sure. This isn’t a gimmick or a joke these are dedicated cannibals who just happen to have the talent to tap into some hard-wired response that sits in the minds of a very select portion of the population who have the aching desire to be call pigs and treated as such.

These are a singular group of people who have found the perfect niche and speak directly to an audience that has for a very long time been looking for a voice that understands them and this is it!

But, and I feel I should mention, if you are not so much into the cannibal life then please don’t let what I have just said put you off. If you have even a passing interest in any kind of heavy metal then you will find Longpig and the Femcans to be very good at what they do. what they do is powerful domineering rock and roll music executed masterfully, with elements of classic bands like Motorhead but with a very dark almost industrial modern twist that really makes the music pop and leaves the listener questioning whether or not they really do want to end up on someones dinner table…

They currently have two songs listed on their site with more to come and it it rare to see any band with nothing but positive reviews seriously, nobody so far has a bad thing to say! and there is a good reason for that as you will see for yourselves if you give them a listen. we are all very much hoping that they will soon release more tracks to to the public.

And of course I can only recommend that you drop these people a line, the entire project is crowd funded and any growth they have planed relies enterly on their fans getting involved and spreading the word to where ever it needs to be spread. They are looking to tour and asking people to help them make it it happen, and I for one its well worth while to make that happen if for no other reason than its refreshing to see passionate people doing what they love, working for a cause and I believe that this particular cause is very noble indeed.


What We Need & What You Get

1. Alienware Area 51 Computer $3,000
2. Cakewalk sonar Platinum $600
3. Sure SM7B Microphone $500
4. Manley Core Vocal Compressor  $2,000
5.Alesis Elevate 6 Monitors x2 $300

The Impact

If we have a studio upgrade we can create more and better music for you to hear and enjoy

Risks & Challenges

We will be recording the new album with the new equipment so may not finish the album on time but you will receive the tunes as they are created. You will not have to wait
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute monetarily or buy a perk, THAT'S OK!  You're support is enough to keep us happy.  There are other ways you can help though: by telling your friends, reposting the campaign link, and sharing it on your social networks.

story:
*****English below*******

J'ai attendu longtemps avant de faire ce premier disque et je suis vraiment fier de "Lungta".

C'est le résultat de plusieurs années de travail et de relations avec des musiciens fantastiques.

Ce fût une incroyable aventure où j'ai eu la contribution de plus de 30 excellents musiciens, ingénieurs, photographes... Ils ont travaillé corps et âme pour faire briller "Lungta".

J'ai financé ce projet moi-même et j'ai maintenant besoin de votre aide pour franchir la ligne d'arrivée.

J'ai besoin de 4500$ pour couvrir les dernières dépenses liées au lancement du disque :

- Graphisme de la pochette du disque

- Duplication de disque ( belle pochette à 6 panneaux)

-Création d'un site web pour la promotion du disque

-Frais pour faire venir David Binney de New York à Montréal pour le concert-lancement du 2 avril  prochain à L'Astral.

Avec votre soutien, la sortie de "Lungta" sera couronnée de succès. J'ai hâte de partager ce disque avec vous!

Merci de partager à tous vos amis!


**********************************************************************

I've waited a long time to make my first record and I'm really proud of "Lungta".

It's the result of many years of work and relationships with fantastic  musicians.

 It's been  such a great adventure where I had the contribution from more than 30 great musicians, engineers, photographers... All of them put in all their soul to make "Lungta" shine.

I self-funded this tremendous project and now I need your help to cross the finish line.


I need 4500$ to cover the following last expenses with the release of the record:

- Art work for the cd cover

- Duplication of the record. (nice 6 panel jacket)

- Website to promote the record

- Expenses to bring David Binney to Montreal from New York for the coming April 2nd concert-launch at L'Astral


With your support, the release  of "Lungta" will be a success. I'm looking forward sharing this record with you!


Please share to all your friends!


****************************************************************************



philippecote.com

story:
My Dream, My Passion, My Vision

Four years ago I moved to Lincoln, Nebraska and fell in love with the local live music scene. It all began at The Cask, where I worked as a bartender and became enthralled with the live music we had every Friday and Saturday. My involvement in local live music grew into friendships with the musicians, booking music, managing musicians, creating and running an open mic night, and lastly, creating a business centered around helping local musicians and music-related ventures with social media, marketing, and promotion.

Through my experience with local live music in Lincoln, as a music fan, working in venues as a bartender/booking agent/event planner, and on the musician’s side of things as a manager, I developed a dream to create a music venue that was centered around supporting local artists, paying artists a decent wage, respecting artists, having the best sound possible, and as a result, creating an incredible live music experience for fans through our focus on having very happy artists.

I found a home for my vision at the Night Owl Pub when I struck up a business partnership between myself, with Storm Media Management, and the owner, Chris Rosiak. I relocated my open mic from The Cask to the Night Owl, purchased over $1000 worth of equipment, named my open mic Lincoln Open Mic Night, and took over booking music at the Night Owl, all in the span of a few weeks. Things are going REALLY well! But we NEED more equipment!

Because the Night Owl Pub is so focused on supporting all things local—local breweries, local musicians, local writers, local artists—I’ve decided to help speed the equipment purchase and installation along by calling on local people to support this mission. The goal here is to raise enough money to purchase the rest of the equipment we need to have stage lighting and all sound permanently placed, ready for an artist or band to plug in, and a sound booth for professional sound engineers to operate. 

What We Need and What You Get

Sound Equipment:

FRONT OF HOUSE

Behringer X32 Digital Mixer, Grundorf 12U rack case, DBX 1231 Graphic, EQ DBX 266XL Compressor/Gate I/O Cable

Power Cables, Shorty XLR Cables, 12 Channel Snake, 6 Channel Snake (back line) (3) DBX Compressor/Gates + cabling (2) Dual channel 15-band EQ's +cabling

STAGE & SOUND

AC Mains, Spekon to 1⁄4 cables mains, AC Subs, Spekon to 1⁄4 cables, AC Drum Wedges, Daisy chain speaker cables, Yamaha BR15M, Spekon to 1⁄4 cables (monitors) Rack for power/etc. (static) Crown XLS 802 Crown CE1000

Crown CE 4000 Power Cables, 1) Crown 402, 602, or 802XLS + cabling (1) Power Conditioner/Sequencer (1) DBX 3way Stereo Crossover + cabling FOH signal cabling

***If you're into Lincoln history, the system being purchased here is from the old Duggan's Pub and it's kind of a nice passing of the torch from one historical music venue to another working on making history.

LED Stage Lighting

The first order of business is going to be getting all of the sound equipment in, so even if the goal isn’t reached, what money is raised will be going to the sound equipment first, stage and lighting second.

If we exceed the goal, the extra money will go to sound engineers, additional sound equipment, and other things needed to enhance the live music experience for everyone!

What you'll get is an incredible new home for live local music and art here in Lincoln!

The Impact

I have a much larger vision for the Night Owl Pub than just creating a new live music venue. I’m taking my love of our local music here in Lincoln to a new level with my business, Storm Media Management. I’m taking photo and video of the artists and writing about them in my blog. I’m building a YouTube channel full of amazing local talent and I plan to use my increasing knowledge of social media to spread the word far beyond Lincoln.

The Night Owl Pub is my home base, and has all the ingredients necessary to create a new music scene here in Lincoln. A great music venue can do that. The timing couldn’t be better as Lincoln is becoming recognized as a music city while simultaneously losing a great deal of live music venues (most recently Knickerbockers and The Cask to name a few.)

We have an AWESOME team working to bring all of this together. The Night Owl has a very enthusiastic, hard-working owner in Chris as well as Red Rebel Media building a killer website for The Night Owl and running social media promotional efforts, and then there’s me with all my drive and passion running Lincoln Open Night through Storm Media Management.

We’ve already created an awesome green room, which is about to have its walls lined with black and white, signed posters of all our “green-room-worthy” local artists who’ve played The Owl. It looks like something straight out of Rolling Stone magazine and we are already imagining photos of bands chilling on the L-shaped couches surrounded by all the black and white, signed posters.

Risks & Challenges

There’s no risk here, just the challenge of getting all the tools we need to grow at a faster rate with the help of the community than we’d be able to accomplish on our own. If you’re a musician, music-lover, a writer, an artist, or an art-lover, then it’s beneficial for you to jump on board and throw a few dollars into this campaign, because we’re creating a home for you guys! 

Other Ways You Can Help

You don’t have to contribute financially in order to help! Helping get the word out by sharing this campaign page or just showing up and/or bringing people to the launch party Saturday, March 19th is a HUGE contribution to this cause!

You can share this campaign page across any social media platform or just tell people about it!

I want to send a HUGE THANK YOU to those who have already shared my posts about this campaign as I was in the process of creating it, to those who have already signed up to help in the launch party creation, as well as promises to donate, and THANK YOU in advance to all those who will be contributing over the course of the campaign! Love to YOU ALL!

help of the community than we’d be able to accomplish on our own. If you’re a
musician, music-lover, a writer, an artist, or an art-lover, then it’s
beneficial for you to jump on board and throw a few dollars into this campaign,
because we’re creating a home for you guys! 

Other Ways You Can Help 

You don’t have to contribute
financially in order to help! Helping get the word out by sharing this campaign
page or just showing up and/or bringing people to the launch party Saturday,
March 19th is a HUGE contribution to this cause! 
You can share this campaign page across any social media platform
or just tell people about it!
I want to send a HUGE THANK YOU to those who have already
shared my posts about this campaign as I was in the process of creating it, to
those who have already signed up to help in the launch party creation, as well
as promises to donate, and THANK YOU in advance to all those who will be
contributing over the course of the campaign! Love to YOU ALL!

story:
Dem Bones are at a crossroad with a great opportunity of game-changing caliber: with YOUR HELP our debut EP will be recorded at at Evolution Studios in Oxford, one of the best studios in the UK, and produced by Nick Moorbath. 

WHO ARE DEM BONES?

Dem Bones was founded by myself, Demian Boas, with a handful of original songs and a pocketful of dreams in 2013.
I was soon joined by three outstandingly brilliant musicians, all with notable successes of their own:

Bernd Kiener, a reputed international session drummer, years signed to various major labels in his native Austria and surrounds, before moving to London to find the right band.

Oddur Mar Runarsson, acclaimed guitarist with “Lamb” on major international tours, including as support on Moby's major UK tour, as well as performing with Michael Franti, Robert Plant + many more.

And last, but not least, bassist Lewis Bayfield, a consummate musician and veteran of the well-loved band "Stickman Army".

THE MUSIC 

Our music is an exciting and original blend of all our sonic influences and personal experiences.

Our songs are a real cultural collision mixing the sounds and sense of the sun-kissed concrete jungles of West-Coast California with the bruised and edgy beats that reverberate in the streets of London.

Our first demo, recorded before our current line up, was produced on a very tight budget over a few days with practically no mixing and mastering. 

Have a listen here on Soundcloud and check out our website : dembones.rocks

A good start for a demo we think but to get to the next level we need to really up the game and record a professionally produced EP.


THE CROSSROAD

Dem Bones are now at a major stage of our career with a great opportunity
of game-changing caliber:
our debut EP will be recorded at Evolution Studios in Oxford, one of the best studios in the UK, and produced by Nick Moorbath.                                                       
Nick Moorbath is a legendary figure in the UK music scene: as keyboard player in the seminal band Ride, a gifted promoter of bands like Radiohead, Supergrass, Muse, + many more, founder of the ticket outlet “WeGotTickets”, and owner/operator of Evolution, a studio of incredible pedigree.
With thirty years experience in the music industry and undeniable talent, Nick will take us to the next level and we are very excited to be working with him.


HOW YOU CAN MAKE IT HAPPEN

The total project cost is estimated at £5,000. We have all worked hard and saved and raised a fair amount ourselves.
The Studio is booked, everything is ready to go, and we just need a final £1500 to make it all happen.

In addition to making real art happen and helping us stand a chance in a very competitive artform, donating to the Dem Bones EP fund will give you a sliding-scale range of specially tailored “perks” that may tickle your funny-bones!

The maths...
Cost of recording a 5-track top-quality EP = £2500
Mixing and Mastering = £1000
Manufacturing the CDs + Booklets with Art/Design = £500
Video, Photos, and Marketing = £750
Band accommodation and travel = £250
Total cost for the project = £5000

Funds from our pockets and in kind support = £3500
Cash Shortfall - The last bit of money we need to make this happen! = £1500


THE NEXT STEPS

We have already had radio-play in the UK and France. As an international band we will be looking to make our mark in the UK and in the rest of Europe, where there is a great audience for what we do and from the reactions we've already had in France to our early demo. Our international approach will translate into well-paid mini-tours abroad and we will be targeting radio shows in Europe as well as the UK, and as we are registered with PRS, and are seeking a publishing deal, we are confident we will be able to use this quality EP as a springboard to earning enough as a band to continue to create and develop and gig for you.


We start recording this month and we will be relying on your generosity and faith to a massive degree to realise our ambitions.

Please donate what you can and spread the word; we thank you in advance and we hope you know that we appreciate your support and investment enormously!

Thank you!

DEM BONES

story:
Hello!

My name is TyLean, and I am an avant-garde singer, composer and recording artist. I've released six albums and made guest appearances on albums by Attrition, Acclimate V.1, Rossetti's Compass and many others.  (You can download three free songs at TyLeanPolley.com)

Beyond that, I'm also a wife and mother to two wonderful little boys. My family loves Christmas - who doesn't? Well... some things we don't love about it. As atheists, we don't love how every year Christians declare that there is a war on Christmas and try to make non-Christians feel as though they have no right to celebrate the holidays. But - of course - that's nonsense! Human beings across the globe, spanning vast gulfs of time, have always celebrated at that time of year. In fact, most of the perceived "Christian" traditions are - in fact - not from Christianity, but borrowed and assimilated from the Romans and Pagans. No one owns any holidays, and everyone should be able to celebrate as they wish. 

For us, that means family, gifts, good food... and music!

But all the best Christmas music is deeply religious. We didn't care that much before we had kids.... but now... in our opinions, religion is a systemic problem, and the last thing we want to do is bring that flavor of indoctrination into our home. 

So I decided to start writing new versions! All the best traditional music with new, non-religious music. (No Santa either.... indoctrination of a different sort I would also like to avoid). When I told my friends what I was up to, they all expressed the same frustration of feeling like hypocrites, because they love the religious Christmas music so much. I decided to share the new Christmas songs with the world, and I booked myself some studio time!

The working track list includes the following:
1. O Holy Night! (New title: O Christmas Eve!)

2. Ukrainian Bell Carol

3. What Child Is This? (New title: What Day Is This?)

4. The Wassail Song

5. Go Tell It On The Mountain

6. The Holly & The Ivy

7.  God Rest You Merry, Gentlemen (New title: Oh Rest You Merry, Gentlemen)

8. O'Little Town of Bethlehem/We Three Kings Medley (New title: Lost in the Snow)

9. Silent Night

10. I Heard the Bells on Christmas Day

11. Auld Lang Syne

12. Everyone (Has Someone On Christmas) Except Me (a new composition)


Here is what I need to get this album made:

$2,000 - Recording, Mixing and Mastering

$1,500 - Manufacturing costs for CDs

$500 - Transportation (Spain to the UK for recording) and Childcare

$500 - Envelopes, boxes and postage

$500 - Album Artwork, Photography and Design

$270 - Miscellaneous expenses. (Software updates, orchestral samples, licensing fees, bar codes, etc. 

If the album is not fully funded - don't worry - it'll still get made! The songs are already written and the vocals recorded. However, the more people who contribute, the better the quality of the project, as I won't have to cut corners on mixing, mastering, artwork, manufacturing, etc.

Perks include:

$1 - One track of your choice

$10 - Album download

$15 - CD mailed to you + download

$65 - CD + one year membership to The Unveiled

$125 - 10 Pack of CDs for gifts + download

$250 - CD + The Unveiled + 30 minute Skype performance.

If you can't contribute, please join me on social media and share the word that the holidays belong to everyone!

story:
New Album!

Hello! When we started this band almost two years ago, we never imagined we would have gotten this far so quickly. 

You guys have amazed us with your support from day one, and we want to thank you from the bottom of our hearts! 

You have inspired us to continue writing and to improve a little more with every live show and each new song written.

So, we have some exciting news! We are planning on releasing a new record in the next few months!

This coming year we, as a band, are taking taking a huge step of faith, taking a lot of risks, and leaving some comforts and securities behind, in pursuit of this adventure. 

We have decided that for us, it is all or nothing. And we want to invite you along!

This album is about getting serious concerning our relationship with God and how that empowers us to live lives that can make a difference.

A lot of the project is done already, but there is more that still needs to be finished, and to do that we need your financial support. If each of our facebook fans pre-purchases our new album for $10, we will reach our goal. With that pre-purchase you will get a download of our new single Define the Relationship. There are also a lot of exciting packages to choose from with things like a one of a kind Polaroid photo album taken by us.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $8000 to finish production on this album. This includes the cost of album artwork, CD's, new merchandise, and putting our music out there for everyone to enjoy.
  • Whether you want to invest a little, or a lot, we have quite a few awesome perks to choose from!
  • Some options include a polaroid album shot by us, a limited edition hoodie, a signed drum head, and more! 

The Impact

  • The lyrics of this album touch on subjects that many people relate to, such as relationships, commitment, and dealing with the everyday grind of life, in a positive manner.
  • This is our second album, and we are putting all our effort and experience and musical growth gained from writing the last one in to this newest one.
  • We can't wait to share this project with you, and hope you love it as much as we do!

Risks & Challenges

  • The lyrics we have been writing reflect where we are in this season of life, and we put ourselves out there through them, based on personal experiences and growth.
  • Your support will help lighten some of that risk, no matter how much or how little you can give.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you are unable to help, please help spread the word about this! It means the world to us.
  • Don't forget to share this Indiegogo page!

Thank you so much!

story:
#SupportFemaleProducers

Hey!

My name is Alysha Brilla. I'm an independent artist, activist and music producer based in Kitchener-Waterloo, Ontario, Canada. My first two, self-produced albums, were Juno nominated. Pretty amazing considering that I'm an independent female artist.

I love my community and I hope to establish a small studio where artists (especially women/BIPOC) are able to feel comfortable and record their music or other media projects with (me) a producer who knows what it's like to be on the other side.

This campaign is about supporting independent female producers. By supporting this campaign, you are helping pave the way for female/BIPOC artists, not just in the region but Canada-wide and world-wide. This campaign is going to allow me to put funds towards projects that will lead to the creation of a studio that will #supportfemaleproducers.  This campaign is going to start a conversation about the lack of diversity in the Canadian music industry and how to #supportfemaleproducers.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I'm looking to raise $20,000 to pay for the costs of pre-production, production and post production.
  • This includes renting a larger studio for certain instruments, paying the musicians I hire, having my music professionally mixed and mastered so that it can compete with larger commercial projects being put out by major labels.
  • The ultimate goal is producing my third album independently and having quality produced songs that I can share on an international platform.
Perks for you for helping fund this campaign:
  • $10 CAD - Digital Delight -You will receive a digital download of the album and my sincere gratitude for helping support female producers.
  • $20 CAD + Shipping - Let's Get Physical - You will receive a physical copy of the album and my sincere gratitude for helping support female producers.
  • $50 CAD + Shipping - Signed Syllables - You will receive a signed copy of the book accompanying the album and my sincere gratitude for helping support female producers.
  • $75 CAD + Shipping - Signed & Sealed - You will receive a signed copy of the book accompanying the album, a signed copy of the album, and my sincere gratitude for helping support female producers.
  • $100 CAD + Shipping - Tickets & Tangibles - You will receive a ticket to the album release party, a signed copy of the book accompanying the album, a signed copy of the album, and my sincere gratitude for helping support female producers.
  • $100 CAD - Music Video Easter Eggs - You will choose 1 Easter Egg* to be put in the music video for the album's single. You will meet with my to figure out all of the little details. *Easter Eggs are hidden jokes, references, etc. often found in movies and video games
  • $200 CAD + Shipping - VIP (Very Important Perk) - You will receive a VIP pass to the album release party, a signed copy of the book accompanying the album, a signed copy of the album, and my sincere gratitude for helping support female producers.
  • $500 CAD - Revolutionary Recording - You will receive 5 hours of recording time in my personal studio and my sincere gratitude for helping support female producers.
  • $1,000 CAD - Proudly Produced - You will receive 2 hours of recording time in my personal studio, and I will personally fully produce your song. On top of this, you will receive my sincere gratitude for helping support female producers.

Bonus, non-monetary perk: THE COMMENT CONTEST
  • Each comment you make on this campaign's page gives you a ticket in our comment contest. The prize? You'll have a feature role in the music video for the Album's single. Comment 100 times? That's 100 chances. Get those fingers typing and your signature dance moves ready to go!
What happens if this campaign does not reach it's goal?
  • Every dollar put into this campaign is going towards the production of this album, music video, and #supportfemaleproducers campaign, no matter if the goal is reached on not.

Why only 5% of music producers are women...

This year, only 32.8% of Juno Nominees were women. Of all the potential nominees in the production category, there was only one single female co-credit. The Junos have said that this is 'simply a reflection of who is submitting'. If so, why aren't more female artists/producers submitting and why are there so few female producers in the first place? Women are deterred from entering production sphere because it’s a man’s world, and so we have less female producers than we should, and this reflects in the awards. 

  • Since it was introduced in 1974, only six women have been nominated for "Producer Of The Year" at The Grammy's.
  • As one of the few female producers to be twice nominated for a Juno, the Canadian music industry desperately needs to change to truly represent the diversity of Canadian producers.
  • The goal of #supportfemaleproducers is to change the Canadian music scene. My long term goal of creating a studio that will focus on female BIPOC artists needs the success of this Indiegogo campaign and the #supportfemaleproducers campaign.

Risks & Challenges

Being a female producer in Canada is not an easy journey. With little to no representation in the production field, it is a constant uphill journey to be represented in the industry, let alone recognized.

  • I've been an independent artist for 5 years, and over these 5 years, I've pieced together a team that truly supports me. When you are first starting out as a female independant artist, it is incredibly difficult to navigate the industry and find a team.
  • By creating a conversation about how to #supportfemaleproducers, by creating a studio that addresses female BIPOC independant artists' needs, by addressing the lack of diversity and representation in the Canadian music industry, we can break these barriers and challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign is not just about the fundraising, it's just as much about awareness. You can help this campaign in non-monetary ways by:

  • Sharing this campaign with your friends!
  • Commenting on the page - every comment helps brings this campaign to the top of the list on the Indiegogo site and gives you a chance to be in the music video!
  • Tweeting and sharing the campaign on social media using the Hashtag: #SupportFemaleProducers

Thank you so much for your support!

When you are first starting out as a female independant artist, it is incredibly difficult to navigate the industry and find a team. By creating a conversation about how to #supportfemaleproducers, by creating a studio that addresses female BIPOC independant artists' needs, by addressing the lack of diversity and representation in the Canadian music industry, we can break these barriers and challenges.    Other Ways You Can Help This campaign is not just about the fundraising, it's just as much about awareness. You can help this campaign in non-monetary ways by:
 Sharing this campaign with your friends!
Commenting on the page - every comment helps brings this campaign to the top of the list on the Indiegogo site and gives you a chance to be in the music video!
Tweeting and sharing the campaign on social media using the Hashtag: #SupportFemaleProducers   Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Campaign Purpose

Composer and performer, Jacqueline Dicie, is offering her music for the support of campus ministry and the music program at St. Stephen University Chapel where she is composer-in-residence.  The University community is eclectic, and Jacqueline believes that spiritual music should reflect this diversity.  The music at St. Stephens is a unique sound amidst traditional church music, and all the students who pass through on their way to the world at large, contribute to this experience and grow from it.

Jacqueline has written several original compositions including three musical settings of the recent translation of the Catholic mass ordinaries for the St. Stephen community. The main ambition of this campaign is to record one of these settings, "The Mass of Repentance." However, during the development of this campaign, St. Stephen underwent extensive building repairs and is currently $25,000 in debt because of them.  Jacqueline then decided to contribute half of all the proceeds of this campaign directly to the church's building fund using only the remainder to pay for recording costs, musicians expenses, and CD reproduction.

Goals and Perks

The goal for this campaign is $10,000.  $5,000 for St. Stephen building fund and $5,000 for the album recording.  

For those who are unfamiliar with album costs, those $5,000 are used to pay for studio recording time, production costs which includes digital mastering, musicians' time and practice, instrumental arranging, transcribing, and printing.

For your contributions, you can receive music downloads, physical albums, or music transcriptions for several of the recordings heard in the promotional video above, and for angel investors, larger perks include having Jacqueline visit your community to share and teach her music, custom arranged for your musicians.

Samples of the Albums can be Found Here

The Image of His Love

In the Eye of the Lord

Music for Liturgy

Your Assistance

If you feel this campaign is a worthy endeavor, but find your ability to financially assist strained, do not be troubled.  We simply ask that anyone who wishes to support this campaign, follow its progress on Indiegogo, Facebook, Youtube, and Twitter and share its updates with all your friends, family, and acquaintances.  We will be offering an honor system perk to anyone who pledges to share any information about this campaign through any of the aforementioned social media; this perk will be the free download of "God Is":

  

Help us make this campaign a success.

story:
Hi! 

The first campaign was launched end of last year and some incredibly generous people helped me raise £550 out of £1500, in only 40 days. I want to give a massive thank you to every donator, thanks to you the flight tickets are covered. 

This is round two, aiming to raise the rest of the amount needed for this project to become a reality, £950.

My name is Shelly Ravid, I am a full time music student combining my passion for music with my passion for Charity. Together with the fantastic organsation WAYout Arts in Sierra Leone, I'm planning to travel to Freetown in Sierra Leone, record an EP with some very talented street youths as well as film a documentary about their lives. 

Here's the link to the previous and first campaign:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ldn-to-sierra-leone-a-music-and-film-journey/x/12503322#/

--------------

Help us get Shelly to Sierra Leone to create music with Freetown's street youth and The Black Street Family. Street youths in Freetown and a full time music student in London could not be more different to each other but they have connected through music. This project will create an EP and highlight how much all people have in common once you get passed the surface differences by documenting the whole journey into a film. 
Hi and thank you so much for clicking on our campaign.
My name is Shelly Ravid and about a year ago, I had the opportunity to take part in a Charity project run by my school BIMM, the Joe Strummer Foundation and WAYout Arts. When it was first suggested to me that I might like to do a collaboration with a group of street youths in Sierra Leone I wondered what we could possibly have in common. How can my experiences compare with theirs and how would we write lyrics that co-exist? The first track they sent me was about life on the streets and for them that meant no food, nowhere to sleep and running from the police. I don’t have that experience, but I know what it feels like to worry about money, work and reaching your goals in life. This is what came out of that collaboration:
Full song with music video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IWbeRzkLLgc
Short documentary about the collaboration:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fY61O5oL_bM
During the year we have had contact on Facebook, whenever the guys have access to Internet, which is not too often. We have gotten to know each other, talked about music and goals, life and struggles.
A few months later, we embarked on a second track, this time with only one of the rappers, ‘Wanted’, and me. It has been recorded and mastered and is ready for release. We would love to shoot a music video for this one as well - but here’s where my campaign comes in:
Me and Hazel Chandler, co-founder of WAYout Arts and filmmaker, have a wonderful vision of me traveling to Freetown, meeting the whole of Black Street family as well as other rappers, and record an EP, while documenting everything into a film.
Apart from doing music together, I will also explore Freetown and give viewers a chance to see what life is like for some of the most underprivileged people - ex-child soldiers and sex workers of Freetown. Two very different worlds will meet and create important music, but most of all, give viewers an insight into an area often not shown to the western world. We all dream of the same things, safety, stability, happiness and love, but we have very different opportunities and access.
When you live on the streets, somewhere like Sierra Leone, with little access to information and the Internet, you can feel pretty left behind by the world -unimportant and hopeless. Making connections with those from other countries is not just an opportunity to try different styles of music; it gives hope, a sense of an existence outside the narrow boundaries of Black Street, a chance to make connections across the world. 
The amount I'm raising:
After research, I have come up with some approximate costs in order to make this project see light. Your contributions will go towards:
Flight ticket to Sierra Leone and back including transfer to Freetown
Vaccination 
Visa
Travel insurance
Food
Money for unexpected expenses (such as flight tickets price rise and transfer between airports etc.)
Total: £1500 (only £950 left)
If we don’t manage to raise any funds, or not enough, even after plenty of tries – I will donate all the money to WAYout Arts Sierra Leone.
Perks:
Every donator will receive a mention in the texts at the end of the film (if you want to!) plus a free online download of the EP we record as well as a thank you card sent personally from everyone involved.
The music we create will be sold on Bandcamp with all of the profits going towards Way out Arts Sierra Leone in order for them to continue their amazing work helping street youths staying out of gangs and putting their passion into making music instead.
When am I going?
It all depends on if we manage to reach our goals and my studies. I am aiming for summer of 2016, I graduate in June 2016 and hoping to be on a plane in July. If we manage to raise funds quickly, and are able to get everything sorted quickly – even earlier.
Once the film is edited and ready, we will work hard to get it on air as well as sending it to different film festivals around the world.
Previous work:
Hazel Chandler and her colleagues has been very successful with their ‘After the Jungle’ documentary, which was last aired on BBC News Friday the 16th of October 2015. 
Watch it here: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p035d3gj
It tells the story of Mash P, an ex-child soldier trying to come to peace with his traumatic childhood. 
Read more about previous work on: http://www.wildernessfilms.co.uk/
A little bit about me, Shelly Ravid:
I’ve been gigging around London with my Reggae band for the last 2 years and started collaborating with a DJ which has given me the opportunity to go sing in places like France, Italy, Belgium and performed at festivals such as ‘Reggaebus’, ‘One Love’ and many more. It’s been an incredible journey and I even had the privilege to do backing vocals for legendary Earl Sixteen. I write lyrics about issues close to my heart, Politics, Injustice, Feminism, Racism and everything else that lingers in my mind and have recently started combining my love for music with my passion to create change through Charity.
Last summer I release a track called ‘Amsterdamage’ and gave half of all profits to ‘Women’s Aid’, the national charity for victims of domestic abuse. Feel free to visit my YouTube Channel to get a clearer view of who I am:
www.youtube.com/sravidmusic
www.facebook.com/shellyravid
WAYout Arts Sierra Leone provides recording opportunities for street youths who live in Freetown, Sierra Leone. Read more about them here: 
http://www.wayoutarts.org/
What obstacles may we come across?
Thanks to Hazel, the actual filmmaking will not be a problem as well as recording facilities and producers provided by WAYout Arts. The main worry is if we don’t raise enough funds for me to actually travel. I can by no means fund this myself with student finance so we are putting our hopes into this campaign.
Other Ways You Can Help
Don’t worry if you can’t contribute money wise – there are other ways! By sharing this campaign on your social media and encourage others to have a look, you are doing us a massive favor and increasing our chances of making this happen. Remember to use Indiegogos great share tools.
Thank you for reading
Every little helps, even only one pound. Many, many thanks for reading and donating from me, Shelly Ravid, Hazel Chandler and the Black Street Family. Feel free to contact me: www.sravidmusic@outlook.com

story:
Noize Fabrik: Audio Industry Co-Working and Studio Spaces in Berlin

Wir brauchen eure Hilfe dabei:

Da Community und Zusammenarbeit so fundamental Teile unseres Weltbildes darstellen, möchten wir unseren Mitgliedern bei Noize Fabrik einen Ort zur Zusammenarbeit bieten. Der Live-Room selbst ist zugeschnitten auf Bands, Gruppen und Einzelpersonen und bietet eine erstklassige, schalldichte Vielzweckräumlichkeit, bestimmt für Proben, Konzerte, Live-Mitschnitt-Sessions und mehr. 

Der Live-Room: „Geeignet zur Zusammenarbeit, geeignet zum Co-Sharing, geeignet für die Community!“

So sieht ein Live Room von Boxy IT aus. Eine großflächige Glaswand für den Vielzweck-Raum für eine Zuhörerschaft bis zu 100 Leuten.

---------

Berlin, eine Stadt, wohin die vergangenen paar Jahre so viele Künstler und kreative Köpfe geströmt sind, ist schon lange bekannt als geschäftiger kultureller Knotenpunkt. Aber trotz all dem emsigen Treiben der städtischen Musikindustrie gibt es immer noch einen unbefriedigten Bedarf an Studioräumen und geteilten Arbeitsumfeldern.

Auftritt Noize Fabrik

Vor nicht allzu langer Zeit hatten Marcus und Oliver, zwei lebenslange Freunde, eine Idee, die einfach und aufregend zugleich war: die Schaffung eines Bereichs, wo Künstler, Produzenten, Tongestalter und Profis in der Audio-Industrie als Community zusammenkommen können, um zu produzieren, zu gestalten, zu inspirieren und inspiriert zu werden. Wir möchten eine dynamische Örtlichkeit bieten, wo unsere Mitglieder kreativ und produktiv sein können. Arbeitsplätze, Versammlungsräume, ein Seminarbereich für Workshops und Bildungsaktivitäten bis hin zu modularen Produktionsstudios – da ist es leicht zu verstehen, warum wir von Noize Fabrik so begeistert sind.

Wir brauchen euch

Wir hatten das Glück, die perfekte Örtlichkeit mitten in Neukölln zu finden, und wir arbeiten bereits mit einer großartigen Mannschaft an der Aufbereitung. Alles, was wir jetzt brauchen, ist ein kleiner Anstoß, um das Ganze wirklich perfekt zu machen und diesen Traum Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen, und genau da kommt ihr ins Spiel!

Warum?

Die Krönung der Noize Fabrik wird der Live Room sein. In Einklang mit unserem Weltbild der Zusammenarbeit soll der Live Room Noize Fabriks pulsierendes Herzstück werden. Ein Ort, wo unsere Community zusammenkommen und gestalten kann, während sie ihr Können zur Schaustellt. Ein Raum, wo wir professionelle Mitschnitt- und Probemöglichkeiten bieten können, die die Künstler zufrieden stellen, während die übrige Noize Fabrik in Ruhe vor sich hin summt.

Hier einige Angaben zum Live Room

13m² schalldichter Studioraum

4,30 m Glaswand für eine Zuhörerschaft bis zu 100 Leuten, um Live-Aufnahme Veranstaltungen zu sehen. 

Vielseitig nutzbar einschließlich Bandproben, technischen Vorführungen, Live-Mitschnittsessions und DJ-Sets oder Live-Programmen, Komplett ausgestattete Tonstudios

Was eure Teilnahme bedeutet

Jeder Beitrag bringt uns der Verwirklichung unseres „Live Room“-Traums einen Schritt näher. Wenn ihr gerade nichts beitragen könnt – auch das Weitersagen ist sehr willkommen. Macht es bei euren Freunden, eurer Familie und Audio-Fans bekannt und bei all denen, die es dazu anregen  könnte, etwas beizutragen.   

Seht euch unsere Leistungen an und wählt das Richtige für euch aus! 

Jede Unterstützung ist willkommen, und für jeden Beitrag sind wir äußerst dankbar! 

Eure

Noize Fabrik Familie

English:

We need your help for:

As community and collaboration is such a fundamental part of our philosophy, we want to offer our members at Noize Fabrik a space to work together. The Live Room itself is fitted for bands, groups and individuals offering a top quality soundproofed, multi-purposed space, designed for rehearsals, concerts, live recording sessions and more.

The Live Room: “Geared for Collaboration, Geared for Co-Sharing, Geared for the Community!”

This is what a Live Room from Boxy IT looks like. A large glass wall allows for the multi purpose space to be viewed by an audience of up to 100 people.

-------

Berlin, a place where so many artists and creative minded people have flocked to in the last few years, has long been known as a bustling cultural hub. But for all the hustle and bustle of the city’s music industry, there is still an unmet need for studio spaces and shared working environments.

Enter Noize Fabrik.

It was not long ago that Marcus and Oliver, two lifelong friends, came up with an idea as simple as it is exciting: to create a place where artists, producers, sound designers and audio industry professionals can come together as a community to produce, create, inspire and be inspired.

We want to offer a dynamic space where our members can be creative and productive. From desks, meeting rooms, a seminar area for workshops and educational activities; and modular production studios, it’s easy to see why we’re so excited about Noize Fabrik.

We need you.

We’ve been lucky enough to find the perfect space in the heart of Neukölln and are already working with an amazing crew towards reconditioning it. Now all we need is a bit of a push to make it truly perfect and turn this dream into reality, which is where you come in!

Why?

The crown jewel of Noize Fabrik will be the Live Room. In keeping with our philosophy of collaboration, the Live Room is to become Noize Fabriks’ thumping heart, a place where our community can come together and create, while showcasing their skills. A space where we can offer professional recording capabilities and rehearsals that can accommodate artists while keeping the rest of Noize Fabrik in humming peace.

Some specifications about The Live Room:

  • 13 sqm of soundproofed studio space

  • 4.30 meter glass wall for an audience of up to 100 people to view live performances

  • Can accommodate a wide range of uses, including band rehearsals, technical showcases, live recording sessions and DJ or live sets

  • Fully equipped recording facilities


What your participation means.

Every contribution brings us one step closer to realizing the dream of the Live Room. If you can’t contribute right now - helping spread the word is greatly appreciated! Share it with friends, family, audio lovers, and anyone who could be inspired to contribute.


Check out our perks and choose the right one for you!

All support is appreciated and with each contribution comes our most humble gratitude!


Yours,

The Noize Fabrik family.

The Live Room: “Geared for Collaboration, Geared for Co-Sharing, Geared for the Community!”This is what a Live Room from Boxy IT looks like. A large glass wall allows for the multi purpose space to be viewed by an audience of up to 100 people. -------Berlin, a place where so many artists and creative minded people have flocked to in the last few years, has long been known as a bustling cultural hub. But for all the hustle and bustle of the city’s music industry, there is still an unmet need for studio spaces and shared working environments.Enter Noize Fabrik.It was not long ago that Marcus and Oliver, two lifelong friends, came up with an idea as simple as it is exciting: to create a place where artists, producers, sound designers and audio industry professionals can come together as a community to produce, create, inspire and be inspired.We want to offer a dynamic space where our members can be creative and productive. From desks, meeting rooms, a seminar area for workshops and educational activities; and modular production studios, it’s easy to see why we’re so excited about Noize Fabrik.We need you.We’ve been lucky enough to find the perfect space in the heart of Neukölln and are already working with an amazing crew towards reconditioning it. Now all we need is a bit of a push to make it truly perfect and turn this dream into reality, which is where you come in!
Why?
The crown jewel of Noize Fabrik will be the Live Room. In keeping with our philosophy of collaboration, the Live Room is to become Noize Fabriks’ thumping heart, a place where our community can come together and create, while showcasing their skills. A space where we can offer professional recording capabilities and rehearsals that can accommodate artists while keeping the rest of Noize Fabrik in humming peace.

Some specifications about The Live Room: 

13 sqm of soundproofed studio space
4.30 meter glass wall for an audience of up to 100 people to view live performances
Can accommodate a wide range of uses, including band rehearsals, technical showcases, live recording sessions and DJ or live sets
Fully equipped recording facilities

What your participation means.
Every contribution brings us one step closer to realizing the dream of the Live Room. If you can’t contribute right now - helping spread the word is greatly appreciated! Share it with friends, family, audio lovers, and anyone who could be inspired to contribute. 
Check out our perks and choose the right one for you! 


All support is appreciated and with each contribution comes our most humble gratitude!
Yours,
The Noize Fabrik family.

story:
Short Summary

Hello:  I'm Dr. John Paulson, educator, composer, performer and musical director of the John Paulson Big Band (JPBB).  I have a DMA in music ed. from the U. of WA, MM and BM degrees from the U. of Utah and I've performed,  taught jazz and woodwinds full time for over 30 years in SE Minnesota, and produced 10 CD's.  After surviving cancer surgery in 2011, I retired from full time teaching duties to concentrate on my own creative projects including writing and performing jazz music.   My largest project to date is the 17 piece John Paulson Big Band.   This is not your run of the mill mom & pop big band cranking out tired old standards! We play all original music that I've composed and arranged over the years. We released our first CD/DVD in 2012 "The John Paulson Big Band Project" and we've played numerous successful concerts since then plus all of my big band charts are published by eJazzLines.com / Walrus Music in New York. 

 We now have a rare opportunity in that the band has been accepted to perform at the JEN (Jazz Educators Network) national Convention January 7th 2016 in Louisville, KY.  This is our first opportunity to perform on a national stage and it's very exciting! The members of my band are all high level area music educators and they are donating their time and energy to this trip.  However, expenses for travel and lodging are reaching $8,000.  Although we have secured some partial funding support from Jody Jazz, Inc. and the Tenor Madness Shop in Waterloo, IA, we are not eligible for grant funding we have received in the past due to out of state travel.  As a result, your contribution would have a huge impact on the success and viability of this trip.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking funds to cover half of the expenses ($4000) and the remainder of the budget will come from my own funds.  Contributions will help offset the cost of bus transportation lodging and some limited air fares.  If we don't reach the goal of $4k, the contributed funds will still help offset expenses.  We have some fantastic perks for folks at various levels.  

The Impact

Although we've had success performing locally and regionally, our trip to perform at JEN will really introduce the band and my music to the world.  All the major performers, educators and related music industry people attend this event and they represent jazz enthusiasts from all over the world.  Thanks to support from the folks at the Tenor Madness Sax shop, we will be able to feature Doug Lawrence as a soloist with my band at JEN.  Doug is one of the top tenor sax players internationally and is currently the lead tenor player with the Count Basie Orchestra!   To learn more about JEN and the conference check out this link: https://jazzednet.org/2016ConferenceSchedule
I've been fortunate to have secured various grants from both the Southeastern Minnesota Arts Council (SEMAC), the Minnesota State Arts board and the McKnight Foundation.  To see a list of my accomplishments in jazz and jazz education visit this tab on my website:
http://www.paulsonjazz.com/about/
To see a sample of my JP Jazz Notes monthly newsletter, check this out:
http://us1.campaign-archive2.com/?u=c8c5e8457ea344514008b2251&id=b4e972cca3

Risks & Challenges

All the plans including travel, group registration and hotel reservations have been secured.  This trip  and the performance are going to happen so there's really no risk in donating.   I have been playing gigs and saving funds from my part time teaching at Winona State University in order to save my own money for the endeavor.  So, your contribution will simply ease my personal investment in the trip- I may even be able to pay the musicians involved for their time and efforts if this campaign is successful enough!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks in advance for your support!  If you can't afford a contribution, please spread the word about this campaign and the timeline + 

Check out the great Indiegogo tools to help us get this done!

story:
What is the National Cannabis Festival?

In early 2015 a group of cannabis policy advocates, business owners and enthusiasts joined together around the idea to create The National Cannabis Festival (NCF), to celebrate progress on marijuana legalization in D.C. and across the nation. 


(Photo credit: Students for Sensible Drug Policy)

We wanted to put together a festival to give the east coast community a place and platform to recognize the spirit of the cannabis movement and the non-profit groups that fight every day to end cannabis prohibition. 

We're here today to invite you to join us as we make history at the first-ever National Cannabis Festival!


We are inviting thousands of members of the cannabis community from up and down the east coast to join us on April 23, 2016, for:

  • A full day of music on the main festival stage featuring headlining acts and some of the best regional bands.
  • A vendor village with local and national brand names, games, contests and prize giveaways.
  • An advocacy village where you can get to know members of our advocacy coalition. There will be activities and information on how you can contribute to legalization efforts in your community.
  • An education pavilion with informational sessions you can attend throughout the day.
  • And of course, food, beer and wine!
NCF is book-ended by official pre- and post- parties at local venues.

If all of this sounds good to you, then we invite you to join the movement by purchasing a "Founding Member Ticket" through Indiegogo for this history-making event. Help us start a new tradition in Washington, D.C.!


Support NCF by becoming a Founding Member*


To help with festival operating costs, we are offering "VIP Founding Membership," "Founding Membership" (General Admission+), and General Admission tickets via our Indiegogo campaign. Through this campaign, we hope to raise $35,000.

* You must be 21+ with valid government-issued ID to attend NCF

Member Benefits*

VIP Founding Member Ticket (All-Access VIP) $250**
  • VIP admission to NCF
  • Free food and drinks in VIP lounge
  • Access to VIP viewing platform
  • VIP gift bags
  • Admission to 3 exclusive pre-festival VIP events with cannabis industry leaders and policymakers. You'll have a whole new network of friends and business contacts!
  • Admission to the NCF VIP after-party
  • Listing in directory of VIP Founding Members, sponsors, partners and steering committee members. We will distribute the full-list after the festival so you can stay in touch!
Founding Member Ticket (General Admission+) $60
  • General admission to NCF
  • VIP gift bag
  • Admission to NCF VIP after-party
  • Listing in directory of VIP Founding Members, sponsors, partners and steering committee members. We will distribute the full list after the festival.
General Admission Ticket $30
General Admission tickets are available now on Indiegogo for $30. They will be available via Ticketmaster for $35 + fees closer to the event date.
* You must be 21+ with valid government-issued ID to attend NCF
**Only 150 "VIP Founding Memberships" available


Why do we need a National Cannabis Festival?


(Photo credit: Adam Eidinger)

For Fun:

There are beer and wine festivals every weekend - it's time for the cannabis community on the east coast to have an awesome festival!

For Progress:

For decades, non-profit advocacy groups have been fighting to end cannabis prohibition. The National Cannabis Festival is a chance to gather together just one mile from the U.S. Capitol Building to cast the national spotlight on the most pressing cannabis policy issues and show lawmakers that our community is serious about marijuana policy reform. 


Who and How?

Producing a festival is no small feat. Our team is composed of experienced event producers, A/V technicians, policy experts, cannabis industry leaders and media/publicity experts. 

Meet our steering committee here.


Other ways to support the movement

If you can't buy a ticket today, that's OK, you can still support the movement:

  • "Give us a high five!" See our perks above. If you can't join us at the festival but you like what we're doing, contribute today and help us create a new tradition for the east coast cannabis community!
  • Buy an NCF T-shirt! See our perks above. Whether you'll be there on the big day or not, show your support for the first-ever National Cannabis Festival by purchasing your t-shirt today.
  • Spread the word! Hop on Twitter, Facebook or Instagram and tell folks about the festival (you can even use Indiegogo share tools) - encourage them to follow us online, attend the festival and join the movement!
  • Share the link to the National Cannabis Festival website!
  • Stay engaged! We love hearing from all of our supporters. Cheer us across the finish line by sharing and liking our social media posts on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.
  • Visit the National Cannabis Festival website today to learn more about our amazing advocacy partners!

We hope you'll join us in Washington, D.C., on Saturday, April 23, 2016, as we make history at the first-ever National Cannabis Festival.

Purchase your Founding Member ticket today and you can say you were there, you were part of it, YOU helped make it happen!

* You must be 21+ with valid government-issued ID to attend NCF

The National Cannabis Festival complies with all D.C. laws. The consumption of cannabis in public is not legal. The sale of cannabis in D.C. is not legal unless you are a licensed medical dispensary.
