story:
About 'Mirabeau Bridge': Fat Albert's Unofficial Anthem

Toronto songwriter Sam Larkin was a beloved mentor, trickster and songwriter. He was a mystery to many of us—never accurately answering our many questions about his personal life, such as where he lived, what he did for a living—even his name. 

Sam was a true artist to everyone who knew him. Unfussy, always prepared, always giving his all to singing and playing.

Sam attended Fat Albert’s—a weekly hootenanny—every Wednesday night in the basement of the Korean United Church on Bloor Street in Toronto for decades. Mentor to dozens of songwriters, friend to all, and song fisher extraordinaire.

He caught a few big ones, perhaps none bigger than 'Mirabeau Bridge'. Help us send this Canadian classic around the world.

Here is the video that has been viewed 115,000 times:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QwYFrxm0esY

The Pont Mirabeau, celebrated in Apollinaire’s poem of the same name, is depicted with beautiful strangers dancing by candle light. The chorus romanticizes the singer’s perfect lover with an inspired melody audiences love to sing along with. Beautiful young dreamers and lovers, creatures of the night, dancing in the light by the Pont Mirabeau in Paris.

 

 

For years leading up to his passing in October 2013, Sam and Bob Wiseman were working on a new album. Begun in 2009 when Wiseman realized Larkin was sick, the album took six years to complete. We are hoping a breakthrough recording of Mirabeau Bridge will trigger renewed interest in Sam’s back catalogue.

There are plenty of gems there for other singers to find.

And echoes of Nick Drake, who continues to grow in prominence as an artist decades after his passing. Or Van Gogh. Who knows how high Sam's star will rise?

 

 

Studio Recording of 'Mirabeau Bridge'

I heard Marianne Girard sing ‘Mirabeau Bridge’ at the Sam Larkin CD Release party at Tranzac in Toronto. She sang the hell out of it and I said out loud, "Where's the single? This song could be huge!" The fact that a rough around the edges live in-studio performance attracted one hundred fifteen thousand views (115,000) suggests the song has wide appeal. This video was part of Folkus, a local television show created by the wonderful and deeply missed Rebecca Greenberg in 1991.

It’s already a hit in other words. The only problem is not enough people know what a hit it is.

I sent Sam’s video to a friend in Sydney, Australia. He learned the song and played it at an open stage, and everyone wanted to know where that song came from. It quickly became a staple at that café.  Is there any reason it could not happen in 10,000 other cafés?

Here’s a chance for Sam’s friends and admirers and fans to pitch in and get Mirabeau Bridge out into the culture in a big way. Who knows what heights we'll hit?

 

 

Funding Ask

With the funding goal of $18,000, we will be able to:

  • Complete a professional recording, with extra orchestration, backup vocals and other instruments. The amount we raise will in part determine the arrangements. Recording expenses including studio time. top musicians fees, tape, meals.  ($3,000-5,000)
  • Post production: mixing and mastering. Mixing is a day at minimum. ($300-500). Mastering is a flat fee. (For one song $200-300)
  • Package/graphic design. ($1,500-2,500) 
  • Printing and production. ($1,000)
  • Travel costs of airfare and accommodations in Paris. Camera crew, stylist, 2-8 actors and Parisian beautiful people, a cafe, a box of candles. ($6,000 -15,000)
  • Promotional fees, paid to social media wizards to open doors for the song to be heard and considered for television and films. ($1500-5000)

If we succeed in receiving funding in excess of our goal, we will have the option of adding more more bells and whistles to our promotion campaign, to orchestration and to technology and talent at the video shoot.

Here's a beautiful tribute to Sam from Don Freed:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/vy81bukb5zjdcv7/Don%2...

Here is Sam being interviewed by Murray McLaughlan on CBC's 'Swinging on a Star', broadcast September 30, 1988.
https://www.dropbox.com/s/om4xznfuf0ncsj8/Sam%2...

story:
Composer Jeffrey Nytch 

Jeffrey Nytch is an accomplished composer whose works have been performed throughout the U.S. and Europe by leading artists including Richard Stoltzman, The Ahn Trio, New York Chamber Symphony, Seattle Symphony, National Repertory Orchestra, Moravian Philharmonic, and many others. Jeff's music is expressive, lyrical, and spiritual; he creates meaningful connections with his audience through a musical voice that is engaging and approachable. This violin concerto project, celebrating the heroism and life of Hungarian violinist Sándor Fehér, gives him the opportunity to tell a unique and poignant musical story to audiences across the country. Our orchestral partners include the Mission Chamber Orchestra (San Jose, CA), the Pro Musica Colorado Chamber Orchestra (greater Denver), Dallas Chamber Symphony (Texas), and the Chamber Orchestra of Pittsburgh (Pennsylvania).

What We Need ... and Incentives for You!

This campaign will have multiple funding milestones representing a progressively greater realization of our project. At the $20,000 level, the commission is fully-funded. Professional engraving of the score and preparation of the parts is possible at $25,000. At $40,000 soloist fees for our partner orchestras will be covered, meaning that their costs of performing the concerto will be completely met, with no additional funding required on their part. And at $60,000 we will be able to produce a studio-quality recording of the work.

Incentives include (at the $1,000+ level) membership in the "Budapest Travel Club," a personalized trip-planning service to one of Europe's greatest cities. And at the $10,000 level, you'll receive a unique, custom-designed, handmade piece of jewelry from the award-winning West & Company jewelers.

The Impact

Composer Jeffrey Nytch has a long track record of important projects that have reached broad and diverse audiences. His Symphony No. 1: Formations, co-commissioned by the Boulder Philharmonic and the Geological Society of America, has generated international press and brought geoscientists and nature enthusiasts to concert halls throughout the mountain west. His string quartet, Fantasy on Icarus, will have its premiere in January, 2017, at Carnegie Hall's Weil Recital Hall. Concerto for Violin: Costa Concordia will bring a compelling story to the audiences of our orchestra partners, as well as engage the Hungarian community through celebrating a national hero. In addition to our current orchestra partners, we believe this work will stimulate additional performances throughout the United States and (ultimately) in Hungary itself. Building on the recent successes of his Symphony and String Quartet, the concerto project will represent a major move forward Jeffrey Nytch and his work.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk/challenge with this project will be raising sufficient funds to not only fund the commission but address production costs for our orchestra partners. Without our partners, the concerto cannot be performed. We believe the compelling nature of the story, the strength of our partnering organizations, and the enthusiasm of the American-Hungarian community (with whom we have many connections) we can meet this challenge successfully.

Other Ways You Can Help

If a financial contribution is not possible, please help us by spreading the word about this project! If you live in San Jose, Dallas, Denver, or Pittsburgh, contact our orchestra partners and see how you can help them share this project with their patrons. You can make a tremendous contribution through your efforts!

Thank you for your support!

Without our partners, the concerto cannot be performed. We believe the compelling nature of the story, the strength of our partnering organizations, and the enthusiasm of the American-Hungarian community (with whom we have many connections) we can meet this challenge successfully.

Other Ways You Can Help
If a financial contribution is not possible, please help us by spreading the word about this project! If you live in San Jose, Dallas, Denver, or Pittsburgh, contact our orchestra partners and see how you can help them share this project with their patrons. You can make a tremendous contribution through your efforts!Thank you for your support!

story:
We LOVE making MUSIC!!!!

We started this project because we are both passionate about singing, sharing, and making music. Performing together has only heightened our passion and desire to continue to share what we love doing so much.  The amazing support and encouragement we've received for this project has been overwhelming. We've already invested some time and money from our gigs into doing some studio work and we're really excited about where it's all heading. We need some help to keep that going and make this album a reality. Every dollar we collect will help to create this album. You can support by pre-ordering the album or by purchasing some of our fun little perks. 

Thank you in advance for all the love and support - it means the world to us!!

story:
www.sonemus.com

The Society Of NEw MUsic Sarajevo - SONEMUS (Lat. - "let us sound") was established in 2001 in order to perform, promote and educate in the domain of contemporary artistic music. Being the only ensemble for contemporary music in Bosnia & Herzegovina, SONEMUS attracts a huge audience, music students as well as the general public at their concerts and lectures.

The ensemble members are musicians based in Bosnia & Herzegovina,  Switzerland, Germany, France, Slovenia and the United Kingdom.

Our wish is to present the biggest musical achievements of the 20th and 21st century to the Bosnian-Herzegovinian audience, where contemporary music still has a status of an almost exotic and unknown genre of classical music. We offer all of our concerts with no admission. 

In the past projects, we performed a various number of contemporary music "classics" (Schönberg's Pierrot Lunaire,  Romitelli's Professor Bad Trip, Grisey's Vortex Temporum, Ligeti's Chamber concerto amongst many others - all of them PREMIERE performances in Bosnia & Herzegovina) as well as new works and premieres by young local and international composers. Our work in the field of contemporary music is always very appreciated in the local and regional scene, which can be seen by the sheer number of audience we get at every concert of the festival.

 

For our next edition, we will once again premiere new compositions, this time by Swiss composer Antoine Fachard and Bosnian composer Ališer Sijarić. Also, the SONEMUS ensemble will perform Brian Ferneyhough’s La Chute d’ Icare and Richard Barrett’s Trawl, for the first time in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Composers Ališer Sijarić, Antoine Fachard and Richard Barrett will hold workshops for young composers at the Ars Aevi Museum for contemporary art.

In addition to two world premieres and two Bosnian premieres, the members of the SONEMUS ensemble also want to focus on working with music students in Sarajevo. As part of the SONEMUS Fest 2018, we organise workshops for instrumentalists at the Music academy Sarajevo. The participants of the instrumentalist workshops will play at the closing concert of this year’s festival.

SONEMUS Fest 2018 will be held from April 16th to April 21st 2018.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

For the realisation of our project, we still need 5000 USD: 

-1000 USD for renting performance material (sheet music)

-2000 USD for flight tickets and lodging for our international members and guest musicians

-1000 USD to cover the travel/lodging costs of our invited composers 

-1000 USD to cover the concert hall costs in Sarajevo

If we don't reach our full goal, we will distribute the money proportionally towards the same needs as we did before. However, we might have to cancel some of the concerts if we can not afford to put them on, and that will be a real shame!

ANY contribution from you makes a difference for us and gets us one step closer to the realisation of our project.

The Impact

We are the only contemporary music festival in Bosnia & Herzegovina. We have had successes with our previous festivals and we are constantly growing. 

We have already raised the majority of our funds from numerous charities and foundations around Europe but we need more in order to put the actual concerts on. With your help it can become a very real reality of one place becoming the centre stage for world musicians coming together to celebrate modern local, regional and world art.

We believe that together we can be part of the cultural life in Sarajevo, Bosnia & Herzegovina and the region and make contemporary music more known and accessible in regions that do not have a huge variety of concerts and workshops with international musicians. By contributing to the SONEMUS Fest, you are supporting local music students, musicians and composers from Bosnia & Herzegovina, as well as their need to collaborate with international musicians. 

As contemporary  music is neither recognised nor well established in Bosnia and Herzegovina, we believe that the cultural scene would benefit greatly from this event.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even without a donation, you can still contribute and help us achieve our goal: SHARE our campaign, shout, sing and write about it! Spread the word about SONEMUS!

story:
Ready at last!

carefully out of Nowhere is the title of our debut 12 track album of songs composed over the last decade. With an additional 2 albums waiting in the wings, this will be my foray into the music industry, with hopefully much more to come. With parts composed for chamber orchestra, I need your help to make it happen!

These songs you are helping produce are born from a love of words and attention to detail. They are my honest wrestlings with matters of faith, love, depression and joy. I've been waiting to make this happen for many years and you, dear friends, can help me share my art with... well, with you! But I can't do it alone.

Things needful.

This kind of thing isn't cheap. But, I have the awesome opportunity to be working with my old friend Joseph Cheek who is offering his choice talents at Island Studios in Adelaide, Australia!

Here is a breakdown of our costs is USD:

  • Studio Time: $2000
  • Musicians: $2000
  • Editing: $1000
  • Mixing: $1000
  • Vinyl Pressing/Mastering: $3000

Yeah, it's that easy!

It isn't. I've already invested $4000 and counting of my own funds in this project over the last year. Countless hours spent reading articles and books about how to produce an album on a budget; how to market yourself; how to build a website and more! I've lived in three major cities in the last 5 years, finding joy in my relationships with so many of you. No one likes the boy who cries wolf, so I promise you, I'm serious about making this a reality. 

Strapped for cash?

Hey, me too! Don't worry there are some other ways you can pitch in!

  • Help us make some noise! Share this campaign using the links provided for your social media platforms. 
  • Like us on Facebook!
  • Follow us on Twitter! 
  • Follow us on Instagram!
  • Hit up our Website for some curious content and updates!

story:
Darol and Emy here. As many of you know, we love making music together and we love getting the younger members of our far-reaching music community in on it.

Anyone who’s looking at this probably knows me, Darol. I’ve been making music with other great musicians since 1976, with the David Grisman Quintet, Turtle Island, The Montreux Band, (Windham Hill) Psychograss, and my Republic Of Strings band.

In the eight years Emy & I have worked together, we've played about two hundred concerts in the US, Ireland, Australia and Spain,  we've produced three full-length CDs and and five themed shows-a winter holiday show, a Valentines' show, an orchestra show, a tribute to Guy Clark, as well as gobs of Emy's original songs and my Republic Of Strings-type shows… and…

this next thing.

We have been working for the last 4 years on a monumental project for which, we, for the very first time, are asking for financial support.

We have completed our first collection of Sixties and early Seventies songs.

Because of the iconic nature of this stuff, and the fact that it has been 50 YEARS since much of this music got written, we now think of it as folk music… even though we’ll be paying lots of well-deserved publishing royalties.

Much of that music has shaped most of the generations since then, and that period established styles that artists still create in. That’s why we’re calling the project

“Music Of Our People”. 

Out of the hundreds, maybe thousands, of great, significant songs that appeared during that time, these are the ones that presented themselves to us. We are using our unique viewpoints and skills to re-create these songs in the New Acoustic style that I helped invent, and is a big part of Americana-style music. The Songs are:

Up On The Roof 

These Boots (Were Made for Walkin’)

The Wichita Lineman

Stone Soul Picnic

Killin' The Blues

Tattler/I Think it’s Going To Be All Right

You Keep Me Hangin' On

Stoney End

Ripple

Uncle John's Band

Bird On A Wire

                                                      …right?  Yeah. incredible.

As many of you know, I’m not unfamiliar with projects like this. I’ve done many panoramic sonic fiddling projects, and released a folk music album of highly arranged material called “Heritage” featuring Wille Nelson, Mavis Staples, Bela Fleck, Mary Chapin Carpenter, Tim O’Brien, Paul McCandless, David Lindley, Edgar Meyer, Victor Wooten and on and on. And my Republic Of Strings project used a number of songs from this era.

We'll be

This entire project was recorded piece by piece in our attic, sometimes with up to three people at once, sometimes with live vocals, painstakingly assembled after much thought, built up from a rocking basic track of guitar and octave mandolin with bass. My home recording studio combines legacy gear from 25 years ago with the most recent digital technology, and is quirky; but the best tool is the tool you know, and I have made a dozen albums on this system, gradually upgrading and changing out gear. I know exactly how I want it to sound, and I can make it happen… for not a lot of expense, generally. We did pay the other musicians about twice the going recording rate, which is still kind of a pittance.

Many of these folks were not alive yet when this music was created! — but they are pretty much geniuses, and contributed beautiful insight to these songs. You can find more info about these players at my website, darolanger.com.

 

As you can well imagine, this part is the hardest part; asking for funding of any sort pretty much gives me a rash, and I don’t know anyone who enjoys doing it. In the distant dim past, a record company would invest in the project and fund production, and they would be paid back through sales. Recently, I’ve been able to fund my own releases all the way from basic tracks through the release; I invested in recording gear and have a nice space to make the record.

This time is a bit different.

As usual, I’ve already funded my own production here, to the tune of about $6k spread out over the 4 years.

But we want to spend more, about $9500, for:

  • The highest quality mastering,
  • make great CD art,
  • Manufacturing a great package,
  • We want to reach out to people our age who might not be reachable through Instagram or Reddit or whatever folks are using these days.
  • Hire real promotion, working with an experienced pro, running ads and getting articles printed in AARP Magazine, reaching out to all the NPR affiliates and our friends in community radio, and the various Americana and Folk Associations all over the US and Canada;
  • Spend time and energy reaching out to our large network of industry people and fellow musicians, and perhaps even a bit of tour support for playing this music out on radio and concerts (plane flights, van rental, and hiring the best musicians).
  • Paying the PUBLISHING ROYALTIES, which get paid in advance, according to how many recordings are manufactured!

  • The taxes we’ll pay on the money you give us. This is a big thing! Nice.

I know we are all giving to various tax-deductible and other Non-Governmental Organizations like crazy now, in these outrageous, incredible, and dangerous times.

BUT This music has already seen us through a time of great discord and upheaval and maintains its integrity and relevance right now.

So. We’re asking you to make an additional investment in yourself: In your daily happiness and the relief that great music can bring… A gift that keeps on giving. 

Any amount is appreciated! Anything in the neighborhood of $25 will obviously get you your CD signed sealed & delivered, its yours…

For those of you who can give more, we can figure out stuff such as the usual platter of musically-oriented exchange bonuses.

Higher-resolution files of the music,

our secret recipes,

Extra songs or outtakes, alternate mixes with different combos of instruments.  The stripped-down mixes are amazing as well, and groove like gangbusters.

We will record your voice on our answering machine.

T-shirts (more $$, right?)

free hikes in the woods,

meet you for coffee in Glocca Morra, Bora Bora, The Roman Agora. Whatever.

If you don't have money for this--

if you just have ideas, want to help, could publicize or promote through your Facebook page or use the wonderful Indiegogo share tools--

or are interested in this whole process and have knowledge that would be useful,

we want to hear from you!

Please contact us through this amazing organization, Indiegogo.

THANK YOU!

Darol & Emy

story:
Hi, 

Thank you for visiting my CrowdFunding page.  I have just released my 2nd solo album, entitled: "Sign of Life," and I'm trying to raise money to fund my 3rd solo album.

Please watch the video for full information on how you can make a BIG difference in helping me to reach my goals.

Please contact me with any questions you may have.

I appreciate you taking the time to visit this page, and watch the video...Even if you can not contribute, you can be a BIG help by sharing this on your social media accounts.

All the best,

Brian Barnhouse
https://BrianBarnhouse.com

story:
Introduction:

Hi, we’re Spoiler.  We are a Toronto-based skate-punk band that started in 2014. Over the course of our 4 years together we have assembled a blistering collection of 12 recordings, spanning 3 EPs (small albums).

Goal:

Our goal is to release our cumulative collection of songs as a complete album project on vinyl.  For this album, 2 of our EPs have been remixed and remastered (S/T and ‘Starting with S’) and we have recorded EP’s worth of new material in 2017 to complete a record’s worth of material, totaling 12 songs, that we intend to release early into 2018.

Story:

Being fans of vinyl ourselves, we know how much people enjoy collecting punk records on wax.  For that reason, we just HAVE to press this record.  We believe it’s a must-have for existing fans of the band and of punk rock on the whole. For new fans, friends and family, let this album serve as testament and keepsake that highlights the passion that all of the band members share for punk rock and the commitment required from us to produce an album of this caliber.  Your contributions will help us fund the recording and engineering process and, most importantly, the manufacturing of the records.  We can’t afford it!

Numbers:

How much do we need?  We need $3000.00 CAD.  We’ve shopped around a lot of manufacturers and $2200 is going to pay for the vinyl manufacturing here in Canada, while the remaining $800 will be split amongst band members - $160.00 to each of the 5 of us – to cover part of the recording costs that we’ve already fronted.  We are making 200 records.  The price difference from 100 to 200 copies is negligible, so it makes the most sense to press 200 copies.  Your cost per album will be $16 (plus shipping if need-be).

Project Summary:

The self-titled Spoiler album will be pressed on translucent vinyl with beautiful new artwork printed on a high-quality jacket. The press will also include a lyrics insert and a favourite band photo; the same photo included in our profile here.

A lot of hard work and woodshedding went into writing and developing these songs in the band’s practice space and through live performances around southern Ontario. All the songs were professionally recorded by the best punk rock engineer and producer in Toronto – Steve Rizun of Drive Studios.

As a reminder, the album is cumulative in that it is a collection of 3 separate EP projects recorded over the span of 3 years, all of which have been mixed and mastered together to bring them new life as a complete project.

This killer punk LP is a must-have for existing fans of the band and of punk rock on the whole. For new fans, friends and family, let this album serve as testament and amazing keepsake that highlights the passion that all of the band members share for punk rock and the commitment required to produce an album of this caliber.

Thanks for visiting and for your pledge. We hope you thoroughly enjoy this Spoiler LP and that you share it with everyone you can!

For new fans, friends and family, let this album serve as testament and keepsake that highlights the passion that all of the band members share for punk rock and the commitment required from us to produce an album of this caliber.  Your contributions will help us fund the recording and engineering process and, most importantly, the manufacturing of the records.  We can’t afford it!
Numbers:
How much do we need?  We need $3000.00 CAD.  We’ve shopped around a lot of manufacturers and $2200 is going to pay for the vinyl manufacturing here in Canada, while the remaining $800 will be split amongst band members - $160.00 to each of the 5 of us – to cover part of the recording costs that we’ve already fronted.  We are making 200 records.  The price difference from 100 to 200 copies is negligible, so it makes the most sense to press 200 copies.  Your cost per album will be $16 (plus shipping if need-be).
Project Summary:
The self-titled Spoiler album will be pressed on translucent vinyl with beautiful new artwork printed on a high-quality jacket. The press will also include a lyrics insert and a favourite band photo; the same photo included in our profile here.
A lot of hard work and woodshedding went into writing and developing these songs in the band’s practice space and through live performances around southern Ontario. All the songs were professionally recorded by the best punk rock engineer and producer in Toronto – Steve Rizun of Drive Studios.
As a reminder, the album is cumulative in that it is a collection of 3 separate EP projects recorded over the span of 3 years, all of which have been mixed and mastered together to bring them new life as a complete project.
This killer punk LP is a must-have for existing fans of the band and of punk rock on the whole. For new fans, friends and family, let this album serve as testament and amazing keepsake that highlights the passion that all of the band members share for punk rock and the commitment required to produce an album of this caliber.
Thanks for visiting and for your pledge. We hope you thoroughly enjoy this Spoiler LP and that you share it with everyone you can!

story:
GREETINGS FAM!  

      2018 is promising to be a monumental, once in a lifetime opportunity for my music!  This fundraiser's goal is to offer you IRIE G merchandise and music in order to finish my recordings with 5 time grammy winning Marc Lee, and Bob Marley's family sound team.  Most importantly, this fundraiser will enable me to supply organic, original, and positive music for the world!

     I'll need $6000 to finish the album without cutting any corners.    I'm offering exclusive IRIE G merchandise such as- Tee shirts, tanks, stickers, posters, sunglasses, live performances, and more!   

      This year my music aired on many radio stations across the world, including Sirius XM radio!  To finish the album @ legendary Tough Gong studios in Jamaica, with members of Damian Marley's band and audio team would be a dream come true!  Let's make it happen!!

          On my own, it's tough to make enough money to propel my music.  The success of my music is absolutely dependent on supporters, fans, and family!   Through working together, I really feel we can make amazing things happen!

    Please share my campaign using the indigogo "share" tools, or simply share my youtube kickstarter video on your Facebook wall!  

    Thank You!  Mahalos!

    IRIE G

story:
What Is Kept On Hold?

  • Kept On Hold is the pop punk moniker of Detroit local musician, Andrew Alojipan. 
  • The goal of this campaign is much more than putting out a new album, but the hope that others can begin to share their stories of hurt and healing, as a bridge between worlds. I have been given freedom from my past, and I want that for others in the music community.
  • My previous release allowed me to tour the US for the last three years, play over 350 shows, and help get my message of hope into the hands of thousands of individuals across the country. With your help, I believe that this next album is going to reach farther, and allow others around the world to help set people free from their past.

 

What I Need & What You Get

  • Why do you need that much money? I’m glad you asked!
    • $6000 will go toward:
    • $4200 for studio time, engineering, mix, and mastering by mix wizard, Nick Rad.
    • $1200 - fulfillment of perks, shipping, packaging.
    • $600 - marketing, promotion.
    • above and beyond this, will go toward funding future tours!
  • If you choose to help fund this next album, you can receive anything from a digital download of the record before it’s released, receiving exclusive, never before seen, physical copies of previous releases, all the way up to me, cooking you a traditional filipino dish for you and your friends, and then having a house show!
  • If the goal is not met, the perks will still happen, but on a later date. Money will still be allocated for above listed purposes, just may take longer to save the rest.

 

The Story

  • I hope that “What We Buried” will mean as much to you, the listener, as it does to me. Writing it was a serious milestone for me, in seeing my past objectively, and not definitively. Coming to terms with the fact that what happens, happens, but understanding that what I do from there is not out of reach. I would love to see people be able to start having healthy conversations, sharing stories, and opening people up to the real possibility of healing from brokenness. Your contribution will help push that message out much further than I could on my own.
  • Three years ago, some kind people helped me fund my last album “Promises,” which got into the hands of nearly 10,000 people. It’s reached as far as South America, the UK, and the Philippines to name a few places I never imagined I’d have listeners in. The last goal was $3500, and together we raised $4560. I’m so grateful for that, and I have made countless connections and friendships from that kind of support. 

 

Risks & Challenges

  • The only complications that could come are slightly delayed perk delivery, should we meet the goal, between that and touring. If the goal is not met, I will be personally working extra to make sure that the perks are made and delivered on time or as close to that as possible. I am committed and excited to get you, the listener, the best possible products I can offer.

 

Other Ways You Can Help!!

  • If you don't have money, DON'T WORRY! You can still help out massively! Here's how! Chances are, you're reading this on your computer or smart phone... Which means you can...

    Tell someone you know, or ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign on social media (i.e. facebook, twitter, instagram, etc.) You know a lot of people, and you have influence! :) Your voice is just as powerful and valuable! Thank you for your time, and your support. It really does mean more than I could explain.

story:
We are so excited to be able to share these new songs with you!

Your support will go to help fund the recording and production of our first studio worship album entitled, "You Are Ever Faithful".

The last two years we've been humbled, blessed and amazed at God's faithfulness to us! As we've continued on in our faith journey we can't help but look back and see how perfectly God has orchestrated it all.

By standing firm on His promises for us we've grown to know God in a new and deeper way. By allowing His hand to guide and direct us we've learned more about His character and in turn seen Him in a new light.  

We are excited to share these songs with you in hopes that they will connect with your heart and that you too experience a new understanding of His faithfulness! Thank you for your continued support!

By allowing His hand to guide and direct us we've learned more about His character and in turn seen Him in a new light.  We are excited to share these songs with you in hopes that they will connect with your heart and that you too experience a new understanding of His faithfulness! Thank you for your continued support!

story:
English below

Chers amis, chère famille,

Depuis plusieurs années, des chansons,  compagnes de ma vie,  ont fleuri. 
Elles sont maintenant prêtes, corolles ouvertes et dansantes aux quatre vents. Ainsi elles iront leur petit bonhomme de ciel bleu chatouiller, bercer, nourrir, enflammer le cœur et les oreilles de ceux et de celles pour qui elles ont vu le jour ! 
Et oui, elles sont là, patientes, vastes, vibrantes, fragiles et belles: ces chansons coulées de sources vives, de braises chaudes, ce pain de tous les jours, ces chansons nées au ventre des forêts d’ici et de là-bas, ces chansons de la première aube, de la rosée, aux ailes de soleil, ces chansons sœurs des lunes, écho de mes ancêtres, ces chansons nacre des mers, perle des mères, ces chansons chevauchées folles ivres amoureuses sauvages, ces chansons azur du désert, de feuilles au vent et de fenêtres ouvertes… elles me traversent et s’offrent enfin à vous, en une forme donnée, elles osent la complétion !

Ainsi se déploiera ce tout premier album, entre les teintes intimistes de mes compositions en français, les chaudes et vives envolées d’âme de mes chants en anglais et les éclatantes célébrations du vivant en espagnol et en portugais !

Je suis émue devant l’inépuisable bonté de la vie qui me répond au quart de tour en révélant joyeusement sur le chemin des alliés d’exceptions !

Toute ma gratitude à l’amitié tissant la trame de l’offrande à venir :

Laurent Calembert, frère des évidences, complice des étoiles, multi-instrumentiste aux accents électro et mixeur inspiré !

Étienne Babin (Ennyam), allié précieux de source claire, me révélant un peu plus à chaque note pleine, vibrante et sensible de son piano !

Éric Violette, maestro du son à l’oreille affutée, musicien joueur dans l’âme à la créativité débordante et à l’enthousiasme contagieux !

Sacha Thomas, homme solaire de ma vie, me soutenant sur tous les plans au rythme de son cœur généreux, de ses tambours merveilleux et de sa magie bruissant au cœur de ses instruments inusités !

Ainsi qu’aux alliés à venir, percussionniste, violoniste, flûtiste qui se joindront prochainement au voyage, plus d’un seront invités à plonger en sa créativité ! C’est un des précieux joyaux d’une telle entreprise : le fleurissement de ceux qui nous entourent ! C’est tout simplement vivifiant pour tous !

J’ai à cœur d’honorer dignement le temps et les précieux talents des artistes, musiciens, preneur de son, mixeur, infographiste, photographe, et autres collaborateurs qui m’accompagneront tout au long de ce projet!


Afin d’assumer les frais inhérents à une telle aventure, je souhaite atteindre 12 000$ !

Merci de tout coeur de m’aider à faire tourner la roue de l’abondance pour tous !

 

Voici comment seront redistribués les fonds récoltés:

Enregistrement, mixage, mastering: 9000$

Production et distribution du CD: 1000$

Graphisme, photographie et autres dépenses : 1000$

Diffusion et contribution Indiegogo : 1000$

 

Voici comment vous pouvez m’aider :

  • Pré-commander dès maintenant mon album en choisissant l’une ou l’autre des contreparties proposées ! Prenez le temps de lire les différentes options (grand merci au soutien d’artisans inspirés !  Maude Cliche-Ricard Créations Netenkena et Sacha Thomas pour les tambours)
  • Passer le mot à vos amis, à vos familles, à vos contacts et merci de faire circuler la campagne sur les réseaux sociaux !

Vous pouvez découvrir quelques maquettes, explorations, work in progress de mes chansons sur mon Soundcloud Myriam Archambault

**********************************************************************************

Dear friends, dear family,

 

For several years, songs, companions of my life, have flourished.
They are now ready, open and dancing to the four winds. So they spread their wings, rocking, feeding, igniting the hearts and ears of those for whom they were born! 
And yes, they are there, patient, vast, vibrant, fragile and beautiful: songs poured from living sources, this bread of days, these songs born in the belly of the forests of here and over there, those songs of the first dawn, the dew, with the wings of the sun, these songs sisters of the moons, echo of my ancestors, these mother-of-pearl songs, these wild crazy drunken horses songs, these blue songs of the desert, of leaves in the wind and of open windows ... they run through me and finally offer themselves to you, in a given form, they dare the completion!

Thus will unfold this very first album, between the intimate shades of my compositions in French, the warm and lively flights of soul of my songs in English and the vibrant celebrations of life in Spanish and Portuguese!

I’m moved by the inexhaustible goodness of life that responds to me so swiftly and sweetly by joyfully revealing rare allies on the way!


All my gratitude goes to friendship, weaving the work of this upcoming offering :

Laurent Calembert, brother of sheer simplicity, walking hand in hand with the stars, balancing so many instruments together with his electro sounds and inspired mixer !

Étienne Babin (Ennyam), precious ally of clear waters, revealing me a little bit more with every note of his vibrating and sensitive piano !

Éric Violette, maestro of sound with a sharp ear, musician within the soul with exuberant creativity and contagious enthusiasm !

Sacha Thomas, solar man of my life, supporting me on every aspect, following the rythm of his generous heart, of his wonderful drums and of the magic sprinkling from the heart of his unusual instruments !

As well as the up coming allies, percussionist, violinist, flutist who will join the trip soon, more than one will be invited to dive in his creativity! It is one of the precious jewels of such an enterprise: the flowering of those around us! It's simply invigorating for everyone!

I have at heart to honor the time and the precious talents of artists, musicians, sound recordist, mixer, graphic designer, photographer and other collaborators who will walk with me throughout this project!

 In order to cover the costs of such an adventure, I want to reach $ 12,000!

Thank you for helping me turn the wheel of abundance for all!

 

Here's how the funds raised will be redistributed:

Recording, mixing, mastering: $ 9000

Production and distribution of the CD: $ 1000

Graphics, Photography and other expenses: $ 1000

Distribution and Indiegogo contribution: $ 1000
 

Here's how you can help me:

  •  Pre-order my album now by choosing one of the perks listed! Take the time to read the different options (warm thank you to  inspired artisans that support this campaign !   Maude Cliche-Ricard Créations Netenkena and Sacha Thomas for the hand drums)
  • Share this campaign with your friends and families through social networks and by word of mouth!

You can discover some early recordings, work in progress of my songs on my Soundcloud Myriam Archambault

 

Crédit pour la vidéo :

Technique : Eric Violette
Composition, guitare et voix : Myriam Archambault
Piano : Etienne Babin
Tambour : Sacha Thomas

Les premières paroles de la chanson In the Open Sky proviennent d'un chant de Kuthambai, l'un des 18 Siddhas. Profonde gratitude à tous les Masters, à cette flamme dorée de l'amour qui rencontre l’amour !

The first sentence of the first song In the Open Sky comes from a song written by one of the 18 Siddhas, Kuthambai. Eternal love to all the Masters...I bow to this golden flamme of the love meeting love!

story:
A Bit About Me..

About 5 years ago, after a dramatic shift in my life and with the guidance of a spiritual leader (Satguru Sri Ramana Devi) I decided to make music my life's path. From then on, armed with my acoustic guitar and a stomp box, I began gigging as much as I could. With perseverance and a great deal of support, I've witnessed a steady progression. My songs have received national radio airplay, I have won regional awards and last year I signed a record deal with the independent label - 'Kidda Records'.
I want to make people happy through music. It was always my vision to have a big soulful sound so last year, starting small (with my bassist in a freezing shed at the back of a pub), I went about working towards this goal. I am now truly grateful to have a team of incredibly talented musicians around me to bring my songs to life and help spread my message.
Now we want to get out there. We're itching to travel and perform as much as possible especially with a new EP due for release in May. In my years spent playing solo, getting around in my little old car was easy. Now, with 6 of us and a whole load of gear, the gigs we've played have been problematic to say the least and a tour is out of the question. The only way we can move forwards is to get a BAND VAN... and that's where you come in, should you choose to support our cause!
 

The Low Down...

We aren't the wealthiest collection of individuals. 2 of us are still students and I manage to earn enough from music to sustain my own life and my little Renault Clio, but funding a van with insurance costs etc. is something we are unable to do alone. If you make a contribution you will be enabling us to take a crucial 'next step' as a band.
Here is a step by step breakdown of where your money will go if we hit our target.

  • £5,000 budget for the Van itself - I have extensively researched the prices of second hand crew vans that fit our requirements and have relatively low mileage. 'LDV Maxus', 'Ford Transit' and 'Renault Trafic' are the kind of models we are aiming for. Obviously we will have to adapt to what is available on the market at the time of purchase.
     
  •  £1,000 for promotional graphics - one of the most effective means of advertising is to drive around in your brand! On the road, the van will be exposed to thousands of people every day. We therefore plan to utilize our van's potential in this way! This figure is based on estimated quotes from providers based on the approximate size of the Van we will buy.
     
  • £1,950 for 1 years van insurance + breakdown cover - although I have no points or convictions, due to my age (23) Van insurance is very expensive but is obviously a necessity. Also, forking out hundreds of pounds to have the Van recovered should it breakdown on tour is something none of us have the means to do!
  • £500 for Indiegogo fees - this is to cover the Indiegogo charge of 5% for their assistance in the campaign plus additional transaction fees.

If by some miracle we manage to go over our target, or find a quality van at a price below our van budget, a portion of the money will be placed in an 'emergency van kitty' to be used for servicing and maintenance to make sure we can get around and play music for all you lovely people. 
I am also currently fundraising for the various projects (music videos, merchandise, CD's, recording etc) that we have planned for this year, for which we will need somewhere in the region of £5,000. Any left over money from this crowdfunder will be invested straight back into releasing more content for you!
If we are not able to reach our full target, we will prioritize buying a Van and insurance and work towards having graphics printed at a later date. Whatever happens, we will get out on the road somehow!


What you get back

We have loads of really cool incentives on offer to say thank you for helping us in our van quest, including signed CD's, music lessons, living room gigs and a private full band show! Check out everything that we have on offer in the 'PERKS' section to your right >>>>>>>>>
Your help really is incredibly important at this stage in our musical journey and we are extremely grateful for any contribution you wish to make.


The Impact of your generosity?

You have the power to make us mobile! Having effective transport is fundamentally important in the process of touring, and touring is an essential aspect of a career in music. This is exactly what we aim to be doing in the coming months and years across the UK, Europe and further afield. On a practical level, the success of the project for us will mean we can readily get ourselves performing in venues across towns and cities for you guys, wherever you may be. It also means we'll have access to one of the most widely used and effective promotion methods to get thousands of commuters up and down the M6 looking up 'JOHN DHALI'!

Above and beyond our personal growth in success, I do have a broader goal in my heart. Music can undoubtedly be a catalyst for positive change. It has been used for millennia to bring people together, for ritual worship and healing, and to ignite social change. I want to use music for a higher purpose. I want people to leave our gigs inspired to become a better version of themselves. Change happens first on an individual level, then at a collective level. I feel it is my duty to serve people in this way. I am determined and driven to see a world where Self-Realization is a normal part of western life and we are being the kind and compassionate people we were born to be. The way to do this on my part is to bring this philosophy into popular culture through music. The next chapter in the story is getting a VAN...please help!


You can help in lots of ways...

If you can't afford to make a donation but would still like to support, then please spread the word about our cause! Share the campaign with the Indiegogo share tools on social media, tell your family, friends and colleagues, invite us to play a gig in your local area or get us in for an interview at your local radio station. Whatever it is you can do - it will play a part in helping us achieve our goal!

We hope to see you soon in our new BAND VAN! 

Thank you and lots of love to you
story_txt:
A Bit About Me..
About 5 years ago, after a dramatic shift in my life and with the guidance of a spiritual leader (Satguru Sri Ramana Devi) I decided to make music my life's path. From then on, armed with my acoustic guitar and a stomp box, I began gigging as much as I could. With perseverance and a great deal of support, I've witnessed a steady progression. My songs have received national radio airplay, I have won regional awards and last year I signed a record deal with the independent label - 'Kidda Records'.I want to make people happy through music. It was always my vision to have a big soulful sound so last year, starting small (with my bassist in a freezing shed at the back of a pub), I went about working towards this goal. I am now truly grateful to have a team of incredibly talented musicians around me to bring my songs to life and help spread my message.Now we want to get out there. We're itching to travel and perform as much as possible especially with a new EP due for release in May. In my years spent playing solo, getting around in my little old car was easy. Now, with 6 of us and a whole load of gear, the gigs we've played have been problematic to say the least and a tour is out of the question. The only way we can move forwards is to get a BAND VAN... and that's where you come in, should you choose to support our cause! 

The Low Down...
We aren't the wealthiest collection of individuals. 2 of us are still students and I manage to earn enough from music to sustain my own life and my little Renault Clio, but funding a van with insurance costs etc. is something we are unable to do alone. If you make a contribution you will be enabling us to take a crucial 'next step' as a band.Here is a step by step breakdown of where your money will go if we hit our target.


£5,000 budget for the Van itself - I have extensively researched the prices of second hand crew vans that fit our requirements and have relatively low mileage. 'LDV Maxus', 'Ford Transit' and 'Renault Trafic' are the kind of models we are aiming for. Obviously we will have to adapt to what is available on the market at the time of purchase. 
 £1,000 for promotional graphics - one of the most effective means of advertising is to drive around in your brand! On the road, the van will be exposed to thousands of people every day. We therefore plan to utilize our van's potential in this way! This figure is based on estimated quotes from providers based on the approximate size of the Van we will buy. 

£1,950 for 1 years van insurance + breakdown cover - although I have no points or convictions, due to my age (23) Van insurance is very expensive but is obviously a necessity. Also, forking out hundreds of pounds to have the Van recovered should it breakdown on tour is something none of us have the means to do!

£500 for Indiegogo fees - this is to cover the Indiegogo charge of 5% for their assistance in the campaign plus additional transaction fees.


If by some miracle we manage to go over our target, or find a quality van at a price below our van budget, a portion of the money will be placed in an 'emergency van kitty' to be used for servicing and maintenance to make sure we can get around and play music for all you lovely people. I am also currently fundraising for the various projects (music videos, merchandise, CD's, recording etc) that we have planned for this year, for which we will need somewhere in the region of £5,000. Any left over money from this crowdfunder will be invested straight back into releasing more content for you!If we are not able to reach our full target, we will prioritize buying a Van and insurance and work towards having graphics printed at a later date. Whatever happens, we will get out on the road somehow!

What you get back
We have loads of really cool incentives on offer to say thank you for helping us in our van quest, including signed CD's, music lessons, living room gigs and a private full band show! Check out everything that we have on offer in the 'PERKS' section to your right >>>>>>>>>Your help really is incredibly important at this stage in our musical journey and we are extremely grateful for any contribution you wish to make.

The Impact of your generosity?
You have the power to make us mobile! Having effective transport is fundamentally important in the process of touring, and touring is an essential aspect of a career in music. This is exactly what we aim to be doing in the coming months and years across the UK, Europe and further afield. On a practical level, the success of the project for us will mean we can readily get ourselves performing in venues across towns and cities for you guys, wherever you may be. It also means we'll have access to one of the most widely used and effective promotion methods to get thousands of commuters up and down the M6 looking up 'JOHN DHALI'!
Above and beyond our personal growth in success, I do have a broader goal in my heart. Music can undoubtedly be a catalyst for positive change. It has been used for millennia to bring people together, for ritual worship and healing, and to ignite social change. I want to use music for a higher purpose. I want people to leave our gigs inspired to become a better version of themselves. Change happens first on an individual level, then at a collective level. I feel it is my duty to serve people in this way. I am determined and driven to see a world where Self-Realization is a normal part of western life and we are being the kind and compassionate people we were born to be. The way to do this on my part is to bring this philosophy into popular culture through music. The next chapter in the story is getting a VAN...please help!

You can help in lots of ways...
If you can't afford to make a donation but would still like to support, then please spread the word about our cause! Share the campaign with the Indiegogo share tools on social media, tell your family, friends and colleagues, invite us to play a gig in your local area or get us in for an interview at your local radio station. Whatever it is you can do - it will play a part in helping us achieve our goal!We hope to see you soon in our new BAND VAN! 
Thank you and lots of love to you

story:
What are we doing?

Yonge Guns began in 2013 with ideals of competing in the Collegiate Barbershop Quartet Contest. To say we'd be planning a CD and a trip overseas in 5 years would have been ludicrous, but here we are.

We have spent 5 years building a repertoire and an identity that is unique and true to us. Our CD, Show Some Love, is an opportunity to capture that ever developing identity, to take a snapshot of who we are in 2018. The 12 songs that will appear on this CD are exactly that. They encompass every story we've told, every laugh we've had, and every emotion we've felt.

  1. My Lady Loves To Dance (Dean Martin Cover)
  2. History (One Direction Cover)
  3. Secondhand White Baby Grand (from SMASH)
  4. I'm A Train (King's Singers Cover)
  5. All My Life (K-Ci & JoJo Cover)
  6. I Could Be Happy With You (from Boyfriend)
  7. Canadian Girls (Dean Brody Cover)
  8. When I Look At You (from The Scarlet Pimpernel)
  9. God, I Hate Shakespeare (from Something Rotten!)
  10. Show Some Love (original song by Reuven Grajner)
  11. Who Lives, Who Dies, Who Tells Your Story (from Hamilton)
  12. Hideaway (Jacob Collier Cover)

Never one to shy away from a challenge, we are also embarking on an 11,000 km round trip journey to Edinburgh, Scotland to perform at the world famous Edinburgh Fringe Festival. The Fringe is the world's largest arts festival, hosting 3,398 shows and selling 2,696,884 tickets for the 2017 iteration. Our 1-week run will be an experience like no other we could have dreamed of and we are beyond excited to begin.

But none of that would have been, nor will be, possible without the immense generosity and support of the people we love and the people who have graced us with their attendance at our shows and contests. 

What can you do?

Needless to say nothing in life is free, and we aren't quite Pentatonix just yet. We're hoping to raise $5000, a small portion of our total costs, to relieve the pressure of these projects.

Each dollar raised will go towards offsetting everything from flights and accommodation in Edinburgh to our amazing album artwork being done by Kim Sison and CD production being done by Dylan Bell. We want to make these endeavours the most successful they can be in order to spread the joy of music worldwide.

We have some incredible perk packages available to those who donate, including limited edition options only available through this campaign. If not for the merchandise, we implore you to donate for the love of music and all who share it!

Is there another way?

Of course! For those who do not wish to donate we urge you to share this campaign and the projects we are pursuing. We would be nothing if not for your support!

story:
Dear Music People, 

Hello...Keith Putney of Keith Putney Productions here.  While you may not know me (then again, you just might), my company has produced tours by The Rolling Stones' Mick Taylor, Peter Asher & Gordon Waller, aka Peter & Gordon, Albert Lee, Gerry and the Pacemakers, the 2014/2015 British Invasion Tour and more recently for Peter Asher with his own "Memoir" show and with Jeremy Clyde.  I'm particularly excited to share with you news about a new project.  

We would like you to join us in the making of a brand new album by “Sister Kate” Taylor, a project that would be a reunion of many of the great talents that were at the center of the Los Angeles music scene during the explosion of the singer-songwriter era. Our cast includes: Peter Asher, Danny Kortchmar, Russ Kunkel, Leland Sklar, Waddy Wachtel, Albert Lee, Scarlet Rivera, Kate's daughters Liz Witham and Aretha Taylor, the fabulous Ukeladies (Ukeladies are: Laurie David, Joanne Ashe, Amy Irving, Judy Belushi and Kate) and the vocal dynamo herself, Kate Taylor.

L-R: Keith Putney, Russ Kunkel, Jeff Alan Ross, Albert Lee, Kate Taylor, Peter Asher, Leland Sklar, Waddy Wachtel, Danny Kortchmar, Nathaniel Kunkel. 

Allow me to explain by way of recollection.

In a conversation on Martha’s Vineyard in August 2019, where I was visiting to join in the celebration of Kate Taylor’s 70th birthday, we spoke about the upcoming 50th anniversary of Kate’s first album, “Sister Kate”.  The album was recorded in 1970/71 in Southern California, where, as described in an April 1971 review in the Tampa Times, “Crack record producer Peter Asher has assembled a lineup of supporting musicians that sound like the Who’s Who of the recording world”.  Indeed, a great cast was on hand, with Carole King, James Taylor, and Linda Ronstadt among the many masters of the musical arts contributing to Kate’s sparkling debut album.

As anyone who knows Kate or who has seen her perform can attest, her energy and enthusiasm are infectious.  She and I discussed the idea of doing something to mark the anniversary, and I, taken in by her inescapable charm, suggested that her friends and fans might share this enthusiasm and support a reassembling of what I call “The Dream Team”…meaning those mentioned above, i.e. Peter Asher as producer, and the likes of Danny “Kootch” Kortchmar, Waddy Wachtel and Albert Lee on guitars, Leland Sklar on bass, Russ Kunkel on drums, plus Peter’s right hand man -and frequent Kate musical cohort Jeff Alan Ross on piano and acoustic guitar.  With the sublime soufulness of Kate herself on lead vocals…well, you know that can’t be bad.

Yes! "The Dream Team" has agreed  that this project should go forward, This page is an act of faith that you will be with us.  With you beside us, this can and will happen. Please take a look at the premiums we offer as a small way of humbly expressing our heartfelt gratitude for your contribution to this dream of an artistic endeavor.  We’re truly thankful that, pending your support, all the above will come together to make music to mend the heart, raise the spirit, and share the love.

More from me after some words from Sister Kate herself.

-------------------------------------

 "Why Wait?"

Hello Dear and Darling Fellow Travelers,

Kate here.

I have some exciting news!

2021 is the 50th anniversary of the release of my first record, "Sister Kate".

My friend Peter Asher, renowned producer and musical artist, was my first manager and producer in 1970-'71. We recorded "Sister Kate" at a very exciting time to be in Los Angeles. The place was a magnet for many gifted, fun and soulful musical artists just on the cusp of extraordinarily creative and productive careers. Several of them played on "Sister Kate".  Peter would go on to produce many wonderful artists including brother James, Linda Ronstadt, Cher, Elton John, etc!  Peter had had a hit making career as a singer in the British singing duo, Peter and Gordon, and went on to be the three time Grammy awarding winning record producer that he is!

Now, on the anniversary of our first collaboration 50 years ago, Peter and I are making a new Lp together.   We have several of the original players from "Sister Kate"; Danny Kortchmar, Lee Sklar and Russ Kunkel, lined up to play on this new record, as well as other favorite players of ours; Albert Lee, Waddy Wachtel and Jeff Alan Ross, Scarlet Rivera, my daughters and my dear Ukeladies.  We have original tunes of mine plus old and new favorites that will be included in this collection.  I am very excited to be working with Peter on  this project and to be going into the studio with him.   We have started our recording!  There will be updates as we progress.

Our funding needs include a highly reasonable recording budget and an amount for vinyl and cd production, art work and marketing.  

This is your opportunity to pre-order the CD and browse through other perks available for you if you're of the mind to contribute to this project. 

If you're unable to contribute, or if you will be contributing and want to also do this, it would be immensely helpful if you'd share this campaign with your friends via your social media and mailing lists!

We have plans for appearances in celebration of this collaboration and we will be updating you on those as the time progresses.

If you have any questions or comments about the project or the incentives, please don't hesitate to write me at kate@katetaylor.com. 

Thank you for considering this invitation to be on the team!  Hoping to see you and hear from you sometime very soon. 

With love, Kate

-------------------------------------

Thank you, my dear and great Sister Kate. We must mutually thank our own Sandy Hicks, without whom we would never have gotten this far!

As you will see, we have amassed many tasty perks to entice you into joining our cause. If you'd like to contribute to the campaign, without perks, you can simply click on the 'Back It' button.  You'll be able to enter the amount you'd like to contribute, and choose your payment method.

At the very least we hope you enjoy taking a look and considering the idea of being a part of the dream!

All the best,

Keith Putney

story:
Brief summary / Pequeño resumen

Hi everyone! We are Psychic Equalizer and we recently released our brand new EP Revealed. We've got some really great reviews from press and radio and so many nice comments from fans, family and friends around the world. Since all of our year plans have been cancelled due to the pandemic, we've decided to make... Revealed (Part 2). In fact, we are already working on new songs!

¡Hola! Somos Psychic Equalizer y acabamos de publicar nuestro nuevo EP Revealed. Hemos recibido algunas críticas muy buenas en prensa y radio y maravillosos comentarios de seguidores, familia y amigos de diferentes partes del mundo. Dado que todos nuestros planes para este año se han visto cancelados por la crisis sanitaria, hemos decidido hacer... Revealed (Part 2). De hecho, ¡ya estamos trabajando en nuevas canciones!

This is 'Revealed' / Esto es 'Revealed'

 

This is what we need / Esto es lo que necesitamos

As some of you know, a couple of years ago we did another pretty successful campaign to finish our album The Sixth Extinction. This time, we need a lot less from you. We know it's a very difficult moment for everyone, so we really appreciate it if you could support us - even if it's just a little bit! The funds we receive will be used to:

  • Help with recording and promotion costs.
  • Production and manufacture of CDs.
  • Platform fee and payment of taxes.
     


Como ya muchos sabréis, hace un par de años hicimos una campaña para poder terminar nuestro álbum The Sixth Extinction. Esta vez, necesitamos mucho menos de vosotros. Sabemos que todos estamos pasando por una díficil época y por eso estaremos tremendamente agradecidos si nos podéis echar un cable, ¡incluso si solo es un poquito! Las donaciones que recibamos se usarán para:

  • Ayuda para cubrir algunos gastos adicionales de la grabación y la promoción.
  • Producción de las recompensas.
  • El coste de uso de la plataforma y el pago de impuestos.


Other ways you can help / Otras maneras de ayudarnos

If you're unable to donate this time, you can still help us a lot by sharing this campaign. Use the 'share' button and post it on your social media, Whatsapp, email, yell it out loud, smoke signals... anything! You can also visit our websites and help us get traffic. And of course, follow us on YouTube, Facebook and Instagram. Watch our videos, listen to our music on all major digital platforms. Share it all! It might seem like a small thing, but it would help us enormously. THANK YOU!!!
 


No te preocupes si no puedes donar nada esta vez, porque todavía puedes ayudarnos de otra manera. Dale al botón de compartir y pon esta campaña en tus canales de redes sociales, whatsapp, e-mail, grítalo por todos lados, haz señales de humo... ¡Lo que sea! También puedes visitar nuestras páginas web y ayudarnos a generar más tráfico. Y por supuesto, síguenos en Youtube, Facebook e Instagram. Mira nuestros videos y escucha nuestra música en todas las tiendas digitales. ¡Compártelo, no se te olvide! Pensarás que no estás haciendo mucho, pero honestamente... ¡Hazlo porque eso es justo lo que necesitamos! ¡¡¡GRACIAS!!!


----------

PSYCHIC EQUALIZER
Facebook
Youtube
Instagram

---------

India Hooi
Carlos Barragán
Adrian Ubiaga
Hugo Selles

Como ya muchos sabréis, hace un par de años hicimos una campaña para poder terminar nuestro álbum The Sixth Extinction. Esta vez, necesitamos mucho menos de vosotros. Sabemos que todos estamos pasando por una díficil época y por eso estaremos tremendamente agradecidos si nos podéis echar un cable, ¡incluso si solo es un poquito! Las donaciones que recibamos se usarán para: 

Ayuda para cubrir algunos gastos adicionales de la grabación y la promoción.
Producción de las recompensas.
El coste de uso de la plataforma y el pago de impuestos.



Other ways you can help / Otras maneras de ayudarnos
If you're unable to donate this time, you can still help us a lot by sharing this campaign. Use the 'share' button and post it on your social media, Whatsapp, email, yell it out loud, smoke signals... anything! You can also visit our websites and help us get traffic. And of course, follow us on YouTube, Facebook and Instagram. Watch our videos, listen to our music on all major digital platforms. Share it all! It might seem like a small thing, but it would help us enormously. THANK YOU!!! 

No te preocupes si no puedes donar nada esta vez, porque todavía puedes ayudarnos de otra manera. Dale al botón de compartir y pon esta campaña en tus canales de redes sociales, whatsapp, e-mail, grítalo por todos lados, haz señales de humo... ¡Lo que sea! También puedes visitar nuestras páginas web y ayudarnos a generar más tráfico. Y por supuesto, síguenos en Youtube, Facebook e Instagram. Mira nuestros videos y escucha nuestra música en todas las tiendas digitales. ¡Compártelo, no se te olvide! Pensarás que no estás haciendo mucho, pero honestamente... ¡Hazlo porque eso es justo lo que necesitamos! ¡¡¡GRACIAS!!!
----------PSYCHIC EQUALIZERFacebookYoutubeInstagram---------
India HooiCarlos BarragánAdrian UbiagaHugo Selles

story:
Hi, my name is Pete Ray Biggin. I’ve been a professional drummer since the age of 13 and have been fortunate to play with many fantastic bands and artists, including Amy Winehouse, Adele, Incognito, Chaka Khan and the band I play with now, Level 42, as well as fronting my own band PB Underground.

With my best friend and business partner, Rick Green, we’re building a creative hub of 15 superbly designed recording studios with live/control rooms and production suites with and without vocal booths, situated in a creative hub in Watford, North London. 

The studios range from 110 sqf to 350 sqf and are tailored for Producers, Songwriters, Composers, Artists, Musicians, Mix & Mastering Engineers, Programmers, TV Editors and Voiceovers.

What We Need To Complete The Studios

We identified the lack of affordable, quality designed, purpose-built recording studios and production suites as a major hurdle for musicians and artists looking for creative space to work.

So in 2019, we put our life savings into building Track 23 Studios. Rick is a top-quality builder and specialises in soundproofing, and along with my expertise in recording and production we designed the studios and started construction — everything was powering along and we could see the finish line getting closer.

Then in March 2020, the pandemic hit, and the performing arts and live music industry were decimated globally. Along with so many other artists, I lost my entire year’s work and income. Rick continued to fund construction by working on other building projects, but this became unsustainable.


 

We’re still paying rent but construction has stalled, so we desperately need your help to get these studios completed, not only so we can start covering the rent, but also provide much needed creative spaces to help get the musicians, mixers and producers back doing what they do best.

We are down to the last of our finances, having received an initial investment of £150k and pouring our life savings into the pot as well. We need your help to raise a final £65k so we can complete construction and open the studios in May 2021.

What You Get For Supporting Us

We have an exciting list of perks and incentives to say thank you for supporting us.

I'm putting up my time as a drum instructor to offer one-on-one sessions with musicians who can benefit from my skills and experience not just as a drummer, but as a mentor to those looking for a career in the music industry through to hard-core professionals who want to further hone their drumming craft. I'm also offering to play on your own track.

Rick will also be putting up his time as an expert consultant for constructing studios both large and small, and even soundproofing projects for both domestic and commercial use.

I'm also really excited to announce that I will be soon opening my own online music academy, so you can learn drumming from the very basics all the way through to the very best skills and techniques that have been the foundation of my own career.

We will be offering advance subscriptions to these online courses so when it's launched you will be the very first ones to enrol and learn from me directly.

And how's for the wow factor! We're offering a Co-Production credit on the next PB Underground album, a private gig by PB Underground,  and the once in a lifetime opportunity to feature your own track as a hidden bonus on the next PBUG album!


 

We're also offering heavily discounted corporate sponsorship deals to have your brand presence at the Track23 Studios.

The Impact

The arts and music industries have been decimated, live performances have been cancelled indefinitely, stopping us from doing what we love and are great at. It’s because of this that Track23 Studios is an even more important project to create an affordable space for musicians and producers.

While we don’t know how long this pandemic will last, the one thing we can do to make a positive and lasting contribution to the arts and music sector is to finish the construction of the studios to provide musicians and producers with a badly needed creative hub that is built for purpose, affordable and perfectly designed through my own experience as an accomplished musician and Rick as a top-quality construction contractor.

Where The Funds Will Go

Every penny we receive will go towards completing construction on the studios, nearly all of it earmarked for construction materials and the fit-out of the studios to a completed and bookable state so we can start earning income from the project to ensure it's a self-sustaining and enduring resource for the music sector in the future.

If the initial goal is not reached, we will use the available funds to complete as many studios as we can within the budget. If we go over the goal we will be able to spend more on higher-quality gear to outfit the studios and focus on getting this built as fast as we can!

How You Can Help

Please, we need your help to get this unique project completed and up and running. 

We understand that not everyone can make a contribution, but even something as simple as sharing this campaign on your own social media to gain awareness would be a huge help!

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign. From me and Rick, our best wishes go out to you and your families in this incredibly difficult time.

And to the artists, musicians, producers, roadies, sound engineers, event promoters and support staff from all over the world who have lost their livelihood — we salute you!

Sincerely yours,
Pete Ray Biggin & Rick Green

story:
My Story

I am Christena Graves, a singer/songwriter based in Lawrence, KS. After an 18 year hiatus to raise my kids, I am unpausing my music career. While it’s been a long space of time, I haven’t stopped writing. I’ve been collecting songs and waiting for the right time to make a record. When COVID hit and slowed things down, I found myself with time to work on new music. In August, our dear friend and record producer, Greg Lafollette, moved back to Kansas City after being in Nashville for many years. He agreed to work with us and in the late summer of 2020 we brought this collection of 10 songs to life. I’ve named the album Finding My Footing.  I’m finding my footing as a songwriter and performer again, and as a woman, mother, and partner, I’m always on a search to find my footing through the challenges of life. 

 

This Record

I've realized as I've gotten older that songwriting is one of the ways I process through life's ups and downs.  We've had a lot of loss to work through the last several years: a life threatening miscarriage, a close friend's suicide, losing a parent, Brandon's heart attack three years ago.  Sometimes all I can do is pick up my guitar and strum.  Sometimes songs come, sometimes tears come.  It's a time of healing for me.  Most of the songs on Finding My Footing came from these very moments.  Some of them come from the joy of having a friend and partner of 24 years for whom I am so thankful to have in my life.  

Greg arrived at exactly the right moment for us.  We tried several times to work on making a record but always ran into some snag. He stepped in when we needed both inspiration and direction.  I have so appreciated his sensitivity to getting the emotion of each song right. He worked hard to make me feel comfortable and helped me process some difficult feelings during the recording. His production style and addition of vocals and instruments have helped to make this collection of songs a moving, beautiful album.  

Our Plan

That brings me to asking you, our friends and family, fans old and new, for your help to see this project through to the end. We have finished the recording but now we need to duplicate, and market the record in addition to covering initial expenses from recording. I know this is a hard time for so many people with all of the COVID shutdowns and changes. It has been difficult for many musicians who have had to find new ways to keep performing and creating. I believe this is the right time for this record. Even though some were written before COVID, the sentiment is right for this season and I hope it brings comfort to many people. I know music has helped me through many hard times. 

 

What the funds will help us accomplish:

Making cds (which includes packaging)

Vinyl record pressing (which involves extra vinyl specific mastering and packaging) 

T-shirts

Stickers

Artwork prints

Any extra monies will go to cover expenses related to recording and production.

We have come up with different perks packages to help you get the items you are most interested in. Any amount is so appreciated! The packs will offer anything from a single sticker to a homemade meal and private concert at the Graves home in Lawrence, KS. Also, we are so very excited to be able to offer a one of a kind custom snare drum with art inspired by the album cover thanks to WFLIII Drums. 

 

Risks and challenges:

As you may know, crowdfunding is risky business. If we don’t raise enough money, we won’t be able to duplicate the record which will make it more challenging for us in the long run. CD and vinyl pressing is done in batches, usually not less than a few hundred.  Basically, if we sell 25 vinyl records in the funding campaign but we order 300, we will have records left to sell on our web store to new fans. This will help us offset the very low rate that we receive from streaming sites. The current pay out for streaming is $0.00331 per play. That’s $33 for 10,000 streams. Your support of this project will set us up for success by helping us launch without going in debt. 

 

Ways you can help:

Share with your friends!  Share this campaign on your social media pages or tell a friend who might be interested in supporting us.

“Follow” and “Like” @christenagravesmusic on Facebook and Instagram

Go to https://www.christenagravesmusic.com to join our email list for updates about gigs and upcoming projects.  

 

I am so excited to bring this project to you at this time! I think it is music that will bring peace.

Thank you!

Christena
