story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Zev Howling Music, recently I was approached by Liberty Music PR! They are a public relations company based in London and Los Angeles. They happened to stumble upon some of my music and would like for me to work with them. I have worked so hard for a chance to be noticed and this is my first LEGIT chance. This means having a real backing behind me and not just me working alone and doing my own promo. After years of no's I have a big chance to receive a huge YES and push to be a better artist.

What We Need & What You Get

For this to happen I need to raise $3000 for the campaign I am choosing. What that campaign is you might ask includes; Press pitching meaning articles, blogs, and advertisements. It also includes possible brand deals, playlisting and Radio. With this money I can get all these things taken care of, along with a new song! Liberty has major clients from Universal Music to Warner Music Group! Honestly this is so exciting! Even if this goal isn't met it will be used to independently promote and fund my music. The grind will not stop.

The Impact

There isn't a guarantee that working with Liberty will get where I want to be entirely BUT, that is a chance we take as artists! The point of my campaign is to give myself the chance to take my music and craft even more serious. I have been doing this alone for so long I can really use this service to  do some real good in my career.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

The music industry is an intense and fast paced environment and it can eat new artists like myself up and never think twice about it. For every artist full of potential there's someone who can have 10X more that potential and be better at many things. But for me things like that do not matter at all! My love for this runs deeper than anything, there is nothing in this world that will keep me from my goal of being a great artist. Outworking my competition whether it be in the studio or out meeting new people and getting them into the vision. I don't like to call people fans I see these people as like minded friends who all want the same thing as me at the end of the day. Happiness and peace of mind.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you can not contribute to this it is all okay! You can contribute in other ways! share this post! share my music, stream my music! follow me on instagram/twitter/spotify/apple music! Come say hi and express how you feel! Just support the vision anyway you can! Use the share tools provided by inidiegogo for fast sharing!

story:
●Unfortunately Paypal is not an option for crowdfunding platforms anymore. But if you want to support us through Paypal or Transaction you can also send your support per Paypal https://www.paypal.com/de/home

To pinartatlikazan@gmail.com and write down the name of the perk you want to have and I will send you a confirmation E-Mail! For Transaction Information please see the FAQ above. ●

 

Jazz, world, folk, pop, english, turkish, german and cinematic sounds fusioned in Berlin!

(für Deutsch bitte runterscrollen)  

Untertitel für das Video über das (CC) Icon unten rechts

 

Welcome to my crowdfunding campaign to support my first album we will be recording with amazing musicians in Berlin!

Hello/Hallo/Merhaba dear friends, family and fans! My name is Pinar Tatlikazan and I am personally inviting you to be a part of this debut album of my solo project called "Pina Berlin"! Your support (through the years and now) means so much to me and I really want to connect with you through my music, some of which I wrote inspired by you! We already have the arrangements and demos of the songs ready and they are waiting to be recorded. We need your help to bring this project from a construction site to a finished album.

We released the first single of the album and my debut single ‘I’ll be missing you’ with it's official video right before we started the crowdfunding.

 

 
Even though I wrote this song 5 years ago from a place far from home in a 'missing' state of mind, missing the past, the future and the moment, today in lockdown we are not too far from each other but still have to miss each other... This song is for everybody who is in that 'missing' state of mind right now to remember that we are not alone!
 

Read on to learn about me, this project and the team...

 

About me:

 

 

I was born and raised in Bursa /Turkey and after my time in Istanbul at a Turkish-German high school and a summer musical course in Rostock in 2010 I came to Berlin to be a part of the music and culture and first studied architecture. Since I was a little girl I have been singing, acting, dancing. I just wanted to tell stories and connect to people and spread the love through music, as the most innocent and sincere way of sharing peace on this world. I did believe I could change the world with music! 

I grew up listening to Chet Baker, Miles Davis, Dave Brubeck, Paul Desmond, Carmen McRae and Norah Jones. At the age of 15 I started taking classical singing classes and playing the tenor saxophone, and got into the music of the 60s and 70s with Beatles, Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd. It was after I moved to Berlin that I started to treasure my roots in the Turkish music. And that's where my need to fusion the styles started as I became a fusion of cultures myself after 10 years of living in Berlin and living the rich music scene in Berlin showed me that music can bring people together!

After 3 years of long nights at the university in Berlin and a student band in 2013 I finally started going to jam sessions which inspired to me write songs with a ukulele I was given as a gift. That changed my life and reminded me of my dream again. SINGING FOR THE PEOPLE!  After I took courses at the jazz department during my exchange semester in the U.S. I started to prepare for jazz vocal programs of the music schools in Germany. Making it to the last auditions with three other singers in the HfMT Hamburg in 2016 gave me the motivation to keep going. After 3,5 years of working at my architecture job for 3,5 years in the day, getting tendonitis in my arms, singing in a lot of bands, writing songs in the night and recording arrangement ideas to my songs in the bathroom at work... Since we made the demo of the first song it was impossible for me to concentrate on anything else, I woke up and slept with ideas and sounds floating in my mind so I changed my life and had no other choice than to dedicate myself to my dream of recording my songs I've been writing for 7 years and share them from the heart with you!

And that's when I met the producer of this album Fico Jessen!

 

About the team and the project:

 

I met the amazing musician and producer Fico Jessen in January 2020 and we immediately connected and made a demo of my first single "I'll be missing you". After showing him the lead sheets of my songs and notebooks full of song sketches and seeing how he understood my music we just started to work on the idea of an album and oh you couldn't imagine how excited I am to see how the dream world in my head is becoming real!

I’m so happy and lucky to be able to work with a great professional team with Aarón Castrillo on the drums and Lea Simon doing the artwork for the cover of the album. And one of the songs "Seven hours", which was the first song I ever played in public, we will produce with Roland Satterwhite, an amazing musician and my dear friend who made me believe in my music years before I trusted myself to bring it out like this! In addition we will invite further professional musicians to record the songs.

Only with these amazing professionals are my songs able to grow and get out there to reach you.

Although the Covid-19 hit the musicians and the culture scene really hard, and we miss playing live, it led us to stay in and produce with a creativity that was eager to be let out.

 

About my music:

 

You've seen my debut single but don't think that the album will be full of sad ballads! The influences of the music are mostly from my experiences since I came to Berlin with this dream (that's where“Pina Berlin” comes from) and from different kinds of genres from jazz to folk, pop, soul, brasilian music, blues, Turkish music, German poetry ethnic rhythms! Some songs have cinematic elements that will bring you to another world to tell their stories inspired by my love of everyday urban sounds and the power of their storytelling.

The songs are mostly in English but I have a special German-Turkish song which I am super excited about! So this is a whole journey which includes a song I wrote in 2013 but also my last song from the summer of 2020 in the middle of the pandemic and a personal health crisis "There is always hope"...

Once a friend of mine said that my music makes her "feel the sexy shaking through your body or feel inner tears with her ballad, pray with a mantra, but still at the end of the song you will feel the hope and positivity that leaves one with a spark of light in one's heart." It's my biggest wish to connect with every single one of you in that level and spread the positivity and hope through music during these weird times!

 

What do we need your support for?

 

I financed my first single myself and saved up money for this album however making a record as an independent artist is expensive and my savings were not enough to finish it. We already have the arrangements and demos of the songs ready and they are waiting to be recorded. We need your help to bring this project from a construction site to a finished album.

The making and release of this album will cost a sum of 10,200€ inclusive of:

  • Production
  • Musicians
  • Studio rent
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Printing the CDs and Vinyls
  • Artwork for the cover of the album
  • Publicity and promotion
  • Shipment of the physical copies
  • Music Video

(Not including 5% IndieGogo service fee & 3% payment processing fee)

 

We have a wide range of options, with which you can support us and can pre-order as listed on the right side of your screen. We tried to set the rewards so diverse for you to be able to pick the one that fits you best. You can click and open the so called "perks" to see what is included and chose one you would like to have as a "thank you" for your donation.

*We can only press a double-Vinyl if we reach a number of 30 orders during this crowdfunding. In case we don't reach that number you will receive 2 copies of the CD.*

 

Your Donation Makes a Difference

 

Not only are you supporting my dream, you are also supporting the professionals of the culture and music scene I am working with to get through these very unusual times, when there are no more live concerts since months now.

We really appreciate your generous support! You make what we do possible and we are thankful from the bottom of our hearts!

<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3

 

Thank you so much!

 

Thank you so much for reading my story and about our project and watching my videos! I hope you would like to join our team and become a part of our journey. Every single supporter is bringing us a step closer to present you the best sound and music we can offer. I can't wait to share all the fruits of our hard work since months and connect through music with you!

Much love,

Your Pina

 

Other Ways to Help 

 

If you would like to support but can't afford to donate, we totally understand that! There are several other ways you can support us if you want to:

  • Spread the word! Share this campaign on your social media pages or tell a friend who might be interested in supporting.
  • "Like" and "Follow" us on Facebook & Instagram & YouTube (links below)
  • Join our Newsletter mailing list to hear about our latest ventures and upcoming gigs (See email sign-up form at https://www.pinaberlin.com )

Also help other musicians! Help your local musicians! They need you now!

 

Risks and Challenges

 

There are some parts of producing an album which can be deeply effected by the pandemic situation but since we are a core team who are working on it we are pretty independent. The concerts might have to be delayed with this situation. Of course the Covid-19 pandemic also makes everything a bit more complicated like meeting musicians in the studio. In this case it will just take more time.

_______________________________________________________________________________________

 

 

DEUTSCHE VERSION

Jazz, World, Folk, Pop, englische, türkische, deutsche und cinemastische Klänge fusioniert in Berlin!

Willkommen bei meiner Crowdfunding-Kampagne zur Unterstützung meines ersten Albums, das wir mit tollen Musikern in Berlin aufnehmen werden!

Hallo/Hallo/Merhaba liebe Freunde, Familie und Fans! Mein Name ist Pinar Tatlikazan und ich lade Euch persönlich ein, Teil des Debütalbums meines Soloprojekts namens "Pina Berlin" zu sein! Eure Unterstützung (über die Jahre und jetzt) bedeutet mir so viel und ich möchte mich wirklich mit Euch durch meine Musik verbinden, von der ich einige inspiriert von Euch geschrieben habe! Wir haben bereits die Arrangements und Demos der Songs fertig und sie warten darauf, aufgenommen zu werden. Wir brauchen Ihre Hilfe, um dieses Projekt von einer Baustelle zu einem fertigen Album zu bringen.

Lesen Sie weiter, um mehr über mich, dieses Projekt und das Team zu erfahren...

Über mich:

Ich bin in Bursa /Türkei geboren und aufgewachsen und nach meiner Zeit in Istanbul an einem türkisch-deutschen Gymnasium und einem musikalischen Sommerkurs in Rostock bin ich 2010 nach Berlin gekommen, um ein Teil der Musik und Kultur zu sein und habe zunächst Architektur studiert. Seit ich ein kleines Mädchen war, habe ich gesungen, geschauspielert und getanzt. Ich wollte einfach Geschichten erzählen und mich mit Menschen verbinden und die Liebe durch Musik verbreiten, als die unschuldigste und aufrichtigste Art, Frieden auf dieser Welt zu teilen. Ich habe geglaubt, dass ich die Welt mit Musik verändern kann!

Ich wuchs mit dem Hören von Chet Baker, Miles Davis, Dave Brubeck, Paul Desmond, Carmen McRae und Norah Jones auf. Mit 15 Jahren begann ich, klassischen Gesangsunterricht zu nehmen und Tenorsaxophon zu spielen, und geriet in die Musik der 60er und 70er Jahre mit Beatles, Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd. Erst als ich nach Berlin zog, begann ich meine Wurzeln in der türkischen Musik zu schätzen. Und da begann mein Bedürfnis, die Stile zu fusionieren, da ich selbst eine Fusion der Kulturen wurde, nachdem ich 10 Jahre in Berlin lebte und die reiche Musikszene in Berlin mir zeigte, dass Musik Menschen zusammenbringen kann!

Nach 3 Jahren langer Nächte an der Universität in Berlin und einer Studentenband fing ich 2013 endlich an, zu Jam-Sessions zu gehen, was mich dazu inspirierte, Songs mit einer Ukulele zu schreiben, die ich geschenkt bekam. Das veränderte mein Leben und erinnerte mich wieder an meinen Traum. FÜR DIE MENSCHEN ZU SINGEN!  Nachdem ich während meines Austauschsemesters in den USA Kurse an der Jazzabteilung belegt hatte, begann ich mich auf die Jazzgesangsprogramme der Musikschulen in Deutschland vorzubereiten. Das Erreichen des letzten Vorsingens mit drei anderen Sängern an der HfMT Hamburg im Jahr 2016 gab mir die Motivation, weiterzumachen. Nachdem ich 3,5 Jahre lang tagsüber in meinem Architektur-Job gearbeitet, Sehnenscheidenentzündungen in den Armen bekommen, in vielen Bands gesungen, nachts Songs geschrieben und auf der Arbeit im Badezimmer Arrangement-Ideen zu meinen Songs aufgenommen hatte... Seit wir das Demo des ersten Songs gemacht haben, war es für mich unmöglich, mich auf etwas anderes zu konzentrieren, ich wachte auf und schlief mit Ideen und Sounds, die in meinem Kopf schwebten, also änderte ich mein Leben und hatte keine andere Wahl, als mich meinem Traum zu widmen, meine Songs, die ich seit 7 Jahren schreibe, aufzunehmen und sie von Herzen mit euch zu teilen!

Und da habe ich den Produzenten dieses Albums, Fico Jessen, kennengelernt!

 

Über das Team und das Projekt:

Ich traf den großartigen Musiker und Produzenten Fico Jessen im Januar 2020 und wir verbanden uns sofort und machten ein Demo meiner ersten Single "I'll be missing you". Nachdem ich ihm die Leadsheets meiner Songs und Notizbücher voller Songskizzen gezeigt hatte und sah, wie sehr er meine Musik verstand, fingen wir einfach an, an der Idee eines Albums zu arbeiten, und oh ihr könnt euch nicht vorstellen, wie aufgeregt ich bin, zu sehen, wie die Traumwelt in meinem Kopf echt wird!

Ich bin so glücklich und habe das Glück, mit einem großartigen, professionellen Team arbeiten zu können, mit Aarón Castrillo am Schlagzeug und Lea Simon, die das Artwork für das Cover des Albums gemacht hat. Und einen der Songs "Seven hours", der der erste Song war, den ich jemals in der Öffentlichkeit gespielt habe, werden wir mit Roland Satterwhite produzieren, einem erstaunlichen Musiker und meinem lieben Freund, der mir den Glauben an meine Musik gegeben hat, Jahre bevor ich mir selbst zugetraut habe, sie so herauszubringen! Außerdem werden wir weitere professionelle Musiker einladen, um die Songs aufzunehmen.

Nur mit diesen wundervollen Profis sind meine Songs in der Lage zu wachsen und nach draußen zu gelangen, um Sie zu erreichen.

Obwohl der Covid-19 die Musiker und die Kulturszene wirklich hart getroffen hat und wir es vermissen, live zu spielen, hat es uns dazu gebracht, drinnen zu bleiben und mit einer Kreativität zu produzieren, die unbedingt rausgelassen werden wollte.

 

Über meine Musik:

Wir haben bereits die erste Single des Albums und meine Debütsingle 'I'll be missing you' mit dem offiziellen Video veröffentlicht, kurz bevor wir das Crowdfunding gestartet haben.

Auch wenn ich diesen Song vor 5 Jahren von einem Ort weit weg von zu Hause in einem 'vermissenden' Geisteszustand geschrieben habe, in dem ich die Vergangenheit, die Zukunft und den Moment vermisse, so sind wir heute in Lockdown nicht allzu weit voneinander entfernt und müssen uns trotzdem gegenseitig vermissen... Dieser Song ist für alle, die sich gerade in diesem 'vermissenden' Geisteszustand befinden, um sich daran zu erinnern, dass wir nicht alleine sind!

Denkt aber nicht, dass das Album voll von traurigen Balladen sein wird! Die Einflüsse der Musik sind größtenteils aus meinen Erfahrungen, seit ich mit diesem Traum nach Berlin gekommen bin (daher kommt "Pina Berlin") und aus verschiedenen Arten von Genres von Jazz bis Folk, Pop, Soul, brasilianischer Musik, Blues, türkischer Musik, deutscher Poesie und ethnischen Rhythmen! Einige Songs haben cineastische Elemente, die Sie in eine andere Welt versetzen und ihre Geschichten erzählen, inspiriert von meiner Liebe zu alltäglichen urbanen Klängen und der Kraft ihrer Erzählung.

Die Songs sind größtenteils auf Englisch, aber ich habe einen speziellen deutsch-türkischen Song, auf den ich super aufgeregt bin! Es ist also eine ganze Reise, die einen Song beinhaltet, den ich 2013 geschrieben habe, aber auch meinen letzten Song aus dem Sommer 2020 inmitten der Pandemie und einer persönlichen Gesundheitskrise "There is always hope"...

Eine Freundin von mir sagte einmal, dass meine Musik sie dazu bringt, "das sexy Schütteln durch deinen Körper zu spüren oder innere Tränen mit meiner Ballade zu fühlen, mit einem Mantra zu beten, aber am Ende des Liedes fühlst du immer noch die Hoffnung und Positivität, die einen mit einem Funken Licht im Herzen zurücklässt." Es ist mein größter Wunsch, mich mit jedem einzelnen von euch auf dieser Ebene zu verbinden und die Positivität und Hoffnung durch Musik während dieser verrückten Zeiten zu verbreiten!

 

Wozu brauchen wir Eure Unterstützung?

Ich habe meine erste Single selbst finanziert und Geld für dieses Album gespart, aber eine Platte als unabhängiger Künstler zu machen ist teuer und meine Ersparnisse reichten nicht aus, um es fertigzustellen. Wir haben bereits die Arrangements und Demos der Songs fertig und sie warten darauf, aufgenommen zu werden. Wir brauchen Ihre Hilfe, um dieses Projekt von einer Baustelle zu einem fertigen Album zu bringen.

Die Herstellung und Veröffentlichung dieses Albums wird eine Summe von 10.000€ kosten, inklusive:

  • Produktion
  • Musiker
  • Studio-Miete
  • Abmischen
  • Mastering
  • Druck der CDs und Vinyls
  • Artwork für das Cover des Albums
  • Werbung und Promotion
  • Versand der physischen Kopien
  • Musikvideo

(Nicht enthalten sind 5% IndieGogo-Servicegebühr & 3% Zahlungsbearbeitungsgebühr)

Wir haben eine große Auswahl an Optionen, mit denen Sie uns unterstützen und vorbestellen können, wie auf der rechten Seite des Bildschirms aufgelistet. Es gibt Wir haben versucht, die Belohnungen so vielfältig zu gestalten, dass Sie sich diejenige aussuchen können, die am besten zu Ihnen passt. Sie können die so genannten "Perks" anklicken und öffnen, um zu sehen, was enthalten ist, und sich eine aussuchen, die Sie als "Dankeschön" für Ihre Spende haben möchten.

*Wir können nur dann ein Doppel-Vinyl pressen, wenn wir während dieses Crowdfundings eine Anzahl von 30 Bestellungen erreichen. Sollten wir diese Zahl nicht erreichen, erhalten Sie 2 Exemplare der CD.

 

Ihre Spende macht einen Unterschied

Sie unterstützen nicht nur meinen Traum, sondern auch die Profis der Kultur- und Musikszene, mit denen ich zusammenarbeite, um diese ungewöhnliche Zeit zu überstehen, in der es seit Monaten keine Live-Konzerte mehr gibt.

Wir wissen Ihre großzügige Unterstützung wirklich zu schätzen! Sie machen möglich, was wir tun, und wir sind Ihnen von Herzen dankbar!

<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3

 

Vielen Dank!

Vielen Dank, dass Sie meine Geschichte und über unser Projekt gelesen und meine Videos angeschaut haben! Ich hoffe, Sie möchten sich unserem Team anschließen und ein Teil unserer Reise werden. Jeder einzelne Unterstützer bringt uns einen Schritt näher, um euch den besten Sound und die beste Musik zu präsentieren, die wir anbieten können. Ich kann es kaum erwarten, all die Früchte unserer harten Arbeit der letzten Monate mit Ihnen zu teilen und durch die Musik mit Ihnen in Verbindung zu treten!

Alles liebe,

Eure Pina

 

Andere Wege zu helfen

Wenn Sie uns unterstützen möchten, sich aber eine Spende nicht leisten können, verstehen wir das vollkommen! Es gibt verschiedene andere Möglichkeiten, wie Sie uns unterstützen können, wenn Sie möchten:

  • Verbreiten Sie die Nachricht! Teilen Sie diese Kampagne auf Ihren Social-Media-Seiten oder sagen Sie es einem Freund, der vielleicht Interesse an einer Unterstützung hat.
  • "Like" und "Folgen" Sie uns auf Facebook & Instagram & YouTube (Links unten)
  • Tragen Sie sich in unseren Newsletter-Verteiler ein, um über unsere neuesten Unternehmungen und anstehende Auftritte informiert zu werden (siehe E-Mail-Anmeldeformular unter https://www.pinaberlin.com )

Hilft auch anderen Musikern! Hilft Euren lokalen Musikern! Sie brauchen Euch jetzt!

 

Risiken und Herausforderungen

Es gibt einige Teile der Produktion eines Albums, die durch die Pandemie-Situation stark beeinträchtigt werden können, aber da wir ein kleines Kernteam sind, das daran arbeitet, sind wir ziemlich unabhängig. Die Konzerte könnten sich durch diese Situation verzögern. Natürlich macht die Covid-19-Pandemie auch alles ein bisschen komplizierter, wie zum Beispiel das Treffen mit den Musikern im Studio. In diesem Fall wird es leider mehr Zeit in Anspruch nehmen, bis das Album fertig ist.

 

Links:

YouTube

Facebook

Instagram

Newsletter

Website

But if you want to support us through Paypal or Transaction you can also send your support per Paypal https://www.paypal.com/de/homeTo pinartatlikazan@gmail.com and write down the name of the perk you want to have and I will send you a confirmation E-Mail! For Transaction Information please see the FAQ above. ● Jazz, world, folk, pop, english, turkish, german and cinematic sounds fusioned in Berlin!(für Deutsch bitte runterscrollen)  Untertitel für das Video über das (CC) Icon unten rechts Welcome to my crowdfunding campaign to support my first album we will be recording with amazing musicians in Berlin!Hello/Hallo/Merhaba dear friends, family and fans! My name is Pinar Tatlikazan and I am personally inviting you to be a part of this debut album of my solo project called "Pina Berlin"! Your support (through the years and now) means so much to me and I really want to connect with you through my music, some of which I wrote inspired by you! We already have the arrangements and demos of the songs ready and they are waiting to be recorded. We need your help to bring this project from a construction site to a finished album.We released the first single of the album and my debut single ‘I’ll be missing you’ with it's official video right before we started the crowdfunding.  Even though I wrote this song 5 years ago from a place far from home in a 'missing' state of mind, missing the past, the future and the moment, today in lockdown we are not too far from each other but still have to miss each other... This song is for everybody who is in that 'missing' state of mind right now to remember that we are not alone! Read on to learn about me, this project and the team... About me:  I was born and raised in Bursa /Turkey and after my time in Istanbul at a Turkish-German high school and a summer musical course in Rostock in 2010 I came to Berlin to be a part of the music and culture and first studied architecture. Since I was a little girl I have been singing, acting, dancing. I just wanted to tell stories and connect to people and spread the love through music, as the most innocent and sincere way of sharing peace on this world. I did believe I could change the world with music! I grew up listening to Chet Baker, Miles Davis, Dave Brubeck, Paul Desmond, Carmen McRae and Norah Jones. At the age of 15 I started taking classical singing classes and playing the tenor saxophone, and got into the music of the 60s and 70s with Beatles, Led Zeppelin, Pink Floyd. It was after I moved to Berlin that I started to treasure my roots in the Turkish music. And that's where my need to fusion the styles started as I became a fusion of cultures myself after 10 years of living in Berlin and living the rich music scene in Berlin showed me that music can bring people together!After 3 years of long nights at the university in Berlin and a student band in 2013 I finally started going to jam sessions which inspired to me write songs with a ukulele I was given as a gift. That changed my life and reminded me of my dream again. SINGING FOR THE PEOPLE!  After I took courses at the jazz department during my exchange semester in the U.S. I started to prepare for jazz vocal programs of the music schools in Germany. Making it to the last auditions with three other singers in the HfMT Hamburg in 2016 gave me the motivation to keep going. After 3,5 years of working at my architecture job for 3,5 years in the day, getting tendonitis in my arms, singing in a lot of bands, writing songs in the night and recording arrangement ideas to my songs in the bathroom at work... Since we made the demo of the first song it was impossible for me to concentrate on anything else, I woke up and slept with ideas and sounds floating in my mind so I changed my life and had no other choice than to dedicate myself to my dream of recording my songs I've been writing for 7 years and share them from the heart with you!And that's when I met the producer of this album Fico Jessen! About the team and the project: I met the amazing musician and producer Fico Jessen in January 2020 and we immediately connected and made a demo of my first single "I'll be missing you". After showing him the lead sheets of my songs and notebooks full of song sketches and seeing how he understood my music we just started to work on the idea of an album and oh you couldn't imagine how excited I am to see how the dream world in my head is becoming real!I’m so happy and lucky to be able to work with a great professional team with Aarón Castrillo on the drums and Lea Simon doing the artwork for the cover of the album. And one of the songs "Seven hours", which was the first song I ever played in public, we will produce with Roland Satterwhite, an amazing musician and my dear friend who made me believe in my music years before I trusted myself to bring it out like this! In addition we will invite further professional musicians to record the songs.Only with these amazing professionals are my songs able to grow and get out there to reach you. Although the Covid-19 hit the musicians and the culture scene really hard, and we miss playing live, it led us to stay in and produce with a creativity that was eager to be let out. About my music: You've seen my debut single but don't think that the album will be full of sad ballads! The influences of the music are mostly from my experiences since I came to Berlin with this dream (that's where“Pina Berlin” comes from) and from different kinds of genres from jazz to folk, pop, soul, brasilian music, blues, Turkish music, German poetry ethnic rhythms! Some songs have cinematic elements that will bring you to another world to tell their stories inspired by my love of everyday urban sounds and the power of their storytelling.The songs are mostly in English but I have a special German-Turkish song which I am super excited about! So this is a whole journey which includes a song I wrote in 2013 but also my last song from the summer of 2020 in the middle of the pandemic and a personal health crisis "There is always hope"...Once a friend of mine said that my music makes her "feel the sexy shaking through your body or feel inner tears with her ballad, pray with a mantra, but still at the end of the song you will feel the hope and positivity that leaves one with a spark of light in one's heart." It's my biggest wish to connect with every single one of you in that level and spread the positivity and hope through music during these weird times! What do we need your support for? I financed my first single myself and saved up money for this album however making a record as an independent artist is expensive and my savings were not enough to finish it. We already have the arrangements and demos of the songs ready and they are waiting to be recorded. We need your help to bring this project from a construction site to a finished album.The making and release of this album will cost a sum of 10,200€ inclusive of:
Production
Musicians
Studio rent
Mixing
Mastering
Printing the CDs and Vinyls
Artwork for the cover of the album
Publicity and promotion
Shipment of the physical copies

Nachdem ich 3,5 Jahre lang tagsüber in meinem Architektur-Job gearbeitet, Sehnenscheidenentzündungen in den Armen bekommen, in vielen Bands gesungen, nachts Songs geschrieben und auf der Arbeit im Badezimmer Arrangement-Ideen zu meinen Songs aufgenommen hatte... Seit wir das Demo des ersten Songs gemacht haben, war es für mich unmöglich, mich auf etwas anderes zu konzentrieren, ich wachte auf und schlief mit Ideen und Sounds, die in meinem Kopf schwebten, also änderte ich mein Leben und hatte keine andere Wahl, als mich meinem Traum zu widmen, meine Songs, die ich seit 7 Jahren schreibe, aufzunehmen und sie von Herzen mit euch zu teilen!Und da habe ich den Produzenten dieses Albums, Fico Jessen, kennengelernt! Über das Team und das Projekt:Ich traf den großartigen Musiker und Produzenten Fico Jessen im Januar 2020 und wir verbanden uns sofort und machten ein Demo meiner ersten Single "I'll be missing you". Nachdem ich ihm die Leadsheets meiner Songs und Notizbücher voller Songskizzen gezeigt hatte und sah, wie sehr er meine Musik verstand, fingen wir einfach an, an der Idee eines Albums zu arbeiten, und oh ihr könnt euch nicht vorstellen, wie aufgeregt ich bin, zu sehen, wie die Traumwelt in meinem Kopf echt wird!Ich bin so glücklich und habe das Glück, mit einem großartigen, professionellen Team arbeiten zu können, mit Aarón Castrillo am Schlagzeug und Lea Simon, die das Artwork für das Cover des Albums gemacht hat. Und einen der Songs "Seven hours", der der erste Song war, den ich jemals in der Öffentlichkeit gespielt habe, werden wir mit Roland Satterwhite produzieren, einem erstaunlichen Musiker und meinem lieben Freund, der mir den Glauben an meine Musik gegeben hat, Jahre bevor ich mir selbst zugetraut habe, sie so herauszubringen! Außerdem werden wir weitere professionelle Musiker einladen, um die Songs aufzunehmen.Nur mit diesen wundervollen Profis sind meine Songs in der Lage zu wachsen und nach draußen zu gelangen, um Sie zu erreichen.Obwohl der Covid-19 die Musiker und die Kulturszene wirklich hart getroffen hat und wir es vermissen, live zu spielen, hat es uns dazu gebracht, drinnen zu bleiben und mit einer Kreativität zu produzieren, die unbedingt rausgelassen werden wollte. Über meine Musik:Wir haben bereits die erste Single des Albums und meine Debütsingle 'I'll be missing you' mit dem offiziellen Video veröffentlicht, kurz bevor wir das Crowdfunding gestartet haben.Auch wenn ich diesen Song vor 5 Jahren von einem Ort weit weg von zu Hause in einem 'vermissenden' Geisteszustand geschrieben habe, in dem ich die Vergangenheit, die Zukunft und den Moment vermisse, so sind wir heute in Lockdown nicht allzu weit voneinander entfernt und müssen uns trotzdem gegenseitig vermissen... Dieser Song ist für alle, die sich gerade in diesem 'vermissenden' Geisteszustand befinden, um sich daran zu erinnern, dass wir nicht alleine sind!Denkt aber nicht, dass das Album voll von traurigen Balladen sein wird! Die Einflüsse der Musik sind größtenteils aus meinen Erfahrungen, seit ich mit diesem Traum nach Berlin gekommen bin (daher kommt "Pina Berlin") und aus verschiedenen Arten von Genres von Jazz bis Folk, Pop, Soul, brasilianischer Musik, Blues, türkischer Musik, deutscher Poesie und ethnischen Rhythmen! Einige Songs haben cineastische Elemente, die Sie in eine andere Welt versetzen und ihre Geschichten erzählen, inspiriert von meiner Liebe zu alltäglichen urbanen Klängen und der Kraft ihrer Erzählung.Die Songs sind größtenteils auf Englisch, aber ich habe einen speziellen deutsch-türkischen Song, auf den ich super aufgeregt bin! Es ist also eine ganze Reise, die einen Song beinhaltet, den ich 2013 geschrieben habe, aber auch meinen letzten Song aus dem Sommer 2020 inmitten der Pandemie und einer persönlichen Gesundheitskrise "There is always hope"...Eine Freundin von mir sagte einmal, dass meine Musik sie dazu bringt, "das sexy Schütteln durch deinen Körper zu spüren oder innere Tränen mit meiner Ballade zu fühlen, mit einem Mantra zu beten, aber am Ende des Liedes fühlst du immer noch die Hoffnung und Positivität, die einen mit einem Funken Licht im Herzen zurücklässt." Es ist mein größter Wunsch, mich mit jedem einzelnen von euch auf dieser Ebene zu verbinden und die Positivität und Hoffnung durch Musik während dieser verrückten Zeiten zu verbreiten! Wozu brauchen wir Eure Unterstützung?Ich habe meine erste Single selbst finanziert und Geld für dieses Album gespart, aber eine Platte als unabhängiger Künstler zu machen ist teuer und meine Ersparnisse reichten nicht aus, um es fertigzustellen. Wir haben bereits die Arrangements und Demos der Songs fertig und sie warten darauf, aufgenommen zu werden. Wir brauchen Ihre Hilfe, um dieses Projekt von einer Baustelle zu einem fertigen Album zu bringen.Die Herstellung und Veröffentlichung dieses Albums wird eine Summe von 10.000€ kosten, inklusive:
Produktion
Musiker
Studio-Miete
Abmischen
Mastering
Druck der CDs und Vinyls
Artwork für das Cover des Albums
Werbung und Promotion
Versand der physischen Kopien
Musikvideo
(Nicht enthalten sind 5% IndieGogo-Servicegebühr & 3% Zahlungsbearbeitungsgebühr)Wir haben eine große Auswahl an Optionen, mit denen Sie uns unterstützen und vorbestellen können, wie auf der rechten Seite des Bildschirms aufgelistet. Es gibt Wir haben versucht, die Belohnungen so vielfältig zu gestalten, dass Sie sich diejenige aussuchen können, die am besten zu Ihnen passt. Sie können die so genannten "Perks" anklicken und öffnen, um zu sehen, was enthalten ist, und sich eine aussuchen, die Sie als "Dankeschön" für Ihre Spende haben möchten.*Wir können nur dann ein Doppel-Vinyl pressen, wenn wir während dieses Crowdfundings eine Anzahl von 30 Bestellungen erreichen. Sollten wir diese Zahl nicht erreichen, erhalten Sie 2 Exemplare der CD. Ihre Spende macht einen UnterschiedSie unterstützen nicht nur meinen Traum, sondern auch die Profis der Kultur- und Musikszene, mit denen ich zusammenarbeite, um diese ungewöhnliche Zeit zu überstehen, in der es seit Monaten keine Live-Konzerte mehr gibt.Wir wissen Ihre großzügige Unterstützung wirklich zu schätzen! Sie machen möglich, was wir tun, und wir sind Ihnen von Herzen dankbar!<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3 <3<3 <3 <3 <3 <3  Vielen Dank!Vielen Dank, dass Sie meine Geschichte und über unser Projekt gelesen und meine Videos angeschaut haben! Ich hoffe, Sie möchten sich unserem Team anschließen und ein Teil unserer Reise werden. Jeder einzelne Unterstützer bringt uns einen Schritt näher, um euch den besten Sound und die beste Musik zu präsentieren, die wir anbieten können. Ich kann es kaum erwarten, all die Früchte unserer harten Arbeit der letzten Monate mit Ihnen zu teilen und durch die Musik mit Ihnen in Verbindung zu treten!Alles liebe,Eure Pina Andere Wege zu helfenWenn Sie uns unterstützen möchten, sich aber eine Spende nicht leisten können, verstehen wir das vollkommen! Es gibt verschiedene andere Möglichkeiten, wie Sie uns unterstützen können, wenn Sie möchten:
Verbreiten Sie die Nachricht! Teilen Sie diese Kampagne auf Ihren Social-Media-Seiten oder sagen Sie es einem Freund, der vielleicht Interesse an einer Unterstützung hat.
"Like" und "Folgen" Sie uns auf Facebook & Instagram & YouTube (Links unten)
Tragen Sie sich in unseren Newsletter-Verteiler ein, um über unsere neuesten Unternehmungen und anstehende Auftritte informiert zu werden (siehe E-Mail-Anmeldeformular unter https://www.pinaberlin.com )
Hilft auch anderen Musikern! Hilft Euren lokalen Musikern! Sie brauchen Euch jetzt! Risiken und HerausforderungenEs gibt einige Teile der Produktion eines Albums, die durch die Pandemie-Situation stark beeinträchtigt werden können, aber da wir ein kleines Kernteam sind, das daran arbeitet, sind wir ziemlich unabhängig. Die Konzerte könnten sich durch diese Situation verzögern. Natürlich macht die Covid-19-Pandemie auch alles ein bisschen komplizierter, wie zum Beispiel das Treffen mit den Musikern im Studio. In diesem Fall wird es leider mehr Zeit in Anspruch nehmen, bis das Album fertig ist. Links:YouTubeFacebookInstagramNewsletterWebsite

story:
Short Summary

I founded the Revival Festival in 2015 in Vancouver, Canada to showcase the level of high-quality local talent in the area. Now more than ever, we need to show love and appreciation for our independent artists both globally and locally. Since I first visited Colombia in 2015, I fell in love with its people and its land. It’s since been my dream to bring the Revival Festival to the coast of Colombia, where locals share a passionate love of artistic expression but sadly do not have much access to live music. The Revival Festival will be one of the first events of its kind in the area, and we hope it will be a beacon of light for locals and tourists alike.  

We are happy to be donating one third of all profits to two charities - the El Rio Foundation and Women for Conservation. The El Rio Foundation focuses on offering educational support and community sport opportunities to the local community, in addition to reforestation and waste management projects. Women for Conservation works to empower women and girls to lead in the field of conservation by providing them with environmental education, resources to implement and complete projects, and access to a network of professional scientists and advisers. Both charities work in the Sierra Nevada to directly support small communities that now, more than ever, need as much help as possible.

By contributing to this campaign, you’re not only helping us bring the magic of live music to Colombia’s coast, but you’re also giving direct support to two extremely important causes.  

What We Need

We need your help to raise £8000. This will cover the running costs of the festival including:

  • Security – our utmost priority is keeping our guests, performers, and the land safe and secure.
  • Licenses and permits – ensuring full compliance with local authorities.
  • Medical team – should any accidents or health concerns arise during the event; we will have fully trained medical personnel on-site.
  • Toilets and sanitation – for obvious reasons.
  • Stage construction – a safe, secure platform for our artists to play.
  • Sound and lighting – to bring the magic of our vision to life.
  • Artist travel and accommodation – to get our artists safely to and from the event and ensuring they have a safe and comfortable place to rest.
  • Water – ensuring our artists, crew and guests have access to clean drinking water.
  • Backup power – Generators to mitigate impact of potential power outages.

What You Get

  • Tier 1 - Up to £20 and above: A big thank you and a mention on the website after completion of the festival.
  • Tier 2 – £50 and above: All the above + The Revival Festival 2016 mixtape (a Bandcamp download of our album of original songs by our 2016 artists)
  • Tier 3 – £100 and above: All the above + a t-shirt and a signed photo from select bands
  • Tier 4 – £200 and above: All the above + One festival ticket to use or donate to a local + one El Rio Hostel t-shirt
  • Tier 5 – £300 and above: All the above + One night’s stay at El Rio Hostel in small dorm room with bar tab (conditions apply) to use personally or donate to a local. Valid for 1 year.
  • Tier 6 – £400 and above: All the above + One night’s stay in a private room at El Rio Hostel + 1 night’s stay at Mama Tayrona in a luxury private room + 1 extra ticket to the festival + luxury camping - or option to donate all perks to a local - raffle to be held prior to festival
  • Tier 7 – £500 and above: All the above + 1 extra night at El Rio Hostel, 2 extra festival tickets (4 tickets total), + a live shout out from headliners recorded for website + VIP camping with artists - or option to donate all perks to a local - raffle to be held prior to festival

 

All Perks other than tickets will be dispersed after the festival, from the beginning of February 2022.

If our target is not met, no perks will be dispersed and all donations will be refunded directly back to the account debited by the Indigogo platform.

All perks donated to a local will be rewarded with a photo and contact details of the person who wins the raffle, to send to you so you may keep in touch, and they may offer a thank you to you personally.

Risks & Challenges

The volatile political situation in Colombia has always been a problem. The main issue is that the country is constantly in a situation of instability due to potential revolution. However, what is happening there now has been happening in many countries. The youth of today are finally standing up and saying "No More!". This creates a potentially dangerous situation for the people (of the country), especially those who protest, but I believe it will eventually result in change for the better. In all my years visiting Colombia I have never seen extreme violence, and I have only ever witnessed tourism being treated with respect and gratitude. The current problems facing the country have nothing to do with visitors. The unrest is contained in the major cities far from the festival site. On the coast where we are holding the festival there is very little atmosphere from these events, and in general feels much safer. All that said, we do not take security lightly. We will have a specialist security team taking care of us for the duration of the event.

Colombia was affected terribly during the pandemic. At one point it was one of the most affected countries in the world. However, it is predicted that the majority of the population will be fully vaccinated by the beginning of October. The developing world is always impacted more when global events like this happen, and what has affected the country more than the virus itself, is poverty. Colombia is not a welfare state. The people received no governmental help during the pandemic. Colombia relies largely on tourism and trade. Events that bring tourism are more vital than ever. Now is the perfect time to help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate financially, please consider sharing this campaign with your network and on your social media. Every little bit helps!

story:
My Story

Hello dear friends and family, and music lovers! I'm Jaana Narsipur, a jazz vocalist and music educator based in New York. I've been teaching and singing for many years - first in Chicago, and now in New York where I live with my husband and two young children.

I'm about to embark on a new chapter in my jazz career, releasing my first solo album! With the music already recorded and mixed, the first single will be released on September 3, 2021 and the complete album is projected for release in October 2021.

Click here for sample track teasers on Soundcloud!

Carriage House Studios. Photo by Paul Seibert @paulseibertphotography.com

The Music

This album is focused on the music of two jazz masters - Horace Silver and Bob Dorough.  What connects these two jazz icons?  Songs that are remarkable for both their complexity and their catchy melodies, a grounding in the harmonic traditions of bebop, and always a sense of joyfulness and playfulness - that many times, coexists with a melancholy that reaches our core. 

This album features my arrangements - some with my rhythm section, several featuring a great tenor saxophone and trumpet player, and one with a string quartet - of Horace Silver and Bob Dorough's tunes. There are a total of 10 songs on the album - including swing tunes, bluesy funky grooves, and several gorgeous ballads.

The Musicians

I am fortunate to have worked with a generous, talented group of musicians on this album.  We had a wonderful time making music together and that is reflected in the album!

  • Cary Brown, Piano, Fender Rhodes, and Hammon B3 Organ
  • Thomson Kneeland, Bass
  • Joe Abba, Drums and Assistant Producer
  • Sean Nowell, Tenor Saxophone
  • Eli Asher, Trumpet

Carriage House Studio. Photo by Paul Seibert @paulseibertphotography.com

The Studio

We recorded and mixed at the wonderful Carriage House Studios. Working with owner and chief engineer Johnny Montagnese has been an exhilarating experience! His expertise - gleaned from decades of working with artists like jazz great Randy Brecker and blues rocker Marcus King, as well as countless local NY bands - guided us throughout the process. Johnny, and his CHS crew, provided a warm, welcoming environment that helped me relax (solo album nerves!) so I could focus, have fun, and SING!

Why Crowdfund?

Why crowd-fund? People like YOU, who are interested in helping me with my project, donate funds to support the project in exchange for various rewards. For a minimum contribution of $15, you are ordering this album in advance (digital download).  Albums cost a lot of money to record, produce, duplicate, license, and publicize. The way the music business has shifted, more and more artists are self-releasing their projects.

How Can You Help?

My album is already recorded and mixed. I arranged all the music, functioned as the bandleader, and produced the album (with drummer Joe Abba's assistance).  Over the years, I have made HUGE investments of time and money in my music dreams. It's more expensive that most would imagine.  Each and every contribution helps realize my dream while giving you some truly unique and exciting rewards. Whatever you feel like giving is so appreciated!  You can also help by sharing the project in your social media feeds, talking about my album with your music-loving friends, anything to help me get the word out there!

Your support will help to fund:

  • Additional post-production (edits and mastering)
  • Album production (CD & potential vinyl pressing)
  • Photography/Video
  • Licensing, distribution, marketing and promotion for the album
  • Incentive/Reward creation/distribution

Fun perks and incentives!

  • Getting the album - digital download (early release) or CD, or both!
  • Autographed copy of CD with original art, photos, liner notes.
  • Your name included in a "Special Thanks" section on Jaana Narsipur's album website, and on my social media pages.
  • Be My Guest at the album release concert and receive your autographed CD.
  • A voice lesson, your choice of in-person or virtual, where we work on a song of your choice, breath technique, pop/musical theater/jazz techniques, building your practice routine, or just have fun singing!
  • VIP house concert - with trio or the full band with horns.

CURRENT GOAL: $4000

Track Listing

Sample track teasers on Soundcloud!

Better Than Anything - Bob Dorough - a breezy, swinging tune with mischievous lyrics about how love is is truly better than anything!

The Jody Grind - Horace Silver - a funky blues with hard-hitting lyrics arranged for Hammond B3 and a horn section.

Small Day Tomorrow - Bob Dorough - a bluesy, moody ballad about a long night and daybreak.

Nica's Dream - Horace Silver - a lively Latin/swing tune that pays tribute to one of jazz history's most famous patrons.

But For Now - Bob Dorough - a gorgeous romantic song originally written for Dorough's wife, that I've arranged for a string quartet and rhythm section.

Comin' Home Baby - Bob Dorough - a groovy blues tune with a great hook arranged for Fender Rhodes piano and tenor saxophone.

Lonely Woman - Horace Silver - a beautiful, plaintive ballad featuring bass and trumpet.

Senor Blues - Horace Silver - a Latin jazz standard with a memorable bass line, great horn lines, and an infectious groove.

Devil May Care - Bob Dorough - an irresistible swing classic!

Peace - Horace Silver - a beautiful, pure ballad with inspirational lyrics.  Arranged as a voice/piano duo.

Thank you!

It has been, and continues to be for many, a challenging time in our world.  During the last 15 months, we have faced difficulties we never imagined ... and we are now emerging from the darkness into a different world - one filled with new challenges, but also filled with renewed hope and value for our loved ones, for collaboration, for music and all the arts, for opening our hearts. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for making time to read my story and offer your support. I am BEYOND EXCITED and so happy to share my album with you!

With love and thanks,

Jaana

But For Now - Bob Dorough - a gorgeous romantic song originally written for Dorough's wife, that I've arranged for a string quartet and rhythm section.
Comin' Home Baby - Bob Dorough - a groovy blues tune with a great hook arranged for Fender Rhodes piano and tenor saxophone.
Lonely Woman - Horace Silver - a beautiful, plaintive ballad featuring bass and trumpet.
Senor Blues - Horace Silver - a Latin jazz standard with a memorable bass line, great horn lines, and an infectious groove.
Devil May Care - Bob Dorough - an irresistible swing classic!
Peace - Horace Silver - a beautiful, pure ballad with inspirational lyrics.  Arranged as a voice/piano duo.

Thank you!
It has been, and continues to be for many, a challenging time in our world.  During the last 15 months, we have faced difficulties we never imagined ... and we are now emerging from the darkness into a different world - one filled with new challenges, but also filled with renewed hope and value for our loved ones, for collaboration, for music and all the arts, for opening our hearts. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for making time to read my story and offer your support. I am BEYOND EXCITED and so happy to share my album with you!
With love and thanks,
Jaana

story:
Welcome!

My name is Pam Van Dyke Crosby. I am an Oklahoma native and I have been singing for, well the majority of my life. I am thrilled to have recorded my latest album 'Good Vibes' in Tulsa, Oklahoma! If you aren't familiar with Tulsa then you may not know this but we have some incredible musicians in Tulsa. The 'Good Vibes' album is exciting for me on many levels. We need your help to finish our CD and get it out to the public! We have recorded the songs and the album is ready to go. Your contributions will allow us to pay for the musicians time, the art work, the mixing & mastering of the music and produce the physical product. These are all vital in order to produce a good quality product for you.

I am so proud our 'Good Vibes' cd. Good vibes is just what you get when you listen to this album. The name actually came from the vibraphone we have featured on the album played by Jay Garrett. 'Good Vibes' is a wonderful mix of original compositions and songs from the Great American Songbook, It features a variety of rhythms Latin, swinging be-bop style and ballads. The unique sounds of the vibraphone give it a special feel. Each tune is executed with superior musicianship and deep emotion. In addition to Jay, we have Tony Yohe on the drums, Wade Robertson on percussion, Scott McQuade on the piano and Bill Crosby on the bass.

It has been a joy to record with this group of musicians.  I am also excited because this is my first time to use a crowd funding campaign to raise money for an album. This is a whole new world!

A Little About The Musicians 

Pam got her first big break singing with "The Sammy Kaye Orchestra" as the featured "girl singer". The Orchestra, based in New York City, toured the United States from coast to coast. During her time in New York Pam began her jazz career when she sang with a quartet that included Duke Jordan on piano, Keeter Betts on bass, Lee Abrams on drums and Frank Capi on baritone sax. Pam moved back to Oklahoma for her family but continued singing in nightclubs, hotels, restaurants and on local tv shows. Pam also toured the southwest with her jazz oriented pop music group 'Pam Van Dyke and Friends' with extended club arrangements in Texas, Louisiana, Missouri, Arkansas, Nebraska and Oklahoma. Pam has been a featured performer in numerous jazz festivals, concerts and benefit shows. Pam is also the founder and President of the Tulsa Jazz Society.

Scott McQuade (PIANO) is about to enter his 20th year as a professional musician. Scott started taking music lessons at 4 1/2 and took his first 'gig' on his 5th birthday. Music is just in his blood. Scott has had the opportunity to perform alongside such world- renowned jazz artists as Louis Bellson, Randy Brecker, Cleveland Eaton, Jason Marsalis... just to name a few.

Tony Yohe (DRUMS) began playing drums professionally at the age of 10 in and around his hometown of Hartshorn, OK. He received his BA in Music Education from OSU. Tony has performed with internationally known musicians Ken Peplowski, Eddie Daniels, Randy Sandke, Ted Rosenthal and actress/singer Felicia Rashad. Tony is the organizer and leader of the 9 piece jazz band 'Swinghouse' and produced the band's self-titled CD in 2004.

Jay Garrett (VIBES) is originally from Tennessee and went to school at North Texas State University. Garrett arrived in town a few years ago to take a teaching job. He taught at Monroe Demonstration Academy while also playing jazz around town in a variety of settings. The latter part of his musical life includes Jazz Depot performances with vocalist Annie Ellicott, and another appearance there as the featured artist in last year’s jazz composer series.

Wade Roberson (PERCUSSION) began playing professionally at 16 with the Don Linde Orchestra and Joe Fusco Orchestra. While pursuing his BA in Music Education Wade accompanied acts such as the Temptations, Kay Starr, the Four Aces and Marilyn May. He drummed for Chet Baker on a live recording of "Out of Nowhere" and in 2006 he toured with Country Music Hall of Famer Hank Thompson. Wade has lately been working and recording in and around Tulsa.

Bill Crosby (BASS) is a Tulsa native. In school Bill started playing the clarinet and the saxophone. After high school Bill was accepted to the Naval School of Music where he continued his education. He was assigned an Admiral's Band aboard ship. It was during his tour of duty that he started playing the upright base. Upon returning to Oklahoma Bill started playing with The Ray Miller Trio and the original "Rubiot" with Sonny Gray. The Trio backed up national acts such as The Ink Spots, Teddy Wilson, Zoot Sims and Sonny Stitt. This literally just names a few... Bill has played with so many incredible musicians to list them all! In the past few years Bill has been playing and recording with his wife Pam and promoting jazz and live music in the area.

Where Your Contributions Go 

The Break Down:

  • $620 - Mixing and mastering the album 
  • $1000 - Musicians fees for the time it took to record ($200 each x5)
  • $400 - Musical arranging cost
  • $250 - CD artwork & layout
  • $250 - Licensing and copyright for 2 songs
  • $500 - Campaign Management & PR
  • $200 - Cover art photos
  • $150 - Liner notes done by John Wooley
  • $400 - local composer fee
  • $1049 - CD copying in 4 panel case (1000 ads)
  • $181 - Misc. incentive fulfillments (just a little extra in case shipping is costly)

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean you can't contribute. Please share this this site on your Facebook, twitter, mailing lists and emails!

story:
Who am I?

My name is Tje Austin (pronounced TYE) and I am a singer songwriter living in Austin, Texas living out my dream. I've been blessed to be able to travel, write songs, make albums and I was even on Season 1 of The Voice once upon a time. Now is an amazing time for me because I have the opportunity to sing the music that I have always wanted to with an amazing team of musicians who have my back.  By contributing to this campaign, you are helping me bring these songs to life.

What is Cerulean?

Cerulean (/səˈruːliən/) is a collection of life experiences: the pain of losing a loved one, the unexpected discovery that you've decided to give your heart to one person and one person only, the promise to never let yourself get hurt again and much more.  

I am recording this 6 song EP in Austin, Texas at Orb Recording Studios with producer and bassist from Blue October, Matt Noveskey.  With numerous days of pre-production, we have put together basically the soundtrack of my life that has been ringing in my head over the past year. The details are in the songs, discussing the extreme lows and the best highs.

Cerulean will be the first EP in a series of three, with Indigo and Umber to follow soon after.

Why IndieGoGo?

Recording an EP costs a ton of money. I make my living from playing shows, from royalties earned from various music streaming services and from when songs are used for tv and film. This allows me to live day to day, but to be able to record the songs I write, I’m asking for a little help from my friends. Using IndieGoGo, people who want to own/love/cherish the album can pre-order it. I've also created some really awesome perks and this way, with your help I can create an album.

Here's why this album costs $12,500:

$8,200 Recording + Mixing + Paying musicians

$1,000 Mastering

$2,500 Printing 

$400 Filming IndieGoGo video (Underground Planet is AMAZING!)

$400 Album Artwork

These are the basic costs of recording this album. If we meet this goal and then beat it, the additional funds will be put towards filming music videos, marketing the album and touring!


EVEN IF YOU CAN'T CONTRIBUTE, YOU CAN HELP!
Please SHARE, SHARE, SHARE on FACEBOOK, TWITTER, TELL A FRIEND, TELL YOUR MOM, YOUR SISTER, BROTHER, AUNTIE...

Everything helps. 
So whether you stuck it out and read to the end, or you skimmed down to the bottom, I'm hoping one thing remains the same: 
You have faith in me and want to support me as an artist creating my art.
For that I thank you! This is going to be such an awesome EP and I'm excited about creating it and sharing it with you!
Much love,
Tje Austin

story:
About me

My name is Ashina and I’ve been making music and experimenting with sounds for about 8 years. I’ve decided to take the plunge and start releasing my music on a physical format. Although notions of perfection have held me back from doing this sooner, we only live once and making, recording, and releasing music is something that I would like to continue pursuing throughout my life's journey. 

I’ve lived in Chicago for the past decade and I think residing here has certainly shaped me in many ways. I am a firm believer that environment affects art; this EP will consist of 5 songs that I feel represent some energy I’ve absorbed living in this urban environment. Various synthesizers and sounds were used to make the music and a few of the songs feature recorded samples of mechanical objects. 

The platform I will be releasing music on is called Sovereign State. This represents my need to secede from the overly critical inner voice and the fear of failure. Expression and intuition are essential and certainly worth exploring and pursuing. My plan is to use this campaign to fund the first EP and then use the proceeds from items sold to fund future releases. 


Why I need your help & where I am at

It will cost $1,775 USD to fund this project. 

This includes the cost of mastering, lacquer cutting, and the pressing of 200 vinyl records. The cost also includes jackets and sleeves to house each record, as well as full color center labels. This amount will also cover some of the total shipping costs. 

- $1350 for mastering, laquer cutting, the vinyl pressing process, sleeves and jackets for 200 12" records.

- $225 for full color center labels.

- $200 to ship the records to Illinois from the pressing plant in California. There aren't many pressing plants in the United State and I've chosen this plant in order to have the mastering, cutting, and pressing done under one roof. 

I am currently in the process of making a few final touches to the songs that will be used on this EP, and getting the mixes and levels prepared for the mastering process. 

Unable to contribute?

If you are unable to contribute monetarily that is alright. I'd be grateful for your well wishes and moral support. Feel free to share the campaign or watch and share the video.

story:
Short Summary

Last October 7th, Rádio e Televisão de Portugal (RTP) announced their withdrawal from Eurovision Song Contest, to be held in Stockholm, Sweden, on May 10th, 12th and 14th 2016, due to lack of funding. But, what does it consist of that "lack of funding"? It is all about sport events like Olympic Games, next year in Rio de Janeiro, the European Football Championship in France and the UEFA Champions League. What about arts? Eurovision Song Contest was, is and will be the hugest platform of new and successful artists whom wants to represent their countries. I am a huge fan of Eurovision Song Contest, and I used to be watching with my family, year after year at our living lounge and vibrating with all songs from all different countries.

Well. I can tell many of Eurofans are disappointed with the portuguese broadcaster decision and we started to share our opinion in social networks within different hashtags, but, until today, nobody had the idea of creating a crowdfunding campaign to change their mind and presenting an application to participate in the biggest music contest in the world.

Let's get together and make history. Every single donation is important to us. You will be our hero. Let's be "the heroes of our time".

What We Need & What You Get

As far as we know, an application to participate in the contest is a bit expensive. But how much? We think we will need at least €250,000 to make it viable. All the money will go to RTP to cover all expenses with the participation and artist selection. 

And the best of all is: if you help us and if we reach the target, you could go watch LIVE the biggest song contest in the world, in Stockholm, Sweden. Starting from a simple postcard, to a basket of portuguese products, or even a weekend break in Lisbon, there's many reasons to contribute to our crowdfunding.

If, in a little chance, the crowdfunding campaign doesn't reach the minimum value, all the money will go to Casa do Artista, a non-profit association which targets to support all artists, musicians, actors and arts in Portugal. More information at http://www.casadoartista.net (in portuguese).

The Impact

We believe Portugal have already all the respect and admiration of all countries and Eurofans in Europe and rest of the World. We can prove that together we have the power to change the things, even to change RTP directors' mind and present, at least, a temporary application to European Broadcasters Union (EBU) to participate at Eurovision Song Contest.

It is a shame that Portugal participates in the contest for more than 50 years and never won, or even made a TOP5. We still believe that it is possible to win the contest, or, at least, to get a great result and make all the 15-million portuguese and lusodescendents proud of being part of a great country called Portugal.

Risks & Challenges

This is not only a song contest. It's the stage where we can share our origin, our culture, our beliefs, our strengths in a 3-minute song. But, at the same time, there's some risks, like failing the qualification to the finals, or even finishing last in the semi-finals. But, at least, our mission is to make it possible to see our country, and having those goosebumps every time we see Portugal in the stage being represented by an outstanding artist, year after year.

Other Ways You Can Help

We will understand if you can't afford and help us in our crowdfunding, but you can still help us. Share our campaign on social networks, or on your site or personal blog. Just don't forget our hashtag #letsmakehistoryforPortugal everytime you share.

Thank you for your attention and all support given to our project.

Claudio Poiares Rodrigues

story:
BEN IS A RISING ARTIST IN THE DREAM POP/ALTERNATIVE MUSIC SCENE.

Funds will go towards production costs, touring costs, and will make it possible to make this dream a reality. There are many ways to contribute and any amount is appreciated. Donating towards the EP will automatically put your name into the booklet. Thank you for your support!


LISTEN TO THE NEW SINGLE INSOMNIA HERE:

WATCH THE MUSIC VIDEO: 

WHO I AM

When I was a young boy growing up outside of Atlanta in a town called Carrollton, which not too many people outside of it have heard of, I knew I wanted to be a musician - an artist. I would put on little shows around the house, hanging up posters on the wall, and I would sing along to my favorite songs and even would start writing my own when I was only in first grade. I remember carrying around a notepad and just writing down every thought that went into my head. Not much today has changed for me since then. I am currently in school and finding the finances to produce this record, while taking copious hours, working a job, and studio time, is difficult. However, I am determined and I am passionate. I know that this is exactly what I need to be doing -creating music to share with the world.

WHAT THIS MEANS TO ME

Being able to share my music with the world is the only reason I get up in the morning. Furthermore, MUSIC is the only reason I get up in the morning. Having the ability to change someone's life and be there friend firstly through the songs I write, is so amazing to me. I know that even though I have never met some of my favorite artists, theres still this undefined connection that is between us. I have already began to create relationships with people I had never met before through my music and I plan to continue that.

MY GOAL

I want to help people realize that they aren't alone. I want to show that, even though I am a pop musician who happens to be a guy, that it is okay to bare your soul and show your emotions. Being vulnerable does not need to equal embarrassment.  Being vulnerable  is one of the most beautiful things about being human. 

Music has a way of making that vulnerability even more beautiful.


Every single dollar helps. Really. If all you can give is a few bucks, it is still as appreciated as anything else. I cannot wait to share what I have been working on with everyone. I am hopeful. I am joyful. Most importantly, I am blessed to get to do what I love to do. So, thank you in advanced.

Let's get this thing produced together!

-B

WATCH THE MUSIC VIDEO: WHO I AM
When I was a young boy growing up outside of Atlanta in a town called Carrollton, which not too many people outside of it have heard of, I knew I wanted to be a musician - an artist. I would put on little shows around the house, hanging up posters on the wall, and I would sing along to my favorite songs and even would start writing my own when I was only in first grade. I remember carrying around a notepad and just writing down every thought that went into my head. Not much today has changed for me since then. I am currently in school and finding the finances to produce this record, while taking copious hours, working a job, and studio time, is difficult. However, I am determined and I am passionate. I know that this is exactly what I need to be doing -creating music to share with the world.WHAT THIS MEANS TO MEBeing able to share my music with the world is the only reason I get up in the morning. Furthermore, MUSIC is the only reason I get up in the morning. Having the ability to change someone's life and be there friend firstly through the songs I write, is so amazing to me. I know that even though I have never met some of my favorite artists, theres still this undefined connection that is between us. I have already began to create relationships with people I had never met before through my music and I plan to continue that.MY GOAL

I want to help people realize that they aren't alone. I want to show that, even though I am a pop musician who happens to be a guy, that it is okay to bare your soul and show your emotions. Being vulnerable does not need to equal embarrassment.  Being vulnerable  is one of the most beautiful things about being human. Music has a way of making that vulnerability even more beautiful.Every single dollar helps. Really. If all you can give is a few bucks, it is still as appreciated as anything else. I cannot wait to share what I have been working on with everyone. I am hopeful. I am joyful. Most importantly, I am blessed to get to do what I love to do. So, thank you in advanced.Let's get this thing produced together!-B

story:
The Westminster Chamber Singers are touring France in May 2016. The choir will be singing in cathedrals, churches, and concert halls and performing in some of the most historic locations in France, including: Eglise de la Madeleine, Notre Dame, and Chapelle des Penitents. 

In addition to performing we will have the opportunity to experience and learn about French culture. We will balance the intense performing schedule with daily sight-seeing trips to museums and other historic sites. One of the goals we hope to achieve is to gain a deeper appreciation for the challenges of performing while traveling; an experience we cannot get in a classroom! We also hope to return from the tour with a broader view of the world and deeper appreciation for our own country.

Dr. Christopher Quinn, Director of the Chamber Singers, has been touring with the choir since 2000. The choir has brought their music to audiences in China, England, France, Scotland, Ireland, and throughout the United States. Audiences rave about the choir’s expressive singing and continually ask the choir back for return engagements. He is very excited to return to France to share a world-class experience with his students.

  Your donations will go directly into the Choir's Tour Fund, reducing the cost for all students. For this reason we have set an ambitious fundraising goal of $25,000 in just under 60 days! You can help by making a donation and/or by forwarding our message along to your friends and family. We also would love to see you at our concerts this year!

story:
The Jacksonville Songwriter Residency with the Stetson Kennedy Foundation in partnership with St. Johns County Parks Dept. and Florida Communities Trust aim to activate a vital part of Northeast Florida's Cultural history, and a landmark of national significance, to create a Songwriter Residency at Beluthahatchee Park. 

The site has been designated a National Literary Landmark twice, the only such location in the U.S. to be so designated, once for Stetson Kennedy’s body of work, and also for legendary songwriter Woody Guthrie where he wrote over 80 songs including the song “Stetson Kennedy” and the manuscript for “Seeds of Man.” 

Stetson Kennedy’s vision was for this site to become a place for artists, musicians, and writers to gather to practice their craft and create. It is awe inspiring for us to continue his great legacy on the verge of his centennial. When a songwriter writes a song it is intrinsically tied to that place forever. The song then travels the world through the songwriter, and becomes part of our global culture.  This project has been approved by the Stetson Kennedy Foundation and would highlight St. Johns County innovative support for the Arts and Beluthahatchee as a national place where songs are actively written building upon its profound cultural legacy.

  In the first year (2016) we will host 4 professional songwriters for 1-2 weeks. They will be free to live and write in this beautiful inspiring location. They will perform at least one showcase in the area and will donate handwritten lyrics to the Stetson Kennedy Foundation and Museum. Housing is provided on site at no cost to the songwriter and we hope to provide a travel stipend and a paid public showcase. 
Please contact me if you wish to partner with this inspiring project!
Thank You,
Brad Lauretti
Founder of the Jacksonville Songwriter Residency
